Reviews.Title: “Loden Hotel Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Art6161
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden for the first time and loved it. Quiet, good room and price for down town Vancouver. Plus the people were terrific. Very friendly, helpful, and efficient. Didn't try the breakfast, but had lunch at the restaurant which was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver at its best”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: I booked at The Loden at the last minute, during the weekend of the Sun Run (a 50-thousand person 10K through the heart of the city) and a big teacher's convention. To my great good fortune, there really wasn't any place else to stay...which is to say that the average nightly rate wasn't cheap. But it was worth it. The Loden is, for me anyway, perfectly located: You can easily walk just about anywhere you want to be in Vancouver. BC Place, Gastown, all the downtown restaurants. And it's quiet. My room was on the 10th floor and was utterly silent. The rooms are elegant and modern, the staff is warm but not cloying. Tableau, the very-French bistro connected to the hotel serves good food and even better cocktails. I was there for a mixed business/pleasure visit and I'd certainly stay there again, either for business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but could be great if the breakfast is sorted out!”
Reviews.Author: Tim F
Reviews.Content: Very stylish boutique city hotel in an excellent location. Rooms are excellent (if not that large even though we took the larger rooms) and the staff knowledgeable, helpful, friendly and an asset to any stay. We stayed for one night and then returned for two more after spending some days in Whistler and received a warm welcome back with some thoughtful touches in the room to acknowledge we had returned. All such things lead toward this being one of the best city hotels anywhere however the overall impression of quality and style is a little let down by the breakfast experience which is inconsistent with the rest of the hotel. Our room booking entitled us to a continental breakfast which was a small bar top buffet in the restaurant annexed which was a little meagre even after making allowance for the fact that this is a smaller hotel so the type of offering seen in large hotels cannot be expected. There is a breakfast menu that can be taken but that was not in fact mentioned to us and upon looking at it it did not really inspire in any event. It rather felt as though the restaurant was not really there to provide breakfast and the whole thing was a bit of an afterthought while the staff got the place ready for the real business of the day to come; small things irritated such as coffee other than the low quality type provided in a plunger flask on the bar top was an extra and one glass of juice only was provided etc which is just that bit too mean to leave the impression the rest of the hotel is clearing seeking to achieve and is inconsistent with that being provided by other hotels so they really should pay attention to this (I see that others have taken a similar impression). Another, albeit smaller, issue is that charging for internet access in the room is just not the market standard anymore (I travel a lot on business) and any hotel, like the Loden, that does charge an hourly or daily rate in the room for such access is out of step especially if it markets itself as a business friendly place. So, yes, we will go back to the Loden because it is very good but wish it would take the time to bring its food offering up to the standard of the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: Marissa B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loden for the first time, booked by my Company, and was extremely impressed! The staff is polite and professional, the rooms are very clean and spacious, and the food off the in-room dining menu was delicious and very well priced. I especially enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast every morning. The shower had great water pressure with lots of hot water and the tub was a true soaker tub, great at the end of a long day of work! My only complaint, though small, was that the room did not come with a coffee maker. Sad but true, I need caffeine first thing in the morning! Otherwise, a true pleasure to stay at and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: Newfukie2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I planned a weekend getaway to Vancouver (we're from Calgary) in April, and chose the Loden for its location and reviews. Yes, it was a bit more pricey than some of the options, but there was value in it. The location was ideal: easy walk to the sea wall, Stanley Park and great restaurants. The service was fantastic, with personalized touches like a welcome note and our names on the TV menu screen that made the difference. It felt safe, secure, clean and welcoming. We were upgraded to a King room with floor to ceiling windows on two sides, and enjoyed looking out the window from bed, and enjoying the sunshine. Great bathrooms with big tubs perfect for soaking your tired legs after a day of walking. The only challenges that you should be aware of is the limited breakfast menu and the price of that breakfast menu. It averaged $20 per person for breakfast, so I do recommend you purchase a package that includes breakfast vouchers (we did). My fiance managed with the continental breakfast, but he definitely would have enjoyed more selection of meat products. I overheard a few other men comment on it being a scant breakfast. Selection was fantastic for a Continental breakfast, but not for it being the only option available. Oh, and if you order toast for room service, know that the staff make it from the Continental buffet and just bring it up to your room with an added charge. Otherwise, over all a great stay with lots of benefits. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an upscale, comfortable, personalized stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: sherkston
Reviews.Content: We live on Vancouver Island and about once every 2 months, we're in Vancouver. We've stayed at this property from the time it has opened (it replaced our choice of staying at the Four Seasons). For a variety of reasons, we haven't stayed at The Loden for over a year (namely because we've stayed at friend's and had no need for hotel arrangements). We had to attend a meeting earlier this month and decided to come in the night before - our first choice ... The Loden. When we approached the check in desk, before the young lady had a chance to get our names/information, a gentleman walks out from the back office, looks at me and says "Mrs. ----, how nice to see you back - we haven't seen you in awhile". Again, remember, we haven't been to this property in over a year - talk about an impressive welcome ! From there, the service and hotel offerings were at par to what we've come to expect. Cheers to mgmt and team at The Loden ! The other reason I love this hotel - if you like to walk - this hotel is a great location. It's relatively close to Stanley Park - which is one of the most beautiful walks to take (and I've walked alot of cities worldwide - this is tops). It's also very convenient to shopping and restaurants. One last irrelevant but fun little tidbit - on our recent stay, when we left and returned from dinner, we walked through the reception/premier night for Real Housewives of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover532
Reviews.Content: We knew this hotel was gonna be more expensive but we were not expecting 4 different taxes on top of the regular hotel price. There was a hotel tax, Vancouver tax, olypocs tax ( from the last Olympics!) And parking tax. The staff was friendly and helpful but everything was very over priced! Beware of the taxes and hidden fees!!!

Reviews.Title: “A tucked away small paradise”
Reviews.Author: Leila F
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to stay at the Loden as a small trea for ourselves - a getaway from home, in our home town! And it didn't disapoint. The staff are well mannered and friendly. The place is welcoming and very clean. The room sare super high tech and very spacious. The bed is divine - as are the sheets and pillows - best bed I've ever stayed in I think! There is a lot of light - and despite having many buildings all around the hotel you don't feel like you're squashed against someone else's window. the bathroom is spacious and well designed - with the exception of the shower, where the caulking to the door doesn't seal properly and so you may end up with a bit of a pond!!! The shampoo/conditioner and lotion goodies are heavenly - Molton Brown. Simply the best. Another small issue we had was no hot water when we came home late at night - but the staff was very accomodating in providing us a kettle for filling the tub! We waited for (albeit quite) a while and it sorted itself out. There is an excellent selection of snacks should you feel tempted - and the restaurant at the bottom of the hotel is said to have won several awards. Even if you decide to eat somewhere else you won't have to walk far. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great staff”
Reviews.Author: TutuNeneHonolulu
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderrful stay at the Loden in February, 2012. From beginning to end everyone was gracious and helpful. The room was beautifully appointed (wonderful sheets!) and the partial water view was exactly that - the lower half of the view out the window was of a building but the upper half of the view was water, sky, boats and beautiful. I would definitely recommend this hotel - the location, one very short block from Pike Place Market in one direction, a short walk to the sky train and downtown shops in the other - is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden for a few weeks. Every day the staff at the desk both morning and evening were so cheerful but not intrusive. They could not do enough to help. The standard of the accommodation was excellent and as someone who has stayed in a number of hotels this is by far the best. The quality of the accommodation and the accessories were second to none. The restaurant prices are very competitive for the area but the quality and service outshone the others.We are so pleased that lots of others have given such good reviews as it is a testament to how excellent it is. Would we go back - definitely - and can't wait. To the staff, management and owners - we can't thank you enough.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend away”
Reviews.Author: IMT_2012
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Loden Hotel. it was recommended to us by friends and it did not disappoint. it was quaint - very funky rooms, super comfortable beds and close to almost everything we wanted to do. We had drinks in their lounge which was very nice - live music which was a nice touch. We were there on a Saturday night and were very glad we made reservations (4 of us) for the lounge - it was packed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Sarah (front desk) helped us make reservations (lounge and restaurant). In fact she went out of her way to make sure the planner of this event had all the information needed to make the evening perfect!!! Dave (valet) was great. He was the first and last person we saw at the hotel - very personable and friendly. They have the perfect person greeting guests as they arrive. We were able to get the hotel car to drive us to dinner which was a nice perk Very glad we chose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: AlexBou
Reviews.Content: The Loden is quite the quirky boutique hotel in Vancouver. Rooms are exquisite and service is impeccable. Had a short stay but would gladly come back if I happen to be back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “a 60th bday to remember”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to stay in the Halo Penthouse at the Loden Hotel, thus experiencing the luxury of the accommodations, as well as the professionalism of the staff. The room was exquisite and exceeded our expectations. The Staff is very warm and always there to aid in any questions you might have. Tableau restaurant is also a must, as the french cuisine is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A great hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: CavendishBurlington
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler and former Vancouverite I was pleasantly surprised to discover The Loden last fall. This was my second stay. It's a wonderful hotel, with well appointed rooms, a nice lounge/restaurant, good gym with great equipment and most importantly great staff. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Casey G
Reviews.Content: I came to Vancouver for a convention, and I found the Loden to be very convenient to the convention center. I liked that it was on a quiet street and preferred it to the very large hotels directly by the convention center. The entire staff was pleasant, courteous, and accommodating. I used the complimentary car service for a quick trip into downtown when it was raining and the driver, Sean, was very friendly and gave recommendations for things to do during my stay. The bed was incredibly comfortable (I was sorry to leave it) and the pillows were heavenly. The bath robe was the softest I have come across in a hotel (though it was quite oversized). I had no trouble with the sink splashing or the shower leaking that others have mentioned. When our toilet stopped working, it was fixed immediately (less than 10 minutes), and when we ran out of coffee capsules for our Nespresso machine one morning, they were brought up to us right away. I could definitely tell the difference in service of this small hotel compared to the very large ones. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A convienent, friendly hotel with beautiful furnishings”
Reviews.Author: Joewashington
Reviews.Content: Located in downtown on a relatively quiet street the Loden is only a few blocks from the convention center & harbour and one block from 3 coffee shops. Beautifully designed rooms that differ from the usual hotel set-up are supplemented with turndown & shoe service and a very friendly staff. Quiet lobby in contrast to the convention hotels nearby has a great pod expresso machine that almost makes up for not having it in the room. I would head here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: JP_SEA
Reviews.Content: Over the years we've stayed at many really nice hotels in Vancouver - Fairmont; Sheraton Wall Center; Grand Westin; Westin Bayshore; The Metropolitan; Sutton Place; Hyatt; and Le Soleli - and while there are a lot of great hotels we haven't tried yet, The Loden stands above the rest. When we arrived (around 2 PM) our room wasn't ready but the staff was very helpful and stored our bag, and valet parked our car ahead of check-in. It wasn't a big deal since the hotel is just two blocks walk from Robson Street and Pacific Centre. And when the room was ready we got a call from the hotel letting us know that we can get our keys anytime - its always nice when someone actually takes time to make a call. To our surprise we had been upgraded to a suite that was bigger than many apartments. The room was really well designed, was super comfortable and had some amenities that we weren't expecting - a Wii with Rockband (yes, we had a two person rockband going for a while in our VAN bedroom) and a Nespresso machine. The room and the hotel is very quite (you don't really feel like your in the center of town) but its also very convenient. The restaurant/bar next door (Tableau) was pretty lively which was great since many hotel bars/restaurants seem to be so stuffy. Drinks were good and the breakfast the next morning was light yet delicious. All in all, the Loden is our new favorite hotel in Vancouver and we look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay at The Loden”
Reviews.Author: Teresa R
Reviews.Content: The Loden was in a wonderful location in the beautiful city of Vancouver. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms were very comfortable and the staff was exceptional. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations”
Reviews.Author: FRANCOIS A
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay(too short). Perfect welcome, very nice room and bathroom. Well located and quiet. To be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JohnDanielK
Reviews.Content: Great location. Corner rooms worth it. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a hotel we will go back to...”
Reviews.Author: Barb S
Reviews.Content: Our friends rented the penthouse for a birthday celebration so thought it would only make sense to stay at the hotel for the night. The room was great, it's close to everything but away from the hustle and bustle. Although we didn't eat in the restaurant, we did enjoy the food that was served at the party. When I want to be a tourist in my own town, I will definitely stay at The Loden again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha G
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vancouver! It is my favorite hotel in all of Canada! Rooms are gorgeous... bathrooms are STUNNING! Staff is unbelievable personable, helpful, kind and sweet! :) 10/10 for sure. Samantha Gordon Montreal, Quebec

Reviews.Title: “Excellent... as long as you avoid room service!”
Reviews.Author: Hospo_Will
Reviews.Content: had a really great stay at the Loden, the staff are professional, polite and friendly. We were assisted by the Australian sounding concierge to help plan our skiing outing. Room service needs to be avoided. given that the hotel has a fantastic restaurant next door, we were shocked at the quality of the late night menu. despite this, we still had a good visit. make sure you eat at Tableu. A bit of a walk to the main hussle and bussle of the city. not much happening in the area after hours

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service at a price that can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Kim M
Reviews.Content: Last time we stayed downtown we were less than satisfied with our stay at a larger chain hotel so we decided to check out TripAdvisor for someplace new and decided on the Loden. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. We loved the quiet neighbourhood while still be central to everything. The front desk staff and the valet staff were really friendly and helpful. We stayed in a park vista room which was gorgeous. We loved the decor and everything was super clean. We had the bed & breakfast package which included the room, valet parking, breakfast and a late checkout. I've never had more bang for my buck staying in the city. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Glad the Hyatt was booked...”
Reviews.Author: 21plasticstars
Reviews.Content: I always hesitate to read the reviews that give anything a perfect score because I feel like it was possibly written by some overly exuberant person and I will be terribly disappointed by taking their advice. So at the risk that some idiots who think like me won't read this, I still have to give The Loden 5 trip advisor circle things. We were greeted by The Loden's friendly staff before we even got all our bags out of the taxi. I wish I could remember his name, but people from Hawaii tend to get distracted by things like 0 degree C weather. Anyway, he gave us some great restaurant recommendations and even offered to drive us to a sushi restaurant in The Loden car. The front desk staff were always welcoming upon our return to the hotel and one even printed out info on snowboarding locations for us. The room had a great tub that we used to defrost ourselves and the turn down service was a nice touch. The Loden is also in a great location. We were able to easily walk to Stanley park, Robson street, museums and restaurants. I would most definitely stay here again…perhaps in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lodes”
Reviews.Author: Boliver_12
Reviews.Content: What a delight. Great design, great service, great location and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: BmoreFun
Reviews.Content: We came to Vancouver for some business meetings with some free time sprinkled in. The Loden is in a great location with lovely and well appointed rooms. The adjoining cafe has a nice breakfast and is a good place to enjoy a drink or dinner. The staff helped us enjoy a beautiful day by outfitting us with bikes and advice for a short afternoon ride. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: H R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Loden a few nights while on business. Nicely appointed, quiet, and very comfortable room. The staff was friendly, courtious, and helpful. All in all, a great place to stay while in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bertha C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Loden last year and having had such a wonderful experience decided to stay there again. I did take the time to research other properties nearby and saw no reason to venture any further. Great competative rates, first class service and good location. Since we were returning guests we were surprised with a small treat to thank us for coming back. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Loden Hotel, Vancouver BC”
Reviews.Author: pholman
Reviews.Content: As in past visits, everything about this hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: JimKM
Reviews.Content: The Loden is a great boutique hotel, nice rooms, fantastic restaurant "Tableau". The staff were very friendly and accommodating

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Heart of the Action”
Reviews.Author: painDOC1
Reviews.Content: The Loden Hotel is a relatively new boutique hotel strategically situated in downtown Vancouver. There was a mixup with our reservations because we had changed our arrival day and the computer was having trouble adjusting to the extra February date [Leap Year]. Despite this, the concierge bent over backwards to accommodate us, and we were soon ensconced in a lovely room on the top floor, with a nice view of the harbour. The room was lovely, with two queen beds. Unfortunately, this didn't leave room for a reading lamp on my side of the bed. The absence of an in-room coffee maker was also an inconvenience, although coffee is served in the hotel lobby. The front desk staff were very friendly and the ambiance is lovely. The restaurant/bar is bright and modern, and the breakfast buffet is good, if somewhat limited in hot food choices. Valet parking was very expensive at $47.00 a day after taxes were added on. We arrived after dark and didn't realize that there were two public parking garages next to the hotel. These minor annoyances aside, it's a lovely little hotel with first class service and I would highly recommend it for your next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: taffyyyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed a saturday night at the Loden. checkin- without a hitch, very comfortable room, and whilst we went out the room was prepared for sleep. Service was without reproach excellent. We decided to stay for dinner at the restaurant. It has a good wine list, a very bistro type atmosphere, and the food was excellent. I had the steak frites, steak done rare as requested. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “quite and central”
Reviews.Author: joost m
Reviews.Content: hotel was in excelent condition, rooms were in perfect condition. great service that they provide free taxi's for downtown service! staff was professional, nothing to add on that. fitness room is more than suffiecent. it's worth your money staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel Superb People”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas R
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights here and had a wonderful time. Truly good service, great rooms, excellent housekeeping. Nothing was an issue and help was always at hand. As a first time visitor on a fairly tight schedule the staff front of house were always happy to help, recommend or discuss anything. All done with friendly smile and a genuine desire to make you, their customer, happy. Le Tableau and all staff were also fantastic. The place gets packed as it is one of the new hip places in town. Daryll is a trip and shakes a mean cocktail as do the rest of the team. It may be small and it may not have a view as per other braqnded hotels but to me that is the point. They are very understated, quiet, do not blow their own trumpet but if you are lucky enough to find this hotel and get a room I am able to say you will think long and hard about going elsewhere n your next visit. This is service and pride and attention to detail at a discreet level and at the end of the day simply a great jem in Vc. Enjoy if you getthe chance. I know I will be back many times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Tatyana M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The room was simply perfect, loved the Molton Brown products, and the turndown service. The only disappointments were the very limited in-room dining options, the breakfast (best to check out the cafes around the area), and the expensive internet (boutique hotels need to do away with that, once and for all!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Very good staff”
Reviews.Author: livetotravelcdn
Reviews.Content: I've reviewed this hotel before, but I stay there fairly often so I thought a second review was worthwhile. It has comfy beds, exceptional staff, nice modern rooms, and the car service is a nice touch. If you have to travel around town ask to book their driver and car, which is a London style taxicab. It's very distinctive, and you get more looks than the Aston Martins as they drive you to your destination. Only one downside to this hotel, and that's the bathroom. It looks fantastic with it's brown marble flooring and white fixtures. However, it's almost impossible to run water in the sink without having it splash on you, and the shower leaks like crazy - I notice that they had installed a new piece of trim on the edge of the shower door, but it doesn't seem to work. No worries, just make sure that you place a towel outside the shower door to avoid stepping into a very large puddle when you get out. Overall, I still recommend this hotel, despite the unfortunate bathroom problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lacks a view.”
Reviews.Author: Emilia Y
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for Valentine's Day and we were very pleased with our stay here. The room was comfortable with big windows and the bathroom was to die for! We stayed in a King Corner room. When we arrived the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. For Valentine's day they had these shortbread heart cookies with red sprinkles and they were a very nice touch. So crisp and yummy! We had requested a higher floor, which was granted upon our arrival. The lobby was very stylish and modern. Arriving in our room, it was very clean and bright. The bed was very big and comfortable and there was a big flat screen that was suspended from the ceiling. It was a very nice touch that we turned in on, the home screen had a greeting and displayed our names. There was also a big desk in the room if you had to write or work. The bathroom was very large with a deep soaker tub, standing shower, and a separate little room inside it for the toilet. The tub was big enough for two to sit and relax comfortably with a glass of wine. We brought our own wine (from the BC liquor store up the street) and called about where the ice machine was and they sent someone upstairs with a bag of ice for us and they arrived very quickly. We came and went from the hotel several times and the staff were always pleasant and greeted us. The only thing this hotel was lacking was a view. It is shorter than the other buildings around it so all there was to really see was the street below and into the living rooms of the neighbors. There were little peeks of the harbour between a few buildings though but paying for the higher floor upgrade, I didn't feel was worth it. Overall, I felt this was the best hotel we have stayed in out of several in the downtown area and we would definitely return for another romantic getaway or special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Noonzio1977
Reviews.Content: Hotel is lovely - nice comfortable, spacious rooms, with lovely beds and a great bathroom. The restaurant attached is average at best, and the breakfast is very disappointing . . but there are plenty of places nearby to get breakfast. The complimentary valet parking which comes with the 'Bed & Breakfast' package is worth it as there seems to be no free parking around the area of the hotel (even on Sunday's). Were I going back to Vancouver again I would definitely stay in the Loden

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: maxBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October 2011 and loved it. Location was great, easy to walk everywhere. This is a beautiful hotel and it is beautifully maintained. Very clean and very modern. Perfectly clean bathroom and the bed and linen were gorgeous. The staff at this hotel have to be commended, they are wonderfull. Very professional and friendly and nothing is a bother. Outstaning service. Special mention for Sarah Bugenhagen (Concierge) who made our trip. She effortlessly arranged anything we asked and is a asset to the hotel. The hotel's bar and restaurant are excellent. I recommend dining there, the food was unreal and the service exceptional. I thoroughly recommend staying at The Loden, it will be my first and only choice when I return to Vancouver. It's not offen you stay at a hotel and leave truely happy!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great experience. Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Winelady68
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room! Great amenities! Only things missing were a hair dryer and an in room coffee machine. Otherwise an awesome experience. Tableau was great as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great pet friendly location right downtown!”
Reviews.Author: popic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a pet friendly place to stay for a weekend in Vancouver. Found the Loden online - we were surprised at it's unassuming location. We've driven by it many times but didn't notice it before. Front desk staff were top-notch. Having our dog in the room was also not an issue - opened the door to find a dog bed, food, and water dishes ready. Valet service parking was very quick, the car was pulling up once we got down to the lobby after just calling to say we were checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away”
Reviews.Author: zanellos
Reviews.Content: The Loden provided a great getaway right in our own backyard. My husband and I hada great time having some time together to celebrate his birthday. The room, spa treatments and dinner were all wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Luxury in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: lepage99
Reviews.Content: This little hotel in the middle of Vancouver was such a pleasant experience for me. It was conveniently located within walking distance of some great parts of Vancouver and the quality of the hotel was outstanding. The rooms were a good size, with a large bathroom and extremely comfortable bed. The service and friendliness of the staff was excellent as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and modern, but one weird thing”
Reviews.Author: vancouverchu
Reviews.Content: Spent a great night in a well-appointed corner room with excellent connections for tech gear. A bit disppointed that this type of room did not have a Nespresso machine. The weird thing was the hairdryer provided had a cord of about one foot, making it essentially useless!

Reviews.Title: “terrific hotel with personalized service”
Reviews.Author: DL752
Reviews.Content: hidden gem downtown vancouver- stylish, hip and cool vibe,,,,great service, french bistro was a great way to start the evening,,,,,we didn't want to leave. rooms are very spacious and modern, made us want to redecorate our house.....

Reviews.Title: “Romance Central”
Reviews.Author: Lyle T
Reviews.Content: I booked a Valentines surprise with the Loden and it was amazing. I had pre-arranged flowers to be in the room when we checked in, a massage in their spa room, dinner at Tableau downstairs, and even a drawn bath with candles and champagne. Everything was done seamlessly without a hitch. Each surprise was executed perfectly. I was especially thrilled because I was able to fully enjoy the romantic evening I had planned, rather then worrying about the plans itself. The staff went above and beyond. At dinner they gave complimentary roses, and strawberries for Valentines day, and really made the whole evening feel extra luxurious. I work as a travel agent, and I will be recommending the Loden to all my clients and friends.

Reviews.Title: “So So Chic”
Reviews.Author: loulouL.A.
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is top notch--FAntastic sheets and comfortable beds, the coolest bathrooms, staff that makes you feel like a member of the Royal Family--And they have a fabulous, if tiny, kitchen that does room service Right. Nice touch--when we picked up our car from the valet, he had thoughtfully placed in our console two bottles of water for our drive--NICE. Did I mention the super yummy breakfasts? Dig this place. At around $200 a night (this included overnight parking-VALET service--free wifi and breakfast for two) seemed a great deal for such a stylish and excellent location. Yes, you can walk to everything from here.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and glamour in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: mtl-wasa
Reviews.Content: Very nice, chic and glamourous boutique hotel conveniently located in downtown Vancouver. The rooms are big, comfortable and impressively modern.

Reviews.Title: “They know how to treat people”
Reviews.Author: road_stu
Reviews.Content: The room, staff and wine were excellent. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to friends or clients.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: I loved this beautiful "Boutique" Hotel the moment I walked in. Friendly staff, very helpful, and guest services are top notch. I really enjoyed the location and trendiness of this hotel. I also enjoyed the Tableau Bar Bistro restaurant in the Hotel. The tuna salad (Niçoise) is equisit! Friendly ambiance. I would go back (to this "home away from home") in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Night”
Reviews.Author: Samantha4224
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful evening staying at the Loden. It's downtown location was so convenient to all the activities that I had planned for my stay. The staff was very courteous and made a country girl like me feel like a city girl for the night. The room was gorgeous and tasteful. Even the bathroom felt luxurious. Would recommend to my family and friends that if you need a place to stay downtown The Loden is the place to be!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: First off, I love the location... it's downtown, but kind of on the edge so you're close enough to the shopping, restaurants, and bars without having to hear about it all night while you're trying sleep. The decor is modern/contemporary, which I liked. Rooms were clean (very clean) and there are nice touches that I appreciated such as the glass of water that I'd find on the nightstand when I got "home" for the evening and the nice inspirational/motivational quotes that accompanied two chocolates. Staff was very friendly and the restaurant downstairs served really good food and the bar was fully stocked with the best liquor you could ask for. You also won't find a nicer workout facility at a hotel: top-notch cardio and and weight training equipment with yoga too if you like. Overall, I'm definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, classy, upscale and friendly”
Reviews.Author: suzy_cdn
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Right downtown, you can walk anywhere. The staff are friendly, and helpful. Every time I am there I feel comfortable, at home and relaxed. This hotel is classy, and upscale every detail is thought of.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for bday”
Reviews.Author: lilysisi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for celebration of my gf's bday.We actually live in vancouver so we hvnt got a chance to compare.but im pretty sure that this is our first choice if we gonna live out again.hotel is modern,location is great,the facilities is beautiful,service is awesome.the bed like duvet is very comfortable. thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Loden Vancouver - A fantastic surprise in a city of great hotels”
Reviews.Author: OneTrueMan
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal on business, and have recently found myself in Vancouver regularly. Over the past four trips, I've stayed in four different top-ranked hotels. After my visit to the Loden, I need experiment no longer. Wonderful welcome, superb room, informative and helpful staff, the best gym I've ever seen in a hotel, etc. etc. My compliments fall short of the experience. Count me in for a repeat visit!

Reviews.Title: “best Vancouver hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgale_10
Reviews.Content: This was probably my 7th or 8th stay at the Loden. It is now the hotel we always use for business when in Vancouver and it has become my standard for family trips too. The beds are very comfy, it is quiet, lovely and well-located. The bathrooms are gorgeous, with a big tub being the highlight. The restaurant is excellent, with the one exception being breakfast. I typically go to the Urban Fare around the corner for breakfast. If I am going to pay $20 for breakfast I like to be able to get hot food prepared fresh for me and it should include a latte (that is pretty typical for hotels though to only have a continental breakfast and for it to be pricey). The gym is very well-appointed and typically has nobody in it. Lots of good walks by the ocean and Stanley Park in close proximity. Also, close to many restaurant choices and shopping so great location. Staff are always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A holiday from my holiday”
Reviews.Author: NeedVacation64
Reviews.Content: The stress and frenzy of the Christmas holiday over...we were looking for a total break from the holiday hoo-haw and that is exactly what we got when we booked a couple of nights in a Loden Suite. I'm actually from Vancouver so I'm up on what's available and if you want boutique hotel styling that is close enough to all the downtown attractions but far enough away so that the Entertainment District doesn't "entertain" you into the wee hours of the morning the Loden is it. Everything you need for a comfy zone out plus a great restaurant (Le Tableau bistro). Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “It's official - this is my favourite hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: jaardi
Reviews.Content: I visited Vancouver again this past Christmas (2011) and had the opportunity to stay at The Loden - and again, I was impressed. The front desk staff are helpful, friendly and efficient. It's on a bit of a sidestreet, though very conveniently located, so it's quite quiet. The rooms are very comfortable - the king-size bed with nice down pillows and a wonderful duvet. I was in a corner room and had windows on 2 sides - peek-a-boo views of the harbour and North Shore. The bathroom is a thing of beauty; full-size bath and separate shower and toilet. I love the Molton Brown amenities - if you've never tried their Warming Eucalyptus shower gel, you have no idea what you're missing! :-) I believe they've made some changes to the restaurant - though I'd not eaten there before. Breakfast was included in my rate, so I ate there each morning. The buffet is set up across the bar and seems to have everything you'd want (in a continental style - toast, pastries, juice and coffee and I think they were doing some sort of wrap for a hot breakfast). I enjoyed staying at the Loden and look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: imalwayspacked
Reviews.Content: The Loden is gorgeous. Unique, small, just seconds from the water and a short, beautiful walk to Stanley Park. The rooms are well designed, and they've thought of everything.... Yoga mat, epson salts, newspaper... All the little touches that make your stay remarkable rather than ordinary. I've notice more and more hotels cut back on these little things. I liked the upgrade concept, it's quirky and it worked. The corner rooms are lovely. Only thing I'd change... The water. Fiji water is not pc. For us antipodeans Fiji is not a democracy. You wouldn't stock Zimbabwean water....and besides, with all those gorgeous BC mountains, surely you can find one closer to home. Thank you for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: oldbug55
Reviews.Content: We wanted a romantic night "in town" and picked the Lodan because it seemed to offer an upscale hotel at a fair price. Our expectations were met and exceeded. The service was top notch - anything we asked for appeared (ice, champagne glasses, a newspaper) instantly. The room was warm and elegant - tasteful without being ostentatious, the bathroom was like a spa, the bed was luxurious. We didn't eat in the restaurant (forgot to make a reservation) but enjoyed a drink at bar later. The free cab service in a London cab was the icing on an altogether perfect evening. Everyone we dealt with - the front desk, room service, the bartender, the cab driver - went out of their way to make our visit enjoyable and easy. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: VatmanUsa
Reviews.Content: The room was outstanding m the staff service excellent, and the hotel is in a great location downtown. I will stay there again next time I am in Vancouver. Paul

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property and service!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon D
Reviews.Content: In the past I have always loved staying at the Loden - but had only done so for pleasure. Recently I had a business trip that required hosting a small number of people in my suite. Not only was the suite immaculate and the configuration perfectly suited for my meeting, but the staff went out of their way to ensure that everything ran smoothly. From arriving at the front desk to an extremely helpful welcome, freshly baked cookies for my guests, facilitating their accessing the floor to meet me, the Loden staff went above and beyond. I usually stay at Fairmont properties for business, but when in Vancouver the Loden will be my first and only choice from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars!”
Reviews.Author: hykwok
Reviews.Content: All in all, this is a upscale boutique hotel that impresses. For the average traveller, I would say this hotel is excellent! I preface my review this way because I noticed many of the guests at the Loden were dressed to the nines and of better means, clearly here for business and luxury. If one is used to the glitz and pampering of a fancier hotel, I can understand a lower rating given the price of this hotel. However for me, this hotel is a 5 star. ROOMS: I stayed in a signature room (the most basic) and I was extremely happy. Right off the bat, you see a contemporary style room - the way I'd imagine a home to look after a trendy designer has been through with it. (Of note, I am not partial to the ornate guilded styles of more traditional hotels.) The rooms have earthy neutral tones, tall ceilings, sliding walls between the bathroom and bedroom, and all the trendiest fixtures (beautiful sinks, geometric taps and knobs, flat screen TV). There was both a soaking tub and a standup shower with hot water and great pressure. We had no problems jumping into bed and resting comfortably after a full busy day. SERVICE: My husband and I were meeting up at the hotel after travelling separately. I paced anxiously for over an hour by the front door. In that time, I watched the doorman warmly greet guests and help them out of taxi, and helpfully answering questions. Likewise were the reception and restaurant staff. Internet was $10-12/day, so we only paid for a day to get all our travel arrangements in order. I was surprised because rarely do hotels not provide internet! LOCATION: Fabulous location, right near the waterfront and 4 blocks north of Robson street (5 min walk, not even). Finding food, shopping and spa treatments was EASY! Note: We are walkers - but we walked to Granville, out to Yaletown and Stanley park with no problem (okay fine, we were a little tired). The Burrard Skytrain station was closeby (5 minutes east), so that is convenient as well. Getting to the airport was also easy. We could have taken Burrard to Granville and switch trains, but we walked directly to the Vancouver City Centre station to get on the Canada Line with our luggage - it took about 15 minutes. I would return to the Loden definitely. It's out of my price range, but I would not hesitate for a special event!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfa162
Reviews.Content: We thought our 10 day stay over Christmas could not have been better. Our room was beautifully furnished and had a spacious modern bathroom. The hotel staff were welcoming, considerate and helpful at all times. We enjoyed the well-equipped exercise room. And, Tableau restaurant, attached to the hotel, provided excellent continental breakfasts and was a convenient location to meet with friends. The hotel was well located for walks along Coal Harbour to Stanley Park, and to Vancouver's downtown. All in all, perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great service, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: LDBD6959
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Vancouver. The room is chic and comfortable. The Tableau restaurant downstairs served a wonderful brunch. A perfect Vancouver experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a really good stay”
Reviews.Author: jamiemaclondon
Reviews.Content: We booked through Tablet and stayed 3 nights at The Loden between Christmas and new year. Hotel is of a very high standard with contemporary, luxurious rooms. Nice cosy bar and public spaces. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. It's a very nice, quiet place to spend some time. It's a little further away than some hotels but only a short (5-10min) walk to the main shopping areas and taxis are readily available and inexpensive. Unfortunately we were disappointed with the quality of the breakfast, which we thought was poor for a hotel of this standard. Choice was very limited and quality mediocre at best. It was included in our deal which is just as well, as I would have been very disappointed if I'd had to pay the $18 or so for it. There are other eateries nearby (Urban Fare on Bute St is very good) that offer much more variety and better quality for less. We didn't eat any other meals at the hotel so can't comment on the quality of the restaurant. Finally, the only other disappointment was the lack of availability of the complimentary car service. I tried twice to book it, with a couple of hours notice, but was told that they didn't had a driver available. Seems a shame to be offered such a perk only to be denied it. Overall though a really nice, quiet, luxury hotel which offered good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but failed to impress”
Reviews.Author: bhsgirl
Reviews.Content: The Loden is lovely, but I didn't find that it lived up to my high standards for accommodation or that it lived up to the high ratings on Trip Advisor. I am accustomed to staying in large hotel chains when I travel for work--predominately Fairmont Hotels. While I have no major complaints about the Loden-- front desk staff were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful, the rooms are small, but nice, bathrooms are spacious and very clean-- I didn't find that they tried to go above and beyond my expectations the way Fairmont always does. For example, I felt it was tacky to charge $15 per 24 hrs of wireless internet...PER DEVICE. We had 2 laptops and an iphone and had to get multiple user codes. To their credit, the Loden staff comped us our second code, because we didn't realize the policy when we bought our first. The room was very dry and went from being too stuffy with the window closed to too cold with the window open. I also wasn't able to sleep thanks to a strange loud clicking noise coming from the wall the entire time we were there. The breakfast was lack-luster but adequate, our dinner was ok, and the wait staff were friendly but somewhat inexperienced, and I didn't appreciate their policy of sitting guests VERY close together, even when the place was empty. Gym was nice, again nothing wow. Next time I think we'll give the Shangri-La a whirl and if that's not up to snuff I'm going back to Fairmont. Again, it takes a lot to impress me, and admittedly this was my first stay in a "boutique" hotel, the hotel is nice and will do in a pinch, but they just didn't win me over.

Reviews.Title: “city chic and total luxury”
Reviews.Author: travelsar0und
Reviews.Content: We stayed on our honemoon in the loden and LOVED it!! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. We were shown to a beautiful large bedroom with a spotless and chic en-suite. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. It is in a great location within walking distance of the waterfront. The hotel has complementary bikes which can be taken by guests for a couple of hours which we did on both days to cycle around the nearby stanley park which has a lovely easy 10Km cycle track around its perimeter. There are seats outside the hotel and it was lovely to have drinks sitting there in the evening. We did eat at the loden and the food was excellent. We had dinner at Joe Fortes restautant which was recommended by the hotel and is only a couple of blocks away, the seafood here is amazing!! The restaurant itself is nothing to look at and is quite informal. I would look forward to staying in the Loden again if we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “The Loden Experience- Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: lusterlove
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you enough about my lovely experience with the Loden and its fabulous staff. The Hotel is beautiful- with its boutique chic style. The staff are charming, and the resturaunt incredible. The rooms were beautiful and cozy. Beds very comfortable. All in all this was the nicest hotel I've ever stayed at. I will most definitley be choosing the Loden again.

Reviews.Title: “A total winner”
Reviews.Author: l_and_r_toronto
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Loden was terrific. As to facilities, the design (both in the public areas and in the room) is extremely well thought out, classy (but not ostentatious) and modern, and everything is beautifully maintained. The room - and we had the least expensive room - is spacious, very pleasant to be in, fully equipped and, again, original and very pleasing in design and execution but not tricky or overpowering. As to the human side, you won't find more personal, involved, truly friendly people who are at the same time knowledgeable and very helpful - and this was consistent among everyone there. The size is great - small enough to avoid a big hotel feel but big enough to provide all services without unusual idiosyncracies - and the location is as convenient as any other downtown hotel. Downsides? - we didn't find any.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: ToilsToTravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove up from Seattle for a 1-night getaway. We booked through the Visa Signature Hotel program, and got a fantastic rate complete with an upgrade, breakfast, parking, and other amenities. We arrived before noon, but were still allowed to check-in. The hotel has cozy, but with an ultramodern boutique feel, and the room was fantastic with floor-to-ceiling windows, comfortable furnishings, and ample storage space. My wife particularly liked the amenities. We had a great day walking around Stanley Park, sampling various Izakayas, and exploring Granville Island. Staying at the Loden made the weekend memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoffreytp
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! It is the right size, the right location, the right design and with the best staff. A group of us came up and styaed for a few days and the hotel did all it could to make the trip great for all. Everyone of the 20+ of us loved this intimate delightful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Nina K
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the quality and size of the room and bathroom. Nice amenities and the curved window in the room was the equivalent of a corner view. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “pcook1980@gmail.com”
Reviews.Author: petercooknola
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel: the rooms were great, the staff was especially helpful and friendly, the hotel was in a great downtown location...The one issue which we had - and which is probably the most easily remedied - was their wi-fi, which guests had to pay for and which was outrageously expensive. The Loden aspires to be a top hotel, but it's tacky to charge for wi-fi access, especially on the order of $24 Canadian Dollars a day.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Break !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra13794
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Loden !! From the time I walked in the door I felt very pampered from the staff. Classy decor throughout the hotel. Did not have a reservation for the Loden - London Cab but the great loden staff where able to acomodate my last minute request. The nightly turn down service was great. The bed was soooo comfortable best night sleep in a long time. The Loden Hotel should be on the #1 spot on the trip advisor. Great gym next visit I will remember to bring my gym clothes! Loved the welcome wine !! Planning my next visit already.

Reviews.Title: “The Loden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onthego617
Reviews.Content: Normally I do not write reviews, but I had to give a shout out to the wonderful staff of The Loden Hotel. It is great hotel with great service. Everyone was very helpful and made us feel at home. The location is central on a quiet street. The hotel is hip but not pretensious. The rooms are comfortable and modern. Great gym facilities. The hotel's restaurant, Le tableu, was an added bonus offering a great ambience and excellent food. The bartenders are true mixologists and it was fun to watch them prepare drinks. Truely a gem. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerhoff
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Loden. The room was clean, the bed was super comfortable and the service was really efficient and friendly. I liked the warm wood paneling in the room and the bathroom was fantastic. My only beef was that the continental breakfast is a bit of a rip off. I had a bowl of oatmeal and that was it because I was in a hurry and it cost me $18. Tip: Eat at the Urban Fare just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Philip Z
Reviews.Content: Loved our hotel room, classy modern decor, and really spacious room, the only downside was that the king size bed was a little firm for my liking, other than that the room was spectacular. The staff was soooooo accommadating you are treated like gold from the moment you walk in till the moment you check out, and even after! i Felt like i had just stayed with good friends, would highly reccommend them to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mr_and_mrs_nibbles
Reviews.Content: We were booked at another hotel a couple of blocks away who had decided to book out all restaurants (acceptable given Christmas) AND Bars so we could not meet our friends for drinks before the start of the evening. Phoned Loden, who held a room so we could work things out and we had an excellent stay, always most helpful. Great room - which was 2/3rds cost and 1/3rd bigger than our original 'name' hotel a block or two away. We have stayed at the Loden a number of times now and should have booked this place 1st time around. The changed their restaurant this year to a Bistro, has a smaller menu and a disappointing breakfast choice (no hot), but other than that, this Hotel is our #1 choice for Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andyfromcanada
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Loden for a night as I was in town for my Masters convocation at UBC. My wife and I have stayed at many downtown Vancouver Hotels, but agree with the excellent reviews for this hotel that it is defiantly one of, if not, the best there is in Vancouver. Check in was simple and fast and they gave us complimentary Internet for the evening (normally about 12 bucks), which was a nice touch. The room had high quality furnishing and a neat layout with the bathroom sliding open to the bedroom. We went for drinks in the downstairs bar, which had free tasters and a good selection. The hotel offers car service in a neat looking vehicle to places downtown. As well some of the rooms have glimpses of the ocean. Look forward to going back. Parking is a bit pricey (35 bucks for valet), so if you don't have to bring a vehicle I recommend that.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Unatrip
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice. Great decoration, professional reception staff, good location. I would improve breakfast attention. Warm people but need more experience.

Reviews.Title: “Our new Favorite Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived I was comfortable and excited about my stay. As a frequent business traveler the details were not lost on me. The workstation in the room was the most comfortable and relaxing one- that I seriously wanted to book another night just to work there instead of flying back to our offices. The rooms are so well designed and inspiring and staff so helpful that its really went beyond a typical business trip- it felt like a mini business vacation. I left feeling relaxed and looking forward to my next visit to Vancouver and won't hesitate booking at the Loden!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: lottedavis
Reviews.Content: We recently booked the Loden for a marketing consultant that came here from the US to present to our Sales and Marketing teams. I had requested a nice room for him, but t the regular rate. As soon as he entered the hotel the staff treated him as though he was the only guest and they'd been waiting for him all day. They said they had a great room for him and indeed, he phone me immediately after he saw it to thank me for the extravagance, he was so please. Throughout his 3 night stay they greeted him by name and made him feel welcome and important. On top of all that, which in itself is unusual, the hotel and it's rooms are beautiful and it has one of the hippest restaurants in town attached to it. We'll be looking into making this our corporate hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Should be #1 on TripAdvisor for Vancouver Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: SiskaC
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at L'Hermitage recently, I have to say that I feel like The Loden should be in the number one spot on Tripadvisor! I found the lobby welcoming and opulent with stylish couches; beautifully decorated, and a pleasure to be in. I found the staff professional, inviting and very warm. I received a complimentary upgrade to a corner suite (they have a philosophy that their nicest rooms should be filled by guests if they are available - very smart, as it made us feel both special, and spoiled all at once and gave us a view into what they have to offer for a slight upgrade in price!) Our room keys were magnetic - no mysterious "did it work" moment after sliding it into the lock on the door - it simply worked by waving it in front of the elevator and room. Our room was a positive interior decorating DELIGHT. They nailed a feeling of sophistication, hipness, coziness and opulence in one fell swoop. Features like floor to ceiling cabinetry for stowing away luggage, and the in room fridge and safe created a clean sweep of style and what was even better? A little sitting couch nestled inbetween two banks of cabinets for sitting on to put your shoes on/placing your suitcase on to unpack. Because this cabinetry was tucked away in the entranceway, it left more space to play with in the bedroom. Our corner suite was banked by floor to ceiling windows with an incredible view of the city. I was greeted by name by the television, and we put on all four of their cool little 30 minute ambient videos while we settled in with some snacks and scotch that we had brought along. Realizing we had forgotten our ipod, and that we needed ice, we called down to front desk. I swear they had a teleporter; our items arrived so swiftly that it was almost a little eerie, considering they had to go to our car to get our ipod! Our evening unfolded beautifully. To make use of our room package credit for their restaurant (Tableau) we had made reservations for 7pm. Despite the fact that their restaurant was packed, they had taken note of my special request for a "booth in a quiet corner" and placed us in the nicest seat in the main dining room! We settled in, and proceeded to have a savoury, delicious and wonderful dining experience. Our waiter was a little scattered, but his obvious ineptitude for serving was balanced out by the simple, beautifully prepared and plated food, nice cocktails and overall ambiance. Nice little touches like gourmet olives were certainly appreciated. Heading back up to our room, we decided to stay in; the bathtub in the bathroom was insane - so deep and beautifully lit. The floor to ceiling translucent glass doors that separated the toilet and shower rooms from the main bathroom created the coolest ambiance, and they thoughtfully had patched in music (with volume control on the wall) from our media server in the livingroom (it runs through the television). Dimmer switches on the (very cool) bathroom light fixtures added to the mood, and we settled in for a long soak. The bed? The bed was fantastic! Comfortable, great curtains, wonderful sleep quality and a pot of coffee arrived in the morning as per our request - hot, delicious and lovely. The only negative of this hotel? Checking out. We were totally impressed by every aspect of their service and styling. I would highly recommend this hotel; not just to visitors, but to residents of Vancouver and the outlying areas as well! Treat yourself to a night in the city, have a mini-holiday and support the BC Economy instead of taking your tourism dollars away! With so much culture so close by, it's a fabulous taking off place for a great night/day in the city. Thanks Loden! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel experience to date..”
Reviews.Author: Justin S
Reviews.Content: We had our company Chrismas party at the Loden Hotel (Tableau Bistro) this year. I have been to several company parties and this one in my opinion was the best. Right from the start we were greeted by helpful, courteous front end staff. The rooms were clean, modern and spacious. I thought the location was very convienient as it is very close to shopping has a lot of different places to eat nearby. The restaurant downstairs named "Tableau" was top notch as well. Great food, great service! No compaints whatsoever. I will definatly be back and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in a luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amelia W
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at The Loden Hotel in Vancouver. I recommended this hotel to my friend visiting from Hong Kong and she said it surpassed her expectation. Also, it was much nicer than her last hotel stay in Vancouver at the Four Seasons. To be close to my friend, I also ended up booking for 2 nights stay at the Loden for myself. It was well worth it and would highly recommend it to local Vancouverites who want to spend the weekend in Downtown!!! Great job to all the staff at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, as usual”
Reviews.Author: Carmen G
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Loden a couple of times before. Points of note include: centrally located downtown (close to Stanley Park for walks, Yaletown or Gastown for late night dinners, and close to the business world for meetings), peaceful, great gym, friendly yet professional and polished staff. But above all, I love the beds, linens and tubs. Kudos! Get a room with a sliding wall! It'll open up your experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay!”
Reviews.Author: awright1713
Reviews.Content: Rooms are perfect, verty clean and spacious. Front desk agents are extremely friendly and helpful. One SLIGHT downside is that the onsite resto doesnt have a lot if variety so you have to walk a couple blocks to get other options. But overall absolutely fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A true Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: First time stay at this lovely boutique, but it will not be my last. Tastefully appointed and provisioned, not on the thoughfare, but tucked quietly just steps away. The modern decor and amenities second only to the outstanding staff. If you have the opportunity to stay, make sure you treat yourself to reservations in the restaurant before you arrive.. the amazing work and art of the kitchen at Tableau is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TensionStudios
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Loden, the room was very cozy yet not cramped. The service was incredibly helpful and friendly. They even produced a DVI-HDMI cable for connecting the laptop to their in-dash entertainment system so we could watch our DVDs on the flat screen. Adrien was charming and helpful and an all around cool guy. Highly recommended. The only reason why I didn't give it an excellent was because even though the room was well priced, it was very low and had no view at all. Also, the restaurant served veal which supports a particularly barbaric treatment of livestock.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Happyhat
Reviews.Content: Had a beautiful one night stay at The Loden. Excellent in every way. Beautifully appointed, friendly and professional staff, attention to detail. One of the best bathrooms with a an increible deep soaking tub with dimmed lights and plush towels. My only suggestion would be to add Smith Teamaker Teas and a little kettle to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Azzrielish
Reviews.Content: I could rave about the Loden for pages! We stayed at the Loden for just two nights (wish it could have been more) in September. We arrived off a cruise and caught a taxi to the hotel. We arrived well before check in time but a room was available and we were able to check in around 10 am on a Sunday morning. If only the weather had been as lovely as the hotel..... Loved the room! We got a corner room on a higher floor with floor to ceiling windows which made the room feel larger than it was. Good sized bathroom with everything you could need. Great location - not a lot immediately in the vicinity but just five minutes walk to Robson Steet. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Upon check-in we were given a great overview of the city and recommendations for places to eat and visit. We wanted to go to the Capilano Suspension Bridge and the desk clerk helped us with that. The hotel has complimentary bicycles so we booked them one morning and rode around Stanley Park in the rain. If you like boutique hotels with a great vibe then I would highly recommend the Loden. One of my favourite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Kristie P
Reviews.Content: Fabulous rooms -- felt like you were in a Coal Harbour apartment instead of a hotel room -- perfect for a 5 night stay. The gym was great. Brand new machines, equipment, even exercise bands, bosu ball etc. Very impressive. Room service food was not to my taste. Would rather a few more options on the menu, but all in all, a fabulous stay and great staff to make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jfdb
Reviews.Content: Woke up at 5 with jet lag, and staff made me toast and cappuccino, ignoring the room service menu. thanks! A gesture like that says a lot about priorities. Ps eat at tableau. Amazing food. And the room was hip and modern without being dysfunctional or trendy. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMMRW
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and live in Vancouver. We choose this small modern hotel because of the attractive room design and the deep tubs. Room, parking, lobby, staff, cleanliness, other aspects of the operation, - everything - perfect - and very well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kahlua55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 3 occasions for a business trip. Love the bed linens - very high quality. Really deluxe. Bed is very comfortable and the room pleasant. Not too much to look at out the window. One stay I was on the right side so I could see a tiny bit of ocean, with the float planes taking off. Loved the quality soaps and the bathrobes supplied. Loved the layout of the room and also the business desk by the window. Our group had dinner in the meeting room - great price for what the cost was. Wasn't so impressed with the breakfast...it was your usual buffet type meal. All in all it is a lovely boutique type hotel. It is difficult to find and easy to drive right by. Once you miss the hotel, it is quite the convoluted drive 'round the block. You can park your vehicle right outside the door and bring them the key for parking which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel.”
Reviews.Author: blaine X
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the service! Great recommendations for dining and nightlife Great gym, quiet and comfortable rooms, ideal downtown location for dining. Overall happy and smiling crew! I would definitely return. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Hez12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loden hotel recently for the first time. I will definitely come back. The hotel rooms are beautifully designed and they pay attention to the mattresses and bedding which other hotels often forget. I love the turndown service and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I travel with my dog and she was made to feel very welcome - a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “for a good stay”
Reviews.Author: morisabravaya
Reviews.Content: Good location, great service. Rooms are cosy, nicely decorated. The only problem is the breakfast buffet: not even close to OK, and its until 10 am. Please! We are on holidays! Overall: if its fine for me, its fine for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely honeymoon night”
Reviews.Author: Julie F
Reviews.Content: We had a nice corner King room on the 10th floor as we told them it was our wedding day and we were having our honeymoon there. Staff is very friendly and good service. Room was comfortable and we loved the bathroom with its nice soaker tub and faucet that looked like a waterfall. They left us a nice fruit plate to say congratulations. The only thing was the drape let in some light and my husband had his sheet over his head as it seemed like a spotlight on his face. In the morning we had a buffet continental breakfast in Tableau - the server was so pleasant and food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond like no other!”
Reviews.Author: sragno
Reviews.Content: had a fantastic stay at the Loden. the rooms are wonderfully modern and classy yet very cozy. the staff is awesome- attentive and helpful! the hotel car service is so convenient-- ESP. when it's raining outside! oh, and you MUST eat at Tableau, the hotels restaurant --the food was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, slightly eclectic”
Reviews.Author: 08FLHRC
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a very attentive staff. Only two minor issues.... no coffee maker in the room/coffee service in the lobby not available before 5:30am and the continental breakfast not available until after 7 am. Not good for early risers/east coast based visitors. Very nice fitness center and room service has a good menu, well prepared and reasonable pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kscchang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden last week (Nov. 1 and 2). The room and amenities were luxurious. Service at the front desk and by valets was warm and first class. The hotel is well situated, we walked to Le Crocodile for a very nice dinner. All in all, our only regret is that we couldn't stay longer at the Loden. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: McKayEntourage
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Loden. Was there for two nights on business and enjoyed the friendly and knowledeable staff as well as the modern, luxurious accommodations. Bathroom was fabulous! Great tub!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigV36
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location 5 mins from convention centre and Stanley Park. Staff were attentive and the rooms were superb. It was quiet and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: renaissanceCanada
Reviews.Content: What a great example of contemporary interior design this hotel is! A lovely surprise to come to this fine boutique hotel after a long day coming back from Tofino.Bed comfort is superb,spoil- you-rotten bathrooms ,just overall nicely appointed rooms. We had to leave very early the next morning for a flight and it would have been nice to have a boxed breakfast or roomsevice but too early for the restaurant unfortunately.That was fine as the coffee was on in the lobby..caught breakfast at the airport instead. All staff very helpful.We'll be back and will stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Andrewmac87
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and close to downtown. rooms were amazing. The fitness center was excellent. Only small challenge was the Hotel Bar had odd hours as compared to what one would expect. Great service and friendly staff. Will definetley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude waitress at breakfast oterhwise good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luke V
Reviews.Content: Overall hotel was good, however we were treated very rudely by the breakfast waitress. Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Bekka F
Reviews.Content: (for more details, visit: http://wp.me/p1DPo4-b3) We are not used to pampering ourselves when we come to the Vancouver area, but as it was our first time away from home without kids in three years, we thought we'd take the plunge and visit a nice hotel for a change. We found the hotel to be very comfortable, the staff were a pleasure to deal with and we thoroughly enjoyed a few of the "different" things about the hotel, like the sliding bathroom doors, the floor to ceiling, wall-to-wall windows, and the gigantic bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “the more we stay, the more we love it”
Reviews.Author: notadoc
Reviews.Content: we keep coming back to the loden! Location is primo, we continue to find little bistros, shopping and great walks all around. Staff and hosts are always helpful and gracious. Yoga mat in each room allows one to start or finish the day in sync with the great urban viewscape. No problem having a great vegan breakfast at Tableau - thanks for that. And so easy for business downtown. Close to skytrain for airport...the Gems are endless. See u again soon,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Needs Some Improvements”
Reviews.Author: Alovera23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Sept 29-Oct 1, 2011 for business. This hotel is beautifully decorated. The rooms are stunning! I especially loved the heated floors and speakers in the bathroom. This is the most technologically advanced hotel I've been to. You could even connect an Ipod to the alarm clock, which also worked on the speakers in the bathroom. The room did not have an ironing board, so I struggled to steam my work clothes with the mini steamer that was provided. The breakfast room service menu was disappointing. You cannot order a simple order of eggs, bacon and toast. The only egg option is hard boiled. The only meat option is in a breakfast sandwich. I asked if I could get scrambled eggs and bacon and they said no. I don't understand why they don't offer this as the food comes from the Hotel restaurant downstairs,Tableu. Your choices consist of oatmeal, granola with yogurt and other healthy items. I called ahead and asked for my 'healthy' breakfast to arrive at a certain time. It arrived 30 mins early. The cream had chunks of ice, the butter was so hard I couldn't butter my toast and the salt/pepper holder only contained pepper. I stayed in a room close to the elevator, and I could not sleep the first night. It sounded like a subway rumbling all night. It was extremely frustrating. I had no problem sleeping the next night because I was so exhausted. The sushi restaurants near this hotel closed at 8pm on a Saturday. This hotel does not have a fitness centre/steam room or spa. You can call the front desk to arrange to have spa services. They have professionals who come to the hotel for appointments only.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pzil
Reviews.Content: My family was in town visiting from the eastern US and after doing extensive research I decided upon this hotel. It blew away all expectations. Very impressed. Great beds, great location, everything was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “RPM”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo M
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research into possible hotel stays in Vancouver, my wife and I chose the Loden and we were so pleased with the results. This is a great example of boutique hotel. It is tastefully done and we loved the color palette. The front office staff was amazingly helpful. We stayed in a beautiful corner room on the 9th floor. The room was very comfortable, the bed was sublime. It is wonderfully located almost equidistant from Stanley Park, the Gaslight District and Yaletown. We ate at the hotel's Tableau restaurant on two nights and had lovely meals. My only two criticisms have to do with the small tubs (but very deep) and the remote control for the TV - difficult to maneuver the guide and select buttons. But if I go back I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LKho
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had 3 wonderful nights in this hotel. Our room was on the 8th floor. Love that we can open a window in the room. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly, especially Sean (valet). A staff in the restaurant made us delicious hot lemon and honey drinks without even asking because she heard us coughing and sneezing. Fabulous gym.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the best”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels in Vancouver, and this is the best. (It's what the Opus wishes it could be.) The rooms are stellar and the service is first-rate. They really go out of their way to take care of you. Honestly, I never write reviews for any hotel I stay at, but this place warrants praise. Stay...you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: While in Vancouver for a few days for our anniversary and a Timbers v. Whitecaps game, we were so pleased with our stay at The Loden!
