We had a corner room on the 4th floor - extremely comfortable and cozy. We just wish we would have remembered to bring the right cables to connect our computer with the TV! The staff was so friendly as well! Even when we were in and out in our Timbers Army gear, the staff was engaging and friendly and seemed genuinely interested to talk soccer and about our native Portland, Ore. Parking was a bit steep, but not too bad especially with such prompt and friendly valet service. It would have been great to have access to free WiFi - but there were enough Starbucks nearby (like 2-doors down) to tide us over. Speaking of that - the location was perfect! Near to Robson and close enough to the waterfront and restaurants. Thank you Loden for a wonderful stay. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianakMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights. Wonderful, friendly staff who were very helpful. The rooms were great, clean, and comfy. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jlovesernie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before my wedding with my bridesmaids as well as the night of my wedding with my new husband. The service was excellent. I forgot my contact lens solution and the concierge went out and got me some. The night of the wedding there was a special congratulations note and chocolate-covered strawberries in the room. Brunch at Tableau the day after the wedding was also great!

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly Deliver Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Loden several times and it is always a pleasant stay. Very friendly and personal hotel. Their black cab service is really top notch too!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wavySanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: Great location and excellent staff. Nice boutique hotel with good size corner room. Luxurious linens and bath. Especially liked the complimentary use of bicycles to tour Stanley Park and waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful oasis!”
Reviews.Author: connie s
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in every way. The rooms are beautifully decorated, impeccably clean, and unique with the the sliding door that opens up the bathroom for more light. They've thought of everything including a speaker that pipes the sound from the tv into the bathroom. The beds and pillows are super comfortable! We've never encountered a more helpful and pleasant staff! We were there for 4 shifts and they were all wonderful...so nice. Even before we arrived I received helpful emails about a day trip to Whistler. The location is perfect...a short walk to the seawall and Stanley Park. Vancouver is a bustling city and we were so glad we made this choice when we saw where several of the other hotels that we had considered were located. It was so close to everything and yet so quiet at night. The bikes are a great perk, complete with helmets, locks and water bottles. There's a very good restaurant right next to the hotel where we enjoyed the largest mussels ever and a delicious cobb salad with halibut. The desk staff also offered tips on places to see and go. We could not have been happier and will stay here again! I'm very picky about hotels and this was a favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the class”
Reviews.Author: ClassyOZ
Reviews.Content: I can not rate this hotel any higher. The Loden hotel is a chic boutique hotel close to the waterfront and close to Robson St shops. We arrived very early with our young son, tired from a long overnight flight. Our suitcases and check in were dealt very efficiently. We were so grateful. The service at this hotel was excellent, nothing was too hard, always with a smile. A few hours later I woke up with a bad jet lag, needed a caffeine fix, could not find the kettle. The front desk staff, promptly organized some green tea with a pot of hot water to take to the room. We booked the room with the private water garden terrace, so soothing and tranquil in the middle of the city. The room was perfect, very modern, Hi tech and tastefully decorated. I would love to have this interior designer to design my house!! When we first arrived, we found a fresh pitcher of water and glasses, with some Lindt chocolates on the bedside table, and some clean slippers ready next to the bed....what else can one expect?? The hotel also provided bikes. I booked one for 7am, one was ready and waiting, complete with helmet, lock and a bottle of water to take! All with a smile from the concierge and front desk staff. Whenever we needed a taxi, one seemed to appear instantaneously, the staff went out their way to call or hail one themselves. One last thing, the fitness centre(gym) is amazing!! The best equipments, treadmills with touch screen and personal TV screen with a sport headphone provided. Of course towel and water is provided. It was squicky clean, not a drop of sweat stain to be seen!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Fig63
Reviews.Content: We booked an upgraded room for our Anniversary get-away. We have stayed at the Loden once before and thoroughly enjoyed the funky boutique feel. The room we got had been smoked in and staff were very quick to give us a new room. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to the penthouse suite for our troubles. We would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Michele P
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. Suggestion for the Coast Restaurant for dinner was the best. We used the bikes and the location was perfect near everything especially Stanley Park. Room was quiet and clean. Fitness center was excellent with everything needed. Only compliant was my massage which was an outside vendor who wanted to give me a deep tissue when I wanted relaxation. Everything else was top drawer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Ozlover1023
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Loden only for one night. The welcome was very warm and the corner room very nice. They recommended a great restaurant for dinner - Coast - just around the corner. The breakfast was ok, but if you look for great variation go somewhere else. As we had only some hours in the city they offered us free bikes to go on a tour around Stanley Park which was awesome. If I had not already booked the hotel for our 2nd Vancouver stay a couple of days later I would have gone back to the Loden. The price/performance ratio was perfect and far better than in many 5 star places we went.

Reviews.Title: “Yup. Best Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: It's fresh, beautiful, comfortable. The rooms are really well thought-out. Beautiful marble bathrooms with tub AND shower (not always a given in Vancouver). Great location. Now, let me help to make your stay more enjoyable: 1) note that the sink sticks out about 4" from the countertop, you WILL bang into it, so just know that 2) there is no printed menu in the room. You have to turn the TV on and scroll to the menu (and the remote is sticky so the directional buttons don't work. 3) breakfast menu is posted and inaccurate. It shows a full menu, but when you call and order, they will tell you, "oh - the kitchen is closed, we're serving continental only" 4) not a lot of pillows, and no extras in the closet 5) it's not really a spa, it's a massage room with a gym attached, but nice gym 6) there's no bottled water that comes with the room, that would be nice Little things that are great: 1) free internet 2) neat room divider between bathroom and bedroom. I'm sure there are photos of this, it's really intimate and clever. 3) we stayed in a garden room with a beautiful little reflecting pool and a tiny little buddha sitting next to it. Really fun. 4) restaurant had great food. I don't think anybody would be disappointed in this hotel. It's really comfortable. I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Loden”
Reviews.Author: Emelia76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Loden for 5 nights in September during our visit to Vancouver. We had intended to stay at the Fairmont Pacific Rim but as there was no availability, we looked for alternatives and found the Loden via Tripadvisor. The hotel is in a fantastic location - a few blocks from Robson street and walking distance to the harbour, Stanley Park and the central shopping areas. The staff at the hotel was also very friendly and we were made to feel quite welcome during our stay. Although I think we were either mistakenly given someone else's room or else they had mistakenly put the wrong name on our welcome card (and perhaps we weren't the intended recipients of the free jelly beans and water!). Overall the room was nice, although for such a new hotel I didn't expect the fittings and fixtures to be so worn - the handles on the glass doors the bathroom were broken, the toilet roll holder was dislodged etc. These are minor observations though and overall didn't affect the quality of the stay. One final note though - the Loden charges a daily wifi fee of $14.95 per room which we found to be quite expensive. Tip for anyone staying here - head to the Starbucks around the corner from the hotel. Free wifi for the price of a coffee and barely a minute's walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown area”
Reviews.Author: livetotravelcdn
Reviews.Content: I stay here fairly often on business, usually anywhere from 2 to 5 days every couple of months. The hotel is in a fantastic location in the Coal Harbour area, just a few blocks up from the float plane docks, and a few blocks away from Robson street. The staff are always friendly, and the turn down service includes a couple of chocolates and a fresh decanter of water. It's close to the water front walk, which makes it easy to get in a stroll before or after work every day. Lots of good restaurants close by too - Cactus Club is always good, but try the Italian Kitchen, or Lupo's (also Italian) if you want something really special. The hotel also offers a free car service that will drive you anywhere in the downtown area - just book it in advance at the front desk, and give the driver a tip (ok, it's not quite free). The rooms are well designed, with floor to ceiling windows that include a window that opens to let in fresh air. Bathrooms are large, with a separate bathtub and shower, and nice toiletries. Only two complaints. The shower doors often leak, so it's not unusual to step out of the shower into a puddle of water. And the sinks are not well designed - they look great, but the water splashes out when you run water into them, and the spout sticks up too high so you have to be careful not to bump your head if you try to wash your face. But these are minor, and after many stays I still enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven at the Loden...”
Reviews.Author: campbellk218
Reviews.Content: If I wore a hat, I would tip it to the staff and Management of the Loden. It is simply a slice of heaven to stay there, ... and business travel is no joy, yet I actually look forward to a night in your hotel. The style, design, cleanliness, comfort is THE BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vancouver...”
Reviews.Author: scottemac
Reviews.Content: A great experience at the Loden where I was staying and hosting an event for a client. The staff at the hotel was excellent - friendly and very responsive. Will definitely stay at the Loden next time I'm in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: proletarianTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our trip to the West coast, and loved both stays. The first time we stayed at the Loden was for only one night. We were greeted warmly and checked in promptly and efficiently into a two queen bed superior room, as booked. The decor is modern and comfortable, and the beds and linens were wonderful. Upon our second stay (which was for 4 nights), we checked in expecting a two queen bed room but were given a two double bed room instead. I assume they had overbooked the two queen rooms, but I don't really know for sure. However, a quick call down to the front desk remedied this situation right away, and we were given a one bedroom suite instead. It was a big room, and it came with a DVD player, and a Wii with Rockband 2, which was awesome for killing time during our breaks from exploring Vancouver. There was even a Nespresso machine inside the suite.. So convenient! During our second stay, we also took advantage of the free drop-off car service, as well as the bike loans which we used to cycle around Stanley Park. (You can borrow bikes for up to 3 hours. More than enough time to ride around Stanley Park!) We really appreciated the attention to detail and friendliness of the front desk staff - Once, when it was raining, the front desk offered to drop us off at the aquarium, and the very next day when we called the front desk to ask about bike loans, they asked us how we liked our trip to the aquarium! The location of the hotel is pretty decent, a good place to start from when walking around Vancouver. Some other perks: Free Nespresso machine in the lobby in the mornings, iced tea in the afternoons. Really nicely appointed bathrooms with more masculine smelling shampoo/conditioner/soap - no floral stuff here! Cool buttons in the room that allow you to tell staff whether not to disturb or to make up the room, without needing to use one of those door signs. Lindt chocolates and water next to your bed at turndown time. Comfortable slippers and robes, and umbrellas in every room! Daily Globe & Mail newspaper hung in a green bag on your door every morning. Valet parking was a little bit pricy at $35 per night, especially once you tack on the insane 21% parking tax and 12% HST, which adds up to more than $45CAD per night!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Loden!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry08
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Loden. Beautiful room, very comfortable, very stylish. Staff were very welcoming and friendly. We only stayed one night but wished we were staying longer. Perfect location in downtown Vancouver. Walking distance to Robson street and to the waterfront. The hotel provides Townie bikes for your use so you can cycle to destinations such as Stanley park. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Well done Loden”
Reviews.Author: duwatt50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loden for a week with a friend. Staff was professional and genuinely warm. We had amazing service from the management to the housekeeping. Rooms are beautiful and designed with all travelers in mind. The hotel was in close proximity to the waterfront, train stations and most all transits. Restaurant had excellent food with great servers and prompt kitchen staff. I absolutely recommend the Loden.

Reviews.Title: “"Quote" No worries!”
Reviews.Author: Robert101647
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky person as to where I stay. In reviewing pricing and location I found the Loden Hotel seemed to be the right choice. I was not disappointed. The staff was very nice. The rooms were exceptional. It was difficult getting my wife out of the room in the morning, because it was so inviting. When I go back I will not look anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Fragggie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfetly situated and run by very professional yet friendly staff. This combination actually makes you feel welcome whenever you step inside the doors. Would return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful and friendly, like most Canadians!”
Reviews.Author: beeeeggg
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a cool vibe and was well-stocked with random yet useful items such as umbrellas, yoga mats and fancy grocery bags. The staff was knowledgeable, hard-working and extremely friendly, eg. suggesting that we visit Lynn Canyon instead of Grouse Mtn for a more local and affordable scenic hike. Bikes were available for free rentals and valet service was always speedy. When the complimentary downtown limo was late, a Loden employee flagged down a taxi for me and compensated me for the ride. Great location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed, lovely boutique hotel, great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rebeccalamb
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our two night stay at The Loden. The rooms are very nice with great bathrooms--love the soaking tub! We just wish they would put in-room coffee makers...for the price, an expected amenity for those of us who like our coffee in order to wake up! Also, as on so many hotels, there is a charge for wireless in the room. This really annoys me as the cost is way too high and it should be free. The fitness room was great and a big plus. We will be back but coffee, please!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: icybeta
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've stayed in. Relaxed and friendly staff. Beautiful and comfortable rooms. I wouldn't stay anywhere in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! One of the best.”
Reviews.Author: mavidan
Reviews.Content: 1. great location 2. great staff 3. great facilites

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ShannonDT
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! Hotel is 3 blocks from the waterfront and in the middle of downtown. We had the B&B package, which included breakfast and parking. Complimentary valet, courteous and efficient staff with personal attention whenever we needed it. The first night we had dinner at the hotel and it was excellent. Breakfast provided many choices and great service. Staff also arranged a complimentary ride to a Yaletown restaurant, which was further than we wanted to walk. The hotel is very contemporary, with elegant decor, but cozy at the same time. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Loden is a favorite”
Reviews.Author: mtnair
Reviews.Content: This was my third or fourth stay at The Loden, and it's just as great as ever. This time it was for a last-minute 24 hour getaway with two friends. We got the B&B package, which includes valet (otherwise expensive to park overnight). The decor is modern yet comfortable, the rooms are a decent size, and as a total "germaphobe" I appreciate that everything is clean clean clean. The location is centrally located downtown with easy access to shopping and restaurants in Yaletown, Gastown, West End, etc. It's also a couple blocks to the water, Coal Harbor and its paths connecting to spectacular Stanley Park, a walkers/runners/family outing paradise. There is a Starbucks on the corner, and a gourmet grocery store and deli nearby. Many of the rooms do not have a view, which is typical for downtown Vancouver with all its skyscrapers, but ours had a peek-a-boo view of the water and mountains. It also looked right across at a condo building, which might bother some people. I've stayed in a couple different room types -- a standard king, a park vista corner room, and this time a room with two queen beds. We were able to fit a rollaway into the room, but it was cramped so I'm glad it wasn't set up until we were ready for bed. This room was not as beautiful as the others I've stayed in, even though we were on a high floor. There was no gorgeously tiled tub, and no sliding wall between the bath and sleeping area, so the bathroom was dark and a bit uninspired. I assume there are room space issues with having two beds, because there was also no reading chair or chaise, which previous rooms I'd stayed in had. Beds are soooo comfy with nice linens, and rooms are quiet if windows are closed, though I always travel with earplugs. My favorite rooms are the high floor corner or park vista rooms, with their two walls of floor to ceiling windows - makes you feel like you're floating. Service is consistently outstanding throughout the hotel, and is one of the main draws for me. The reservation staff, valets, concierges and housekeepers are courteous and professional and appear to enjoy their jobs. The restaurant has been remodeled into a warmer and more casual bistro style than when the hotel first opened. We enjoyed our continental buffet breakfast, which had everything from pastries and fruit to smoked salmon or oatmeal. I adore just about everything about The Loden, and look forward to returning on my next visit to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Felt special! Love the boutique nature, vs. run-of-the-mill of larger hotels.”
Reviews.Author: BevAnnDS
Reviews.Content: Free bicycles for use - great for riding iin Stanley Park. Close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: henry1886
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, arriving late in the evening. Excellent rooms and although no coffee making facilities an espresso machine was delivered to the room after we had enquired how we might get a cup of coffee. The porter also volunteered to bring us fresh milk and ice. In the morning we were anxious to weigh our suitcases prior to going to the airport. We asked about this at reception and a set of scales was brought out for us. The only strange thing about the hotel is we understand there is a 15 dollar charge for wi fi access. In respect of car parking, although there is valet parking on offer, there is a multi storey car park adjacent - which for a weekend stay is certainly better value. The on street parking meters - which operate seven days a week - are very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Choice, Will Not Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Shangri-La-BB
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. The front desk staff were very kind and welcoming. The rooms are very well appointed with everything you would need in mind. Technologically up to date, lighting within the room is well thought out, lots of storage space and an amazing bathroom. It has a central location without being in the busy core. The rooms are quiet with great views.

Reviews.Title: “The Loden - Simply "Perfect"”
Reviews.Author: JoeMammy
Reviews.Content: “On your left”, was my favorite phrase spoken or heard during our weeklong visit. Because that meant I was either peddling around someone or someone was peddling or skating around me. It also meant I was on one of the most remarkably visual bike paths in North America- Stanley Park. My other favorite phrase often repeated by locals was simply, “perfect”. A very common reply for just about anything and everything on our visit to your beautiful city. We had a 7 day vacation that had to be used before 9/1. We were looking for an escape from the oppressive FL heat and humidity and decided Vancouver would be the perfect ticket. It had been over 10 years since we last visited and each time in the past had been in the winter months. This would be our first summer jaunt. We exited the airport to find we had arrived on the warmest day of the year, a balmy 79 but guess what? It felt like 79 whereas our weather we just left was 90 but felt like 105 (sorry that I’m stuck on Fahrenheit). After researching TA and scouring hotel reviews, The Loden seemed to offer all of the amenities and location that would fit our needs. Bingo! The Loden not only delivered they exceeded expectations with exemplary service and a few surprises. Our package was the bed and breakfast with the deluxe corner with two window walls offering spectacular views of the city, Coal Harbor and surrounding mountains. Cool features were a doorbell for our room, touch button do-not-disturb and service- notifications. No ice machines. Wait a minute, no ice is a feature? It is when you simply pick up the phone and tell the front desk you need ice. The bellmen are so fast that your doorbell will be ringing within seconds of hanging up- consistently- and we needed ice every day for our in room happy hour! Toss in provided bicycles with helmet, lock and H20 and a fabulous onsite restaurant with tremendous service and our table was set for a great week. Breakfast was a nice buffet of breads, waffles, bagels, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt and hot egg wraps. Servers quickly offered coffee and fresh squeezed juices. Many newspapers are available, all included. It was a great way to jumpstart each day of our metropolitan adventures. The proximity to Coal Harbor and Stanley Park is very, very convenient. We would spend the mornings bike riding the Stanley Park bike trails, which in itself has to rank as one of the world’s most scenic as you always have a water view on one side and either mountainous walls or breathtaking gardens and forest on the other side. We also played the pitch and putt golf course, checked out the ginormous pool, walked the rose and rhododendron gardens, admired huge totems, lunched in the Fish House and.winked face to face with Beluga whales in the Aquarium. Afternoons we would stroll 3 blocks down to the Coal Harbor park area. A massive soft green lawn on the waterfront that served the sun worshipers or just those seeking some laid back book chillaxing like us. Very colorful crowd that included dogs of all shapes and sizes, some even wearing shoes. You will hear the word, "perfect" alot while at the Loden. And justifyably so. We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “KIDS LOVED THE Wii AND ROCK BAND IN THE SUITE”
Reviews.Author: traveler460763
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel- great service, beautiful room!!!! Our family had a wonderful experience at this hotel and would recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Can't say enough!”
Reviews.Author: SluserL
Reviews.Content: Did a mother-daughter trip out to Vancouver and stayed at the Loden. The staff were extremely warm and welcoming upon arrival. The room was absolutely outstanding with great design details - it was a safe urban oasis. Also... fantastic bed - slept like a rock! Great location, great staff, great everything - we can't say enough!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique at its best”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3-night stay at the Loden, our first time in Vancouver. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to Gastown and Robson Street. The front desk staff is outstanding, every single person we dealt with was helpful and professional. Our room was comfortable, chic, and spacious. The bathroom had ample counter space and storage spots for toiletries. Our room had both a shower and a deep tub, which was very nice for soaking. Instead of a standard iron and board (which you can request), the hotel provides you with a hand-held steamer, which was amazing for getting the wrinkles out of more delicate apparel. My only suggestion to the hotel would be to provide guests with room slippers. We spent $36 CAD on a mediocre breakfast for two at the restaurant downstairs. The selection of breakfast items just doesn't warrant that price, in my opinion. There is a computer and printer you can use for free on the second floor on a first come first serve basis. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience and I would not hesitate to recommend the Loden to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful room, mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Lee59
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival, which wasn't until 10pm or so, the desk person remarked that the manager had "upgraded" me to a garden room. It turns out that meant a bottom-floor room. GIven that I had requested an upper floor, I'm not sure why that was an upgrade. Of course, I arrived quite late, and so it is not surprising that only the bottom floor was left. I would definitely suggest trying to get an upper floor as the hotel backs up to a large office building, and consequently I felt there was absolutely zero privacy in my room, and did not open the curtains much. On the other hand, the room decor was, in my opinion, excellent. (The fact that a half-wall slides open to reveal the bathroom might not be to some guests' liking.) The shower and toilet are behind further glass doors. There was a lot of frosted glass and dark wood, the latter in that mid-centruy modern style that is popular. Although I'm not generally a fan of that style, the overall feel of the room was quite nice. The room was also fairly large. The last night, while I was arranging a taxi, there were some guests ahead of me who seemed to have a problem with a nonexistent, or lost, reservation. The desk arranged a very early morning taxi, which was a great relief.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rahulnanavati
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at the Loden and was really happy with everything. The rooms are great and the location is amazing. The service is excellent too... the people are always smiling and quick to help with anything you need. The only word of warning is something I didn't realize - parking is extra and street parking overnight doesn't seem like a viable option.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute class”
Reviews.Author: NoahWard
Reviews.Content: We were just on a day trip to Vancouver and wanted a romantic, classy place to stay the night. The Loden Hotel did not disappoint. We enjoyed everything about the hotel. Dinner downstairs was also amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal first visit to Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Franz202011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 20th wedding anniversary discovering Vancouver. The Loden was the perfect spot to call home for the 3 days we were there. Easy to get around from there on foot, bike and car. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel is very comfortable, clean and quiet. They also have free bikes to use for a few hours, but reserve them early or you'll miss out. The brunch was disappointing and expensive (for what it is) in the hotel restaurant, but that is easy to avoid with all the wonderful food in the city.

Reviews.Title: “What 5 star standard should be for all the rest!”
Reviews.Author: SNR18
Reviews.Content: Excellent room with all the amenities (every little detail down to the bath salts!). Service was best I've ever had at a hotel- they go out of their way to make your visit a great one. They even had an appetizer comped at our restaurant!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the room, the location and decor!”
Reviews.Author: hansdebadde
Reviews.Content: We really appreciated how the hotel was between Stanley Park and the downtown core. We were able to go for a walk around Coal Harbour and the Sea Wall before dinner, and then after a good nap, walk into town for dinner. My wife and i really liked the beverages in the lobby after a long walk on a hot day. It was a nice touch. I like the boutique style, it seems so much more personal. The minimal charge to move to a corner room was well worth it as we loved how windows on two sides completely changed the feel of the room. The bathroom was awesome, albeit the bathtub was short. I really appreciated having a shower without having to bend over due to a short shower head. I think this is only the second time out of the last 30 hotels. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicwest
Reviews.Content: Hotel was selected as it was no 1 in trip advisor and it was perfect.It is a 'boutique hotel" We booked a corner room ,we loved the decor.Reception was warm,and very informed. Location is great, walking distance to the harbor . The restaurant is reasonably priced and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and now with a lively bar and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Graham T
Reviews.Content: We knew the Loden was a convenient, peaceful and comfortable base for visiting central Vancouver, but we were happily suprised to find a much improved restaurant and bar service that moves the Loden into a new category - 'A great place to meet for lunch or dinner'

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: dei4
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in great location right in the centre of downtown Vancouver. We stayed in the Luxe room, a one bedroom suite on the fourteenth floor which has a slight water view. Room is not overly large but so well appointed we felt right at home. Very comfortable bed and linens. The staff were all super helpful. We took the opportunity to view the Stunning penthouse which has a huge terrace and fantastic views. My son had a park vista room on a lower floor and was also very happy he loved the well equipped gym on the second floor. Highly recommend and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JAG710
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in easy walking distance to most everything. The hotel is design is awesome and it's not too big. They rent out free bikes for three hour sessions which is perfect for taking to Stanley Park or to ride to areas that aren't quite walkable. We stayed in room 1005. It had a sliver view of the marina and a sliver view of the Vancouver Harbor. It's far enough away from other buildings around it that you don't feel like you're in a dark hotel room. They provide free espresso and milk in the lobby in the mornings. The staff is very nice. The street is really quiet. It's an awesome hotel for the price in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “no disappointment here!”
Reviews.Author: elsvw
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Loden Hotel for 3 nights and everything was great, from the moment we arived when we were met by professional people at the reception, to the friendly staff at breakfast time. The rooms are "funky" with gadgets I have never before seen in a hotel. Location is great, walking distance to most attractions and the courtesy bicycles were fun for an early morning ride along the seawall in Stanley Park. To get to and from the airport, no need for a taxi, take the Waterfront/Canada Line train, the station is withing easy walking distance from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “No disapointment”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle R
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very good location steps to downtown and to Coal Harbor. The room was very well appointed soap was missing in the bathroom and was replaced within minutes. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “will try again...”
Reviews.Author: enroute68
Reviews.Content: Great location...understated & chic. Reception conceirege service varies from well-informed & exceptionally friendly to deer in the headlights vacant miserable ventilation issues with restaurant kitchen scents permeating the lobby...unfortunately tarnish this stars' ranking

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: PM-Chicago
Reviews.Content: The Loden Vancouver hotel was great for a 4-day family trip to Vancouver (my wife and me, and our thirteen year old son). We stayed in a one-bedroom suite (the Mistral Suite on the 14th floor -- I think room 1403). The configuration of the suite included a nice size bedroom with a king bed, a separate master bath, a nice size living room (with a sleeper sofa, which was where our son slept), and a nice size dining room area. There was only a single vanity sink in the bathroom, and a single bathroom, but it was much nicer than the "junior suites" (available in some hotels which basically consist of a normal hotel room with some separation for the bedroom). The service was excellent, and -- although the hotel is not located on the water -- the hotel is in a great location: a short two blocks from the waterfront (at a great location along the waterfront) and three short blocks from the shopping district (on Robson Street). The service at the hotel was great, and the restaurant in the hotel is also very nice. We would go back any time. They also provided a Wii in the living room (with two large flat screen tvs in the suite).

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Ron74
Reviews.Content: the hotel and staff were just great. Very accomodating and helpful. the location worked wonderfully and we were able to walk almost everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Classy, not pretentious! Amazingly friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jack P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights whilst travelling around the west coast. Honestly its one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in.... nice rooms, super helpful staff, good decor but not too OTT, barman who can make a good drink.. what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Brendan K
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a long week-end at the Loden and have to say it was a terrific experience. It is absolutely the most beautiful hotel we have ever stayed at. The service was impeccable and every employee we came into contact were wonderful. I would especially like to mention Sarah, the Concierge. She did so much for us and made our trip a delight. I wish there was a Loden in every city we visit.

Reviews.Title: “all around excellent”
Reviews.Author: frac81
Reviews.Content: The location is great for walking or taking public transit to essentially everywhere a tourist might want to go. Free bikes to use around Stanley Park, the waterfront, etc. are also a spectacular perk as helmets, a bike lock and water bottles were included. A ride around and through Stanley Park is a must, weather permitting. The staff is very accommodating and nice without ever putting a hand out expecting tips. We did not dine in the restaurant, but it always appeared to be busy. The rooms are very well appointed and ours was quite spacious. Little touches like a nice golf umbrella and clothing steamer made the stay much more comfortable. There was a great TV with excellent connectivity options for your laptop or camera should you wish to stream something or view the day's photos on a big screen. We received complimentary high speed wifi and wired internet access during our stay, but I am not sure if that is routine or not as it was listed at a charge in some of the literature. The city is a great place to visit and The Loden is more than likely where we will stay when we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Passionatetraveler11
Reviews.Content: NIce location, clean, great design and great service. I will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ashleyr87
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was beautiful, had a corner suite, floor to ceiling windows on two of the walls. The bed was the comfiest bed I have ever slept on and the bathroom was huge! Fantastic location, 15 minute walk from Stanley park and we could walk everywhere. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay -- beautiful, professional, impressive.”
Reviews.Author: Addie G
Reviews.Content: The Loden is located in the heart of downtown and within easy walking distance to both transportation and each area of the city. The room was beautifully appointed, the staff was courteous and helpful, and the duration of stay beyond comfortable. I would most highly recommend The Loden to anyone visiting Vancouver and would myself look no further for a place to stay for our next visit to this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Committed to the Loden”
Reviews.Author: Salamander57
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fast but delightful stay at the Loden. The Loden is stylish. The rooms are handsome, comfortable and well laid out. The location is perfect for downtown and access to Stanley Park. We met up with friends in Yaletown, which was a little farther away but easily walkable. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. They had good recommendations for viewing and/or avoiding fireworks and spot on advice for the Vij line. This was our third stay at the Loden and we are looking forward to our fourth visit later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Same Quality n' Service”
Reviews.Author: Bill L
Reviews.Content: This is second time we back to Loden staying.... Quality service of staffs and room cleanning was splendid! Especially thanks to Ms Jill Forbe; She lent us a hand when our plane did relay twice within a same day and she able to settle us in a room for our inconvienence. Now that I call great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: def57
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vancouver and I wanted a small, understated, luxurious hotel in a convenient location. Honestly, like their tagline says " quiet, beautiful and central". The restaurant,Tableau, was very good also. (Great cheese/charcuterie plate and bar). Unless you are looking for a big, glitzy hotel, you cant go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Chic”
Reviews.Author: ita7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our trip off Via Rail from Toronto going home, Houston. This hotel had cool surroundings, art deco furnishings made me want to redo our home, my husband loved the double end bag in the well equipped gym, great location to everything, nice staff, great view. We stayed on a high floor on the corner and it was beautiful. The walls were all glass with a wide view. We took the hop-on-hop-off and learned a great deal, very informative. The front desk told us about Joe Fortays for great seafood and it was. Don't forget to try Tim Horton's coffee, it's starbucks competition. We did not eat in the hotel for we were always out site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: masstraveller117
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Loden Hotel for 4 nights during our stay in Vancouver. Our room was approximately 240 CAD/night, but there are multiple on-line discounts if you do a search for them, usually for 10-15% off. I had called ahead of time to let them know we would be arriving very late and had no problems checking in when we finally arrived (at 2 a.m.). Overall, while I would say the staff isn't the warmest bunch, they were all polite and helpful. The room was well laid out, not cramped at all, and the decor was modern and comfortable. Housekeeping comes by 2x per day, so the room was also quite clean. My only minor complaint about the room is that the sink is very narrow and shallow, and the faucet is very big. If you try to wash your face or shave, the water gets everywhere. The location of the hotel is great. We were able to walk to all the restaurants and sites we visited. We could see Stanley Park and the waterfront from our room. The hotel offers bike rentals (comfort ride style bikes are free, there is a charge for mountain bikes), but they are popular with the guests so reserve them ahead of time. The hotel also has a complimentary car service that will take you anywhere within the downtown area. Also popular so reserve times in advance. Finally, the masseuse (Pamela?) was great! The "spa" is really one treatment room, but it was nice and Pamela is great... one of the best massages I've had in a long time! The gym is also very nice, especially for a boutique hotel. It's large, clean and well-lit. We didn't try the hotel's restaurant or room service because there are a ton of great restaurants nearby. Vancouver is a lovely city, and the Loden was a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service and Amenities - We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Vikings2077
Reviews.Content: The Loden is a great place with wonderful service provided by the staff...very friendly and professional. The bed is the most confortable bed ever...we loved it! For the price, I think internet service should be free and a small continental breakfast would be a nice addition to the overall experience. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “CENTRAL. QUIET. BEAUTIFUL. CONDOMS”
Reviews.Author: matthewkurtzman
Reviews.Content: Awesome, beautiful, modern facility. Had a really nice corner room on one of the top floors. The restaurant attached to the hotel was phenomenal. (I had the duck confit). Staff was friendly, helpful, and courteous. Would get 5 stars but, we found an empty box of condoms in one of the dresser drawers. Told the front desk, who told us that management would follow up. No word from them yet, except for a form e-mail asking me to review on trip advisor. Would likely go back, but am disappointed that I never heard from mgmt.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway.”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in one of only 4 rooms with two double beds since there was 3 of us. We really liked that the hotel is really small (77 rooms), really clean, new, modern and the rooms had lots of space. What also sticks out was the staff, they were really helpful, efficient and friendly. Our hotel highlight was being able to use the hotel's complimentary bikes to ride around Stanley park. This place is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A Top Hotel to Stay - The Reviews Were Right”
Reviews.Author: World_Cup_Wanderer
Reviews.Content: Chose this Hotel after a good long look at the reviews on Tripadvisor. They seemed genuine and promised a good stay. We were not disappointed - somewhat quirky but a really nice Hotel to stay. We were there for 8 days and enjoyed the service and support from the staff. No request was too hard - even if not always possible. They even managed to spring a coffee machine for us - much to the delight of my wife. It was the little things that made this stay just that little bit better - the bikes, evening turn-down service, and the effort from staff to simply say hello and be welcoming without being pushy or mechanical in responses. In a week you see the good and the bad in any hotel - there was hardly any bad to see at the Loden while we were there - just all good. We will be back to Vancouver in future years, and we would be willing to stay there again. - it deserves it high ratings on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Every thing I want in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: RifleMike
Reviews.Content: We had 5 wonderful days at the Loden Hotel. I can't imagine what more they could have done to make our stay more pleasant. From the reception we recceived until our final check out everyone made our stay perfect. Great bar and restuarant,too. The London Taxi they provide is a nice added touch. Really, this is a top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to cruise ship dock”
Reviews.Author: Brinley_brown
Reviews.Content: Lovely facility - newly renovated - great location. We would highly recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect...in every way~”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (50s) just returned from a 6 day trip to Vancouver. We are so happy that our base camp was the Loden Hotel. It was perfect! Great, quiet location, close to the waterfront. The seaplane terminal was right there (we took a seaplane to Victoria for the day), rode bikes around Stanley Park, (the hotel has bikes available), great starting point for our one day trip to Whistler ( we rented a car from Enterprise) and a convenient location to walk the city. (Gastown, Yaletown, Granville Island...all doable). Most importantly, I would like to thank Sarah, our fabulous concierge who suggested some fabulous places to dine and always suggested great things to do. Our trip would not have been so wonderful if it weren't for her guidance!!! Being NYC foodies, we were looking for some fun and local places to eat. Some restaurant suggestions include: Cafe Medina (breakfast), Meat and Bread (lunch) RainCity Grill (Dinner), Go Fish (lunch), Noodle Box. Ask the locals, they are more then willing to share their dining favorites. The people of Vancouver are friendly, approachable and eager to answer your questions. It is the perfect place to visit. Explore all the different areas that the region has to offer. Don't forget Victoria for the day...the Butchart Gardens are amazing!!!! The car rideon the Sea to Sky Hightway to Whistler is breathtaking. Shannon Falls, Brandywine Falls, the Peak2Peak gondola ride...shouldn't be missed!!! Even the flights on Air Canada were enjoyable. I'm ready to move!

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Pam046
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel for a staggette in July 2011. So of course there were a few extra phone calls to the hotel with special requests (extra ice buckets, rollaway bed, extra mini-fridge for use)...and upon EVERY phone call, I was greeting with fabulous service. Every single person that i encountered (and there were at least 4) was amazing and had a "can do" attitude. Using phrases/words like "absolutely, of course, not a problem at all", instead of feeling like I was a bother, I could tell they were just happy to help. I deal with hotels frequently in my job, and I have never had better dealings with a hotel. I had told all my friends/colleagues about the great service I received here (and this was before we checked in. And upon arrival, we were upgraded. Amazing! The high end modern finishings are gorgeous. Thank you Loden....we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Fleur902
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel and the place to stay when in Vancouver. The staff were so helpful and the free loan of bikes is a fantastic way to see Stanley Park. We only stayed one night after a 2 week trip to Vancouver Island , but would have loved to have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Loden!”
Reviews.Author: YankinMelbs
Reviews.Content: Great location in Vancouver, the room was incredibly modern and offered great amenities - LOVE the tv speakers in the bathroom - no need to miss a play of football! Concierge and front desk were really helpful and the bartender served up some great cocktails before we headed out for dinner. We were really happy to find this place at a steal and would definitely recommend it if you want to be in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Casual luxe, stellar staff, fab room and location lived up to the Trip Advisor reputation.”
Reviews.Author: Sip-Sip-HI
Reviews.Content: As another guest said to me this morning while we were getting our complimentary Nespressos in the lobby: "Don't you just love this hotel?!" Their authentic English cab drove us out for dinner one night, our corner room was lovely, and the hotel was two blocks away from the seaplane dock (which we took from Victoria). Walked up a few more blocks to Canada's best department store, Holt Renfrew, also walked easily to Gastown and then on to Chinatown for dinner at Bao Bei. We were even offered free bikes to pedal Stanley Park. And they happily stored a bag for us while we took a side trip to Vancouver Island. The only thing this hotel is missing: free wi-fi. Otherwise it's a hip and hospitable place without the attitude hotels like this can often have.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning downtown hotel just 2 blocks from the Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: louise_craigen
Reviews.Content: I was most impressed by this hotel. The corner room we had was spacious and well designed. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The in-house gym is large and well-equipped. The bar and restaurant are not to be missed. The bar serves innovative cocktails and "Tableau" serves honest bistro-style food. Of all the meals we had in Vancouver, "Tableau" was easily the stand-out in every way.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Irishabroad11
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for my Mum whilst she was staying here in Vancouver. She just loved everything about it. The hotel was elegant and stylish. The staff were all very friendly in the most natural way. Nothing was too much hassle. We took trips to Victoria and Seattle but she could not wait to get back to the Loden. It could be another Carlsberg add!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loden”
Reviews.Author: PBGrl
Reviews.Content: Room is cozy but modern with great amenities and very comfortable bed. Loved the courtesy yoga mat, umbrella, and bath salts in room as well as Molton Brown toiletries. Concierge services steered us to several outstanding restaurants walkable from the hotel, which is in great location. Complimentary bikes were awesome! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bullet2
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is the location. It is central to everything. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were clean and well-kept. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Loden”
Reviews.Author: jemuller
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Loden. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the room was beautiful. We were also very happy with the location being in easy walking distance to the waterfront and downtown shopping and restaurants. We were staying on our honeymoon and The Loden upgraded us to the Penthouse suite. It was FABULOUS. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel in Vancouver for us!”
Reviews.Author: likebeingatourist
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to The Loden and we have been impressed yet again. The location is perfect - close to all downtown Vancouver has to offer yet on a quieter street. The rooms are very nice, particularly the bathrooms. This visit, we were upgraded to a 1-bed suite and it was fantastic. What really impresses us at The Loden is the service and attention to detail. It had been 10 months since our previous stay and the front desk staff and management remembered us. It made us feel so welcome. We will never stay at another hotel in downtown Vancouver from now on - The Loden has spoiled us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, cannot say enough good things about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: desingerinDC
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Loden and have already been here for 2 nights with our little girl, who is 9. The hotel staff could not be nicer. Everything we ask has been done for us with a smile and in a timely manner. When we called to make reservations, the Loden reservation agent told us about their special which included the breakfast and valet parking. I would advise you take it if it is offered, as it saved us quite a bit of money and the buffet breakfast lovely. We have a suite on the 12th floor, with a partial view of the harbor. Its really stunning. The room is modern, furnished beautifully with lots of details that they thought about, and very very clean. They give you slippers that actually fit and special water and robes. Makes you feel very welcome. We've gotten great directions to wherever we want to go from the folks at the front desk. One hotel staff in particular was great--Jordan. Thanks for making our stay very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great, except...”
Reviews.Author: martiniclub
Reviews.Content: The Loden is almost everything a boutique hotel should be. Good location, swanky rooms, helpful staff, loved the bathtub. The complimentary car service is genius. So I almost hate to throw them under the bus for something as simple as wi-fi. But seriously, when you bill yourselves as a stylish hotel for the sophisticated traveller, and you advertize wi-fi in the rooms, logging in and finding a $14.95 per day charge for wi-fi is ridiculous. In a day and age when whole cities offer free wi-fi, is it really necessary to money-grab from guests paying good $$ to stay at your hotel? Unnecessary, and a blemish on what is otherwise a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel In Every Way - Accomodations & Location”
Reviews.Author: ChioTravel
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Vancouver was made even better by our stay at the Loden.The Hotel in general is very well designed in a warm modern stlyle without being trendy. If you want a fancy large Hotel this is not the place, however if you want a very nice small boutique Hotel you'll be hard pressed to find better anywhere. Also we found the cost to be quite reasonable given the quality of the Hotel and accommodations. Ouir room was the best warm modern room we've stayed in any of our many travels. The room layout is extreemly innovative, comfortable and spacious, with attention to detail well beyond the norm.The staff were very friendly , accommodating and helpful. The English taxi courtesy car was extreemly welcomed on several occations. From our room (806), with floor to ceiling glass, we had veiws of the downtown area and partial veiews of two areas of the port.. While we originally wanted to be right in the port, we now believe the Loden's location to be much better considering the quality of the Hotel and convienence both to the downton area and to the port . Next time in Vancouver we would not consider staying anywhere else but the Loden.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and great stay!”
Reviews.Author: KerryAnnCampbell
Reviews.Content: I often visit my old hometown of Vancouver for work as well as holiday and have stayed in many hotels during these visits. Most have been fine but nothing special. My recent stay at the Loden was an exception and a pleasant surprise. The room rivalled some of the best 5* I’ve stayed in. It was clean, well equipped with exceptionally nice fittings. The design was pleasantly spacious and well laid-out. The staff were very friendly, the location was convenient and within an easy short walk of all the activity on Robson Street. Only real criticisms were I would really expect the wifi to be included, the daily fee seemed pretty steep considering the limited use I required and I thought the parking was a bit pricey. All in all a very good stay and I would most certainly consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “one of two excellent boutique hotels in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Terry_UTS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Opus hotel recently so was curious to see how the Loden compared. It was excellent and would rate them similarly. Friendly service and good location.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, good location to Robson and the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: wjtdfw
Reviews.Content: Car service was helpful, but like OPUS it is only drop off, no pickup. Staff generally friendly and helpful. Small and quiet, breakfasts are continental and expensive for what you get. We ended up going around the corner to Starbucks or better yet, Urban Fare two blocks away. In some ways doesn't seem comfortable to vacationers, more of an urban couples weekend place. Internet access is not free, minibar was not up to standards and TV was clunky to use. Bathrooms are nice. We stayed at OPUS first and they both seem to be about the same although the staff at OPUS was definitely more friendly and helpful to vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Immensely enjoyable - great location & wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: lbda213
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our four night stay at The Loden - the room was large and very well appointed (adored the shower & tub!), the location was wonderful and the staff... Can't say enough good things about them, from the bellmen to the front desk to the restaurant to the housekeeping - every single one of them went out of their way, every time, to ensure a delightful and gracious stay. Have already recommended to friends, and would absolutely return!

Reviews.Title: “An incredibly welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: aaflyer3M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden following a week's Alaska cruise and it was wonderful. The staff were consistently gracious and helpful. The room was lovely and couldn't have been better. When I return to Vancouver on business it will definitely be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: coast2coast44
Reviews.Content: Great service from the moment we drove up to the entrance. The valet, bellman and front desk were all ready to assist and were very pleasant. Throughout our stay all of our needs and requests were handled quickly and graciously. Our suite was beautiful, quiet and had a fabulous view of the city. The hotel offers a complementary car ride to attractions as well as town bikes that my family really enjoyed. It was easy to walk to the waterfront, shopping and restaurants yet we also felt we were in a quiet and safe location. The fitness room was very clean and well equipped with a lot of windows and light. My teenage son was thrilled with the technology in the room. We would absolutely stay here again when we visit Vancouver. The hotel and staff are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay, wander the sights, and return to!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joan88
Reviews.Content: The ideal city hotel: chic, friendly, outstanding service, helpful staff, incredible bathtub, bed, linens and on a quiet street! The Bed & Breakfast package included the valet parking and a really good choice of items at a buffet, hosted by an excellent staff! Thanks TJ for our morning coffee and conversation! The hotel room is spacious and has exciting lighting options, room darkening drapes and floor to ceiling windows. Huge exercise room also! Stayed for 5 nights and truly felt at home and already plotting to return!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rotate100
Reviews.Content: Boutique style hotel, just a short walk from everything but in quiet spot. Nice rooms but on the small size. Friendly good service. If you arrive mid afternoon hungry and thirsty you have a problem as the Restaurant and Bar; not owned/run by hotel, shuts between 3 and 6 pm each day. They need to address this!

Reviews.Title: “Personalized Service and Contemporary Hotel Design”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixWestin
Reviews.Content: The Loden Vancouver is a wonderful choice in the Coal Harbour district of Vancouver. Close to Stanley Park, Convention Center, Harbour, and Robson Street without being in the middle of the city noise and traffic. We had a corner room with two walls of windows and peek-a-boo views of the marina and harbour mixed in with close views of other buildings. Personally, the bright and light space itself outweighed looking into other buildings. The room upgrade is worth it. The rooms are well designed, modern and extremely clean. Bed is super comfortable with good linens and plenty of high quality pillows (a must for a luxury property). Bathrooms are roomy. Two dislikes were the small bath sink because it splashes water all around the area (a common design problem with this sink shape), and the shower doors leak water onto floor unless the shower head is pointed away from the glass door. Twice, my husband and I found puddles of water on the floor. These are small issues with this property. Hotel front desk staff are welcoming, friendly and very knowledgeable. They offer complimentary car service to close-by places. The staff are well-trained, and appeared to genuinely greet us warmly each time we entered the lobby. The buffet breakfast was good for a Continental. Fresh cut fruit was fresh, smoked salmon and bagels were a nice offering and the grilled breakfast wrap was tasty. Coffee was average, but we are coffee fanatics :). Staff in the restaurant was very friendly. I highly recommend this boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Passion-Lover
Reviews.Content: this is one hôtel you would regret to stay! Vert clean, friendly and professionnal

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: ilias1
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Loden: Cleanliness, size and style of the rooms, service and location were all above average. It is a 5 minute walk to Robson Street; 15 minutes to Stanley Park, 20 minutes to Gastown, etc. We booked the Bed and Breakfast package which also includes valet parking. We would recommend the Loden both for business and for travel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Kinzi_0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my fiance last night and had such an amazing experience. I had booked this hotel after reading other reviews on tripadvisor; however, I was still skeptical. Most reviews are right on the money! The service was impeccable! The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. They had complimentary bikes that we could borrow for a few hours. We rode around the seawall at Stanley Park. I would recommend reserving the bikes as soon as you get to the hotel since the bikes were already taken by someone else on the day we checked in. The valet was extremely convenient. When I needed to get something from the car, a staff member went to my car for me to get it. Even after we checked out, the staff allowed us to keep our car at the hotel with no additional charge. When the car was brought out to us, the staff member helped store our luggage in the trunk, and closed the door for me as I sat into the driver's seat. They had even left two chilled water bottles in the car for us to drink since it was such a hot day. I cannot stress how great the service was. The room was a great size and was very modern. I loved the set up! There are beautiful floor to ceiling windows. There are even a lot of connections to the television to plug in many different devices. The television is directly across from the bed which is nice. I have been to some hotels where the television is in an awkward position. I would warn you that the bathroom is a somewhat open space to the bedroom. The bathroom door can be closed, however, there is a gab near the sink. The person in the bedroom is able to look into that area. However,the toilet and shower area have some privacy: the toilet has a separate door, and there is another door for the shower. The bathtub is a great size, however we did not get a chance to enjoy it. There is lots of light in the bathroom, tons of light switches. I overcame a switch which even turned on speakers from the television in the bathroom. Overall, the bathroom was beautiful! Be careful about splashes from the modern style sink; a way to avoid that is to not turn the nob too much. That works out perfectly. The continental breakfast was alright, I don't think I would have paid extra just for that breakfast. By the time we got there, most of the food was gone. However, since we had valet included in our package, it all worked out. I really wish the hotel had a swimming pool or hot tub, that would have been perfect! I highly recommend this hotel! Mostly to couples, because of the bathroom situation. It would be kind of awkward with anyone else. Overall, I loved it and will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great 'trendy' hotel, excellent service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: JB30
Reviews.Content: Nicely located hotel, near to the town centre and waterfront. Modern design, comfortable and spacious rooms with (partial) views of the harbour and park. Free bikes very useful. Can be expensive but you do get quality and service for that.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: DolfiRachelle
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying here that the toilets in the rooms don't work. Going to the restaurant for breakfast in the morning was disappointing when the greeter didn't want to seat us because the breakfast buffet closed in 15 minutes, so we left the hotel for breakfast - to another hotel nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Content: Loden Vancouver is a lovely contemporary boutique hotel, with the nicest of staff, terrific location and an amazing restaurant. Tableau is not to be missed. Rent bikes and ride along the ocean at Stanley Park . Highly recommend the entire package!

Reviews.Title: “Our anniversary at the Loden was a riot!”
Reviews.Author: englishtchr
Reviews.Content: Now, despite the fact that there was indeed a riot in Vancouver after the Stanley Cup finals on the night of our 20th anniversary, the Loden could not have been a more wonderful haven. Safely and wonderfully situated away from the one-night-only madness, the Loden is all the positive things that people have said in previous reviews. We had a tripadvisor coupon for a room upgrade, and since so many people had booked to stay during the hockey finals, we were going to have to switch rooms one night to be able to take advantage of the coupon until we mentioned to Adrian, the clerk at the front desk, that it was our 20th anniversary. He found an upgrade for us where we wouldn't have to move--the Zephyr suite, a one-bedroom suite on the 14th floor which had a view of the harbour and the mountains. Wow--those floor to ceiling windows are so cool! We could not have been more pleased! The room looks just as nice and modern as in the photos and was spotless. The staff couldn't have been more helpful--Adrian was who we talked with most often, and he gave us great recommendations on places to eat and areas to visit. Two others were helpful as well, but I've forgotten their names--Suzy (?), another front desk clerk from Australia (?) was wonderful as was the bell hop who helped us with the bikes we borrowed (complimentary from the Loden--just sign up for a free three hour tour with them--we took them around Stanley Park and had a great time!). We were looking forward to dining at Tableau, the restaurant connected to the hotel, as it had only recently opened, and it was okay. It wasn't bad by any means, and it wasn't overpriced, but it was an average meal. We really enjoyed our stay at the Loden, and if we were to visit beautiful Vancouver again, we would definitely stay at the Loden again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facilities and Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: malvern
Reviews.Content: What a great place. Rooms were beautiful, beds very comfortable. The concierge/staff were outstanding. Everything was "no worries." They booked dining reservations and tours -including a last minute sea plane excursion to Victoria with no problem. Great suggestions on things to do. Free wifi was a major plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE”
Reviews.Author: alwaysbetraveling
Reviews.Content: We got to the Loden on Christmas Eve, thus limiting options of eating late at night. At check in, our front desk person called a nearby restaurant, and got us reservations within 15 minutes! It was a wonderful suggestion, and we had a great meal. The staff was over the top friendly and helpful...so welcoming! They automatically hand you an umbrella as you're walking out when you don't even know it's raining. The location of the hotel was central to anything you may want to see or visit. Everything was within walking distance of this hotel. The room we had was a corner room with views of the city. With floor to ceiling windows, it was quite a view. The TV/desk corner was compact but spacious due to its placement. The fridge was quite a help to keep drinks cold. The marble bathroom was modern and spacious. With the shower and the toilet behind separate doors within the bathroom, it provided privacy without compromising effective usage. We LOVED the Loden, and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Vancouver. Thank you Loden for providing us a great "home" during our visit to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: MSherman7
Reviews.Content: We spent the first leg of our honeymoon in the Loden last September and can not recommend the hotel highly enough. Service was quite exceptional and the room was to a very high standard in decor and cleanliness. Well located to see all that Vancouver has to offer. This place is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmyurky
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - close to Gastown and lots of amenities within walking distance. Great sushi place across the street. Be sure to use the parkade across the street instead of valet ($47/night) compared to $17 for the parking lot across the street.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best hotel experiences....ever!!”
Reviews.Author: stargazer444
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden for one night at the end of an Alaskan cruise, and wish we could have stayed longer. The hotel is truly a five star experience. The staff is extremely accomodating and friendly without being pretentious. They obviously work very hard to make their guests feel comfortable and to solve problems quickly without incident. The concierge was also very helpful in making last minute reservations to a popular downtown restaurant on a busy Friday night. We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to an incredible corner suite on the 14th floor. The room had floor to ceiling windows with great views of downtown Vancouver. The room was beautifully furnished in a modern, warm style with a spa bathroom, and an absolutely amazing bed. Some of the little touches that put the hotel in a five star category include the fresh flowers in the room, slippers at the bedside, turndown service with fresh drinking water on the nightstand at bedtime, and of course a full "Wii Rockband" setup in the living room. I live in Las Vegas, and often stay at many of the so-called 5 star hotels here on the strip when they offer special deals to locals, and cannot remember an experience as rich and luxurious as the one at The Loden. I look forward to my next visit to Vancouver for hopefully a longer stay at The Loden.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: 010203lucy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 'girls" time in vancouver. We usually stay at another downtown hotel and decided to try somewhere different this time. What a nice surprise, the neighborhood was fabulous, close walking distance to everything we needed, restaurants, shopping, theatre and the water front. The staff were all so welcoming and couldn't do enough for us. It was the last game of the Stanley Cup playoffs and the staff in the restaurant attached did all they could to get us a place to sit to watch the game. Our room was so comfortable, fabulous bathroom, good lighting, lots of room in the room itself. Comfortable beds, good, quiet air conditioning as well as a window that opened. Anything we needed was brought up right away to the room, no waiting around. The staff tried to do their best to accomodate transportation to and from the theatre for us, we were given good information and acted upon it. Unfortunately the Vancouver riots happened and we had to walk back to the hotel as there were no cabs . Upon arrival back the front desk staff was very concerned and happy that that we had made it back safely. We could not hear any of the riot noise at all once back in the hotel and we felt very safe. It is a very quiet neighborhood. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, traveler, business person, weekend get-away....ticks off all the boxes for me...I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Short and Sweet”
Reviews.Author: greking
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Loden for one night, but it was perfect for our quick stay. Loved the morning Nespresso in the Lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! But not cheap.”
Reviews.Author: HawleyFord
Reviews.Content: Service was great! Hotel was gorgeous! Bill wasn't small, but I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative to larger downtown hotels nearby.”
Reviews.Author: ArchiChod
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a full-service luxury alternative to staying at the Fairmont or other luxury/business hotels in downtown Vancouver. The hotel is a little off the beaten path but is still an 8-minute walk to the Vancouver Convention Centre. It's a quoted hideout if you ate on a busy schedule. The hotel is a mere 3 minutes from Coal Harbour. The rooms are fresh, new and well taken care of on a twice-daily basis. Operable windows and lots of natural daylight make this facility a restful place to stay. The restaurant downstairs is a recent and fantastic place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “a real boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: natanina
Reviews.Content: After a first small problem, every think was great. The management is top level, the food is great and the room are just as quite as you can dream. next time in vancouver will in the loden for me

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Snowbeardude
Reviews.Content: Family stayed in 2 rooms for $400+/room/night. It certainly is a clean very chic hotel, but I would not recommend it for a family with small children. On a business trip, conference, or getaway with your significant other, it's nice. There doesn't seem to be a lot of accommodation for the little ones. Case in point: When we first arrived hungry and tired, and asked for child-approperate setting, we got sent to a bar full of cheering raucous patrons watching the Stanley Cup finals. Definitely not an appropriate place for hungry and tired kids. Even though we were the only people in the lobby, the entire checking in experience seemed a bit stand-offish. The wireless Internet would not connect with my AirPort but would with my iPhone and iPad, which was a bit weird. Overall the rooms are nicely appointed, with sort of a chic slightly retro feel (mostly due to the dark wood paneling that reminds me of some basements). Bathrooms are large. The king bed is pretty comfortable. But I don't think I ever got over the rather cold initial reception and the wild goose chase they sent us on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel With Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: ldiggy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in late May with my partner for a vacation in Vancouver. We absolutely loved the hotel. The room was beautiful and modern with great wall-to-ceiling windows offering a nice modern touch to the room. The service at the hotel was impeccable, with the staff willing to help you at every second. A nice touch was that they offer free bike rentals -- I would definitely recommend taking advantage of this and cruising out to beautiful Stanley Park which is nearby. Don't come here expecting a Vegas-style resort, however. The hotel is very small, and only has 1 restaurant, but if you know that ahead of time I think you will greatly enjoy this property. Can be a bit pricey though, i.e. paying for internet that should be free.

Reviews.Title: “A fresh new hotel that made us feel welcome.”
Reviews.Author: cbolz
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to shopping, dining, and the waterfront. The staff made us feel welcome from the check in to the check out. New contemporary metro design. Very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: lberghs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for a 2-night stay prior to an Alaskan cruise. We are very picky travelers, and were not disappointed in anything about the Loden. It reminded us of some of the "W" hotels we have stayed at. The staff was uber-helpful and attentive--we felt like they knew us--the location was excellent, centrally located to everything but on a nice, quiet street. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable. Whenever we returned from being out it was a pleasure to return to the Loden. Can't say enough great things about it!

Reviews.Title: “First class! Excellent location. Great staff”
Reviews.Author: SKAY18
Reviews.Content: This is a real gem of a hotel. Vancouverites are not aware of this hotel. It is a real find. Great everything- service/ambiance/buffet breakfast/doorman/valet parking. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “There are so many great things to say!”
Reviews.Author: whiteorchid2
Reviews.Content: Wanting to make the most of our two day stay in Vancouver, we flew in first thing in the morning. We arrived at the Loden sometime after 9 am, just expecting to have our bags stored until check-in later in the day, but to our delight, not only did they upgrade us to a Park Vista corner room, but they gave us the room right away! Floor to ceiling windows on two sides made the room bright and airy. The lovely ladies at the front desk were extremely polite, friendly, helpful and very professional. Being our first trip to Vancouver in decades, we were very appreciative of all the information they gave us - suggestions on where to eat and things to see and do during our stay. The treatment we received was very personalized, we were greeted each time we came and went, with the staff remembering our names and the fact that we were in Vancouver to see the Kid Rock concert! It was also convenient to use the complimentary Loden car service to get to the concert, saving us the hassle and expense of a cab ride.
