We were very pleased with our room, it felt spacious and modern, but very comfortable. The bed and linens were luxurious and the room was so quiet, it felt as if we were the only guests at the hotel! The bathroom was sparkling clean and reminicent of a high end spa, with the marble floor, square vessel sink and contemporary fixtures. We ate lunch one day at Tableau and even though we hadn't made reservation, and they were very busy with the corporate lunch crowd, they found us a table and seated us right away. The service there was excellent and the food was tasty. The Mushrooms on Toast was to die for, must be tried if you go there! Over all, we were extremely happy with our entire stay, not one negative thing to say, highly reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: seashelllz
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about my stay at The Loden. The staff was extremely friendly, professional and courteous. The room was beautiful and stocked with all the amenities I could need including a large umbrella, clothes steamer, hair dryer, etc. The bed was so comfortable I fell asleep within seconds!

Reviews.Title: “I'LL BE BACK!”
Reviews.Author: IIDannyII
Reviews.Content: Its a great hotel. The restaurant downstairs is just as great. Def. recommend to get the breakfast package!. The bed was very comfortable and very welcoming after a long day of walking around the city. They also offer a complimentary bike if u want to ride around the city, which unfortunately i was unable to do so, due to an injured foot. They also have cabs waiting outside almost all the time. The room was amazing, love the sliding door, it opens up the room. You can also watch TV while ur in the tub having a beer and it has surround sound in the bathroom, so u dont have to worry about not being able to hear the tv. Very comfortable complimentary robe. Nice size closets. Maintenance workers sometimes leave a special surprise for when u return to your room, which is always nice. Its NOT the last time i'll be staying at the Loden Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very chic with central location”
Reviews.Author: Red2014
Reviews.Content: The Loden made our stay in Vancouver easy and enjoyable. From the moment we checked in, they offered fantastic service. Without being asked, they offered to set up several different day trips for us. We were only able to take one, but it was fantastic and completely worth the expense. The rooms are beautiful, if slightly more modern than my taste. The location was wonderful! It is very central and an easy distance to the water, Stanley Park, Robson Street, and public transportation. The regular price for rooms here would have been slightly prohibitive for us, but they offer multiple sales and opportunities for discounts. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “I Wish We Had Booked More Than Just One Night!”
Reviews.Author: JYTrip24
Reviews.Content: Having just gotten off a cruise ship at Canada Place, gone through U.S. Customs, and whisked off the pier by an eager cabbie, we were totally unprepared for what we were about to discover at the Loden. After 10 days of pampering on a Pacific coastal cruise, one would think it'd be hard for a hotel to impress during just a 1 night stay. The Loden did just that. From the moment we arrived we knew we had chosen someplace special. Our numerous bags were aboard the luggage trolley and inside the hotel before we had paid for the cab. The bellman provided better service and more information than one gets from some 5 star lodge concierges. Our bags were thoughtfully placed out of the way yet accessible as soon as we entered our requested high floor room. The layout was modern, stylish and chic, yet not over the top. The marble bath was superb with a unique configuration which allowed for either privacy or access giving the space an unusual open air feeling not found in most hotel baths. Once slipped on, you surely will not want to remove one of the luxurious robes provided for your stay. Lounging on the settee, a special touch, positioned next to the floor-to-ceiling windows, we overlooked the harbor and nearby snow capped mountains, Vancouver is a beautiful city, with many sights to see and fabulous places to visit. Whenever we return, and we one day will, we shall surely book again at The Loden, only next time, certainly for more than just one night!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Loden”
Reviews.Author: CountryintheCity
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Loden as first time visitors to Vancouver. This hotel is exceptional. The staff are extremely friendly and more than willing to help out in any way possible. The restaurant "Tableau", had reopened the same weekend we visited and it was delightful - for dinner and continental breakfast. (Prices were reasonable.) You can't beat this hotel's location and the value is almost unheard of. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kristin924
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice of the Loden hotel for our first stay in Vancouver. We were able to walk to all the places we wanted to see in downtown Vancouver. We took the seaplane from Victoria to Vancouver harbor and were able to walk to the hotel with our luggage and then walk to the Canadian Line to return to the airport so no car was needed. The room was beautiful though slightly small but the bathroom was large and very nice. We also really enjoyed the restaurant at the hotel, best food we ate in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geri66
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Boutique hotel with a great location.(close to Coal Harbour, Stanley Park, Downtown, shopping). It has a great new restaurant, great gym facilities, friendly, helpful staff. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Was pretty good, not as good as expected...”
Reviews.Author: squall1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. I liked the location which is great for anything downtown or near the convention center. The room was pretty good, well thought out and very clean. Good fitness room and quiet too. Things that irked me, and I am being picky here, but when I stay someplace with this reputation....well... 1. The room service is awful. If you are going to offer it, do it right. It took too long for orders to come up and whenever I called (3 times) they would actually put me on hold to "check and see if we can do it". What? They made me feel like the weirdo for asking for a service they supposedly offered. And I would always be transferred no matter which button I pressed on the phone (room service, restaurant, front desk). And the pizza, take it off the menu...just horrible. 2. When delivering a wake up call, don't just say "hello". Something like "Good morning, this is your wake up call, have a nice day" would work a little better. 3. The bed was a little lumpy to me and the curtains didn't block the outside light at the top, which again is a personal peeve of mine. 4. The bartender was just off. Just kind of introverted and strange. I don't need you to talk my ear off, but at least act like you have the slightest interest in making sure I feel welcome. 4. HDTV with no HD channels. 5. Charging for internet, really? Come on! At half the price of my usual hotel (Shangri-La), it should be a bargain, but I left with the feeling of "I got what I paid for". It doesn't have to be that way, all of the stuff that bothered me might not bother others, but these are minor things that are easy to fix and would go along way for me.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great”
Reviews.Author: urbannomad69
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. The rooms are very quiet and clean. They need to iron out a few kinks that would make it better for a business traveller: ironing board + iron in the room would be nice rather than a steamer and a coffee machine. The other small detail that they could attend to is the doors are very heavy - which makes for a quiet sleep however they slam with great force that is audible in other rooms. But overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: KrystalEdwards
Reviews.Content: I flew in and out within 24 hours and when I arrived to the hotel, my room was not ready but then again I was early. The receptionists were wonderful and told me my room would be ready in an hour. I had been traveling for 7 hours and I was hungry, so they gave me a few suggestions. The location of this the Loden is perfect!! I went and ate and found some great shopping nearby then came back to the hotel to check in. I was surprised at the size of my room. The bed was so comfortable and I absolutely had to take a bath in the huge bath tub! I will be returning to Vancouver at the end of May to go on a cruise and I am already booked at another hotel (recommended from the cruise line) however I have not booked the last night of my stay from our cruise and I believe I will stay here! My stay here was a delight and I will defiantly stay again upon my return.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Quiet, Beautiful - yes, yes and yes!”
Reviews.Author: dawninto
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel - fab service, great location, super sheik, modern but warm rooms, awesome deep bathtubs. I loved the Loden and will stay there the next time I'm in Vancouver! Wish there was one in every city I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Loden”
Reviews.Author: JPHokie_79
Reviews.Content: Booked the Loden for a recent conference when not one of the 18 Fairmont hotels in Vancouver was available at conference rates. Sure glad we did! This hotel is as convenient to the VCC, restaurants and hot spots as any of the local mega-properties, but it's intimate, quiet and posh. The staff was friendly and attentive, knowledgeable and spot-on with suggestions. And the hotel car service came in handy for a last minute jump to the bus/ferry station. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: LannaBaird
Reviews.Content: The Loden is a beautiful hotel and the staff are very helpful. They went out of their way to find a restaurant reservation for us. We will be back for sure! The location is excellent, right in the center of downtown. The new restaurant attached to the hotel is also excellent

Reviews.Title: “Swanky spot in a choice location”
Reviews.Author: akatkin
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay and loved the hotel. The rooms are a little on the small side but brillaintly laid-out.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Decor Complimented with Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: RowdyRiderFan
Reviews.Content: Views from the hotel are wonderful from the North side. security is high, your room key is needed to access your floor No amenities in the room like coffee makers or fridges but you can get a coffee from the lobby in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel! well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: rosebud383
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here! We had a Park Vista room--looks exactly like the photos on the hotel's website. Awesome deep tub and modern bathroom fixtures. The Loden provided any amenity you could want. Great gym with a wide variety of excellent equipment. Can't wait to return for another romantic indulgent weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable 30th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: NMilt
Reviews.Content: We got married at this hotel in October 2010. We returned in February 2011 to celebrate my 30th birthday. The hotel is spectacular! We stayed in the Luxe Suite for two nights and experienced the kind of service that you would expect from one of the top rated boutique luxury hotels in the country. The room was beautiful, the location is superb, and the staff are excellent! We will certainly stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully designed and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Luchko
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the hotel, courteous staff and amenities. One of the best hotels I have stayed at. Felt like home away from home. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very designy boutique hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: SwissTraveler67
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel in the internet and were very happy about our decision. It's a very nice boutique hotel in the center of Vancouver, near by the harbour. Perfect for business oder holiday stays. Very modern rooms, good gym facilities. The breakfast buffet good be a little bit larger. We had a problem with the TV which could not be fixed as soon I excepted.

Reviews.Title: “Completely exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: GenevieveW12
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at this hotel again the next time I'm in Vancouver. What a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish and good service”
Reviews.Author: deniseWien
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay in the Loden. The one bedroom suite is beautifully done and big enough to have a family of four wihout feeling cramped. Very friendly and helpful staff and good central location. no complaints, and we are quite picky usually..!

Reviews.Title: “woderful”
Reviews.Author: BubnDi
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Staff were kind, generous with information and their time, the room was beautiful and the location - well -- perfect for me. I am a walker and a people watcher - it was great.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisI999
Reviews.Content: The Loden hotel is in a great location, very quiet and surrounded by new codos not ugly commercial buildings. The rooms are beautiful, very, very clean as is the entire hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The cost of the rooms are very reasonable for what we get. The hotel is not too large so there are not throngs of people hanging around the lobby, which is a good thing for us. There really is nothing to complain about The Loden, which is very rare for us. We totally enjoyed the whole experience, and will return again this year. Stanley Park and Coal Harbour are blocks away, and the location is on a quiet street with litte traffic. There's even a Starbucks on the same block, once the staff puts away the free Nespresso.

Reviews.Title: “They surpassed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: wdunlop
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Loved the location and the service was great. I was treated with great respect...

Reviews.Title: “It does not get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: Paolosmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be the benchmark for great service, rooms and location. It is worth going to Vancouver to experience the great coffee machines in the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “I wish there was a higher rating for The Loden! Outstanding accommodation and stellar service!”
Reviews.Author: Heatherkohler
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this hotel! Even though the dining room is still under construction, I would not hesitate to recommend this place! Fantastic location, and huge value.

Reviews.Title: “I like Loden Vancouver hotel , it's amazing and wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: AbuYara
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, nice location and view as well, located to all points we need.

Reviews.Title: “recent stay”
Reviews.Author: cbhpoole
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly impressed with the Loden Hotel. From the warm lobby, up the magnetic key activated elevators to the large gorgeous rooms. The management has thought of everything. There were slippers by the bed, Wi games on the big screen and a sound system through-out. The staff was sincere and very willing to help. I’d say their training was top notch. Location was prefect too.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice room in a class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hokemon
Reviews.Content: We got a king room for $149 + tax through a special and were very happy with our stay. Staff was courteous, the room amenities were great (especially the bathroom...very swanky) and the overall stay was as good as it gets for this kind of hotel. The valet parking fee of $35 is a little steep, in my opinion, but parking downtown in Vancouver is not cheap to begin with. When we phoned down for our car it never took more than 5 minutes to have it brought around. We will definitely try and stay at the Loden again if we can find another deal like the one we got. Great bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect luxury weekend”
Reviews.Author: woob1
Reviews.Content: Our splurge weekend at the Loden was amazing. The room was one of the nicest I've ever stayed in. I think it's a genius idea to make the rooftop level rooms into special garden rooms. The front desk girl was incredible, she recommended several wonderful places to go and made all of the reservations for us. A few minor downsides: The "spa" was just a spare room in the fitness center. It's not particularly relaxing to wait in the hallway to the fitness center before a massage. Additionally, the massage people clearly didn't know the policy/packages of the hotel. We had a sauna session included in our stay, and they told us that to use it was going to cost extra, so we skipped it. Later the front desk called us to apologize and tell us it was free and we could use it any time, but we didn't want to go back to the "spa" area after our massages so we skipped it. The taxes for the parking and hotel cost were substantial, and not included in the reservation summary. Together, they added at least an additional 20% onto the total cost of the trip, on top of parking. If the hotel has to have those taxes, fine, but it would be nice to know about them upfront, so they don't come as a surprise at the end of a wonderful trip. Finally, the "temporary dining" solution in the suite is terrible. I went up and tried to grab some coffee and OJ to take back to the room, and it caused such a complication amongst the staff I just left and went to the Starbucks on the corner. It was unclear to me whether there was room service available during the reconstruction of the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogerws_11
Reviews.Content: I stay here whenever I'm in Vancouver. Great location downtown, nice staff and service

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful big City Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Edge2Edge
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Loden in Vancouver and definitely not our last. Everyone was very welcoming especially Guest Experience Manager Adrienne. He gave us a lot of good tip's what to do in Vancouver. It is great that they are doggy friendly, so next time we will bring our dog with us. We enjoyed our Breakfast buffet with fresh salmon, pastry's, fresh fruits... The Fitness room is great with brand new equipment. The Hotel is Down Town so you can walk everywhere. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: BranNewareAtl
Reviews.Content: This property is a beautiful boutique hotel and immaculately decorated. We had a corner room on a high floor with two walls of windows that provided a great view of the city and Coal Harbour. It was fun to watch the sea planes landing and taking off in the distance. I would certainly recommend this to everyone. It was very centrally located and an easy distance to great shopping, restaurants, and pretty much everything else you would want in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the feel!”
Reviews.Author: copgirl99
Reviews.Content: This was just a weekend trip but we were very impressed. Nice and convenient to shopping and the water. The staff was very helpful and polite. We used the gym, which was outfitted fairly well, big windows and lots of space. The hotel restaurant was closed for renovations, which is our only complaint. They tried to create another eating area, which was a suite. A little too close quarters for us, so we only used it the first night we were there. Overall, we'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, nice spacious room and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: brettnjess
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our room, it was spacious and reasonably modern in design. The room was very quiet and we were able to open the windows to let fresh air into the room. Most of all, the bed was very comfortable. If you enjoy a run in the morning, the hotel is located in a great spot, not far from the water front and Stanley Park. The staff there were friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted...surpassed expectations!”
Reviews.Author: JammieMeoita
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location...walked to great restaurants,shopping,Stanley Park etc. Staff was incredibly helpful with restaurant suggestions or anything that you needed. Rooms were very clean and quiet. Great beds and loved the spacious bathroom. We would definately stay at the Loden again,

Reviews.Title: “I totally enjoyed staying here!!!”
Reviews.Author: alexwojto
Reviews.Content: Staff totally nice and rooms very comfortable for a mong stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: gordon_eric
Reviews.Content: Staff was exceptional. All the bellmen were very informative and helped my wife and I out in finding excellent restaurants and suggestions for activities.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaroPanda
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Loden for two nights before heading up to Whistler for a ski holiday. The hotel's location is pretty great: all major attractions are in walking distance. The room itself was pretty generous and the bathroom was gorgeous. The hotel charged for its wifi, which I thought was a bit strange for a boutique hotel. The hotel's bar/restaurant is also currently undergoing a renovation. The hotel had a makeshift breakfast room / evening lounge set up in the Penthouse. The breakfast was not included in our room rate, which we didn't realize until after we'd already eaten. The spread was good, but not mind-blowing (bagels, cereal, etc.) and certainly not worth $17/person. We also stopped by the makeshift lounge for after dinner drinks and were somewhat shocked by the prices for glasses of wine ($17/glass of Malbec). Overall, the hotel is a hip little spot with comfortable rooms. We booked our stay through a deal on Jetsetter.com and probably would stay here again if we found similar rates. I would not pay over $175/night to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ollyhughes
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to Vancouver for business very frequently over the past three years. I have stayed at many of the cities "luxury" hotels. In my opinion none are as good as The Loden. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and very well appointed. The location is in the heart of downtown. There is an excellent 24hr gym with all the equipment you would expect to find in a good health club. The only negative is the dining facilities. Voya restaurant was good, but on my last visit was closed for refurbishment, and the hotel penthouse was temporarily turned into the hotel restaurant. I expect on my next stay that the new restaurant will be open even better than before.

Reviews.Title: “Such a wonderful stylish small hotel”
Reviews.Author: thamerbak
Reviews.Content: It is small quite luxury hotel. I spent 2 nights with my wife and daughter. I like the cleanliness and the location. Stuff where very nice, kind, and helpful. Ive tried staying in garden type room which is really nice and large. There is no swimming pool. Very good gym. They are charging a lot for parking and in-room internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but wait till the restaurant reopens”
Reviews.Author: m0ntesansavin0
Reviews.Content: The room ( I had a a corner room) had a large bed desk and a flat screen TV with wiring to connect you computer.The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was well arranged with large shower and a separate bath. Housekeeping changed towels and organized the room twice a day, bringing a carafe of water for night time (good thought). It is a quiet location in downtown and I slept very well. My only problem was that the hotel on ly had a very small room for breakfast and evening snack and drinks. The restaurant next door was being renovated. Neither the breakfast nor the drinks area was very appealing. When the restaurant reopens it will be a great place to stay and I would go there again. The staff were helpful and charming. I had to pay for the internet in the room which given the hotel price should be included!

Reviews.Title: “We always stay at the Loden...Always improving their quarters”
Reviews.Author: SUNSHINEWindsor
Reviews.Content: Spring time bicycle rentals to adventure the sea wall. Helmuts and locks with superb ride. Pet friendly with comforts away from home...doggy bed...bowls and friendly greetings :)..Reno's are always foing on...always a good reason to return :)

Reviews.Title: “Refined comfort, modern vibe, excellent staff in a jewel of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarollFitz
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about the experience of staying at the Loden — lovely decor and details. Small and comfortable. Stylish but unpretentious. Excellent staff. If you are looking for a tiny, quiet but boutique in the middle of Vancouver — try this place!

Reviews.Title: “A.M.A.Z.I.N.G!”
Reviews.Author: lisawillis23
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Loden was perfect is every way! We visited for the weekend in Feb. Stunning decore, incredible service, perfect location .. on and on! We want to give a special shout out to Brian -- he exceeded expectations every minute of every day with suggestions on where to go, where to eat, what to do ... all while providing the most positve, friendly and helpful service. So happy we always know where we will stay when visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, well located, attentive service”
Reviews.Author: DManToronto_Ontario
Reviews.Content: The place is brand new, looks great, is comfortable and nicely styled. The view out of my corner room was spectacular and light-filled. All staff are very attentive, friendly and eager to please. Every aspect of the trip was great.

Reviews.Title: “im a regular and as always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: smenke
Reviews.Content: Great stay and will be back I am a late night guy so room service would be better for me later The bar is great, good staff I stay at a few places regularly and you are one of them

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: branbud
Reviews.Content: Until now, our favourite boutique hotel in Vancouver has been Opus. But in our opinion the Loden has taken over that title. Service is fantastic. Every staff member seemed to know our name from the moment we arrived. We were traveling with our baby and every baby-related request was met with a smile. When we asked if the kitchen could steam and puree a vegetable the chef came out to see us. 20 minutes later a custom made mashed potato/kale/garlic dish arrived in our room. The whole stay was filled with experiences like that. The Loden is located a few minutes walk from Stanley Park and Robson Street. So, unless you would really prefer to be in Yaletown, it's perfect for any visitor to downtown Vancouver. We'll definitely be staying there again. The only negative is that the lobby restaurant was closed for renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, new and clean.. great service!”
Reviews.Author: CarlosLomeliA
Reviews.Content: There's no pool in this Hotel... but if you feel like you don't need one, it's the perfect place to stay... service it's very good, the place looks new and the rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: SConthemove
Reviews.Content: Based on the rave reviews, I stayed at The Loden for a 4 night trip while attending a conference. I was impressed from check-in to check-out. Service was excellent. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The attention to small details was evident. Rooms were made up quickly and with nice touches. There is an umbrella in the room for your use and the TV/entertainment system is perfect. They went as far as to lend me cable so I was able to watch movies from my Mac. Restaurant is under renovation but the Penthouse continental breakfast was more than adequate as was the 24 hour in-room dining. Location is great for the convention centre, shopping, dining and Stanley Park. Recommend this hotel highly and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Move over Four Seasons Hualalai my new fav!”
Reviews.Author: shudathotathat
Reviews.Content: Attentive without being obtrusive. Everyone from housekeeper to bartender were exceptional. Rooms outstanding. Adrien was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesTy
Reviews.Content: The Loden lived up to expectations. It is a small gem that's a couple of blocks off from the main streets and the harbor. The service was wonderful and all the staff attentive and very pleasant. My room (a signature king in the corner) was not particularly large, but so well designed and beautifully appointed that I didn't care about the size. I loved the large flatscreen LCD into which I could plug my iPod, the turndown service was great. Finally, it had one of the best workout rooms I've ever used at a hotel. I have only two tiny complaints. One is that there is no coffeemaker in the room (although there is a great cappucino machine in the lobby that serves free coffee). I do like not having to go downstairs for this, however. Second, the safe, although not tiny, would not accommodate my laptop.... Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable and clean rooms, our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: pam_holloway
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with you for our past 3 visits to Vancouver. The staff go above and beyond and are very friendly and knowledgeable. Everything from great room service to credible recommendations of restaurants in the area. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. We feel at home when we stay at the Loden.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime2000
Reviews.Content: We had a great quick trip to Vancouver and stayed at the Loden. Overall it was a good experience. The staff is friendly and helpful unlike some boutique hotel staff. It's also centrally located in downtown Vancouver near all the banks, law firms etc. The only downside is that there's no restaurant on site as there are doing renovations. And, if you stay on on the lower floors you can hear the construction from the restaurant and across the street. The noise level was moderate during the daytime but quiet in the evenings and early morning.

Reviews.Title: “VANCOUVERS GREAT LITTLE SECRET”
Reviews.Author: stuartrp
Reviews.Content: wonderful little hotel, great friendly, personable and helpful staff, go above and beyond to please. very helpful and informative pay attention to details, would definitely recommend to friends and would return if back in Vancouver. good value, good location close to most amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a Valentine Visit”
Reviews.Author: hestonpreston
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed our stay at the Loden. Minor glitch that the dining room was under construction as we had dined here before and had very much enjoyed it. That said, there was no noise and there's lots of great eateries within walking distance. The room was excellent, very comfortable and a nice sleek design and the sliding doors bathroom was a nice feature. Bed very comfortable and the air conditioning worked well and wasn't too noisy. We stayed for Valentines on a package that included valet parking, movie, champagne, chocolate strawberries and a red rose. Nice touch. Staff were very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbie & salim
Reviews.Content: What a nice find in downtown Vancouver so close to everything and had a wonderful suite for our early Valentine day, the suite was so lovely, and the bathroom was beautiful along with the champagne and goodies. We live in Vancouver and not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Great”
Reviews.Author: cormacc
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here quite a few times on business and have never been disappointed. Consistently high standards in all respects and exceptionally friendly staff. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Chazel134
Reviews.Content: Located well within walking distance (for those who like to walk) to Stanley Park, Robson St., Yaletown. Staff was quick, courteous, patient and knowledgeable which was appreciated. Definitely will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if your in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Ontheway75
Reviews.Content: I was down in Vancouver for a week on Vacation with my girlfriend. After reading some reviews online I decided on staying here. The Location is great, especially if your into shopping during the day, and going out later to enjoy the Nightlife. The Price is reasonable, and the beds are super comfy. I'll consider staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bweeks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our time at the Loden Hotel. We had excellent customer service and felt like royalty on our anniversary! Thank you to the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: jeff_fma
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed in the Loden Signature King room. The room was great with modern style and features very comfortable bedding and pillows, beautiful washroom, dimming lights, large windows, connections for electronics on desk, e.g. USB and large LCD TV. The little things like subtle music in played in the hallways, I could go on... The service was great. I asked to check into my room at 12PM, however the room was still being cleaned. My bags were stored. About one hour later I received a phone call on my mobile that my room was ready. A cot was also given to me as I told my cousin and his gf they could stay with me after needing a place to stay when his gf's air mexicana flight was cancelled due to bankruptcy. This was at no extra charge. Hotel staff also delivered a connection cord to allow us to watch a movie from my Macbook to the TV. In no time they brought the cord to my room and helped connect the laptop to the TV. When I stayed at the hotel for the first time in March 2010 a fire alarm went off at 230AM in the morning. The next evening I was delighted to find a small sample plate of great tasting desserts waiting in my room along with a letter of apology for the fire alarm. I enjoyed having breakfast at the Voya restaurant, not many people, very quiet. The service was a little slower for not having many people in the restaurant. I am a little disappointed that in room internet is not free however there is a business room where a computer with internet access can be used. The gym looks well equipped with the latest cardio equipment. The location of the hotel is a close walk to Stanley Park and close to the Burrard Skytrain, convenient if you have no car. I did not use valet parking because I walked the city. I will definitely stay at the hotel again, next time I'm in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for an urban retreat”
Reviews.Author: mmwong
Reviews.Content: Just spent a lovely weekend at the Loden. Loved that it was a few streets away from Robson, close enough to walk there in a few minutes but away from the flurry of activity there. Delightful, functional, well designed room with a great bathroom. Loved the super snazzy modern bath faucet! Everything was there but tucked away thoughtfully. We used the business center a few times for the internet and no one was ever there. Also went to the fitness center every day and had it to myself. There could be a helpful map, if there was one I didn't see one that would let you know what restaurants, markets and shopping are within a 6 block radius. Next time we will check out restaurants on Alberni Street.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: jaardi
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I've stayed at the Loden. I love this hotel - it's small and on a quiet street, but close to everything in Vancouver. The staff is consistently friendly and professional. The room is large and luxurious, the bathroom is great - my only minor peeve is that the faucet and sink are designed so that there tends to be water all over the counter! But it sure looks good! Parking (other than the valet - which I didn't take advantage of) is always a challenge in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NaomiThomas
Reviews.Content: I won a contest awhile back and the prize was a night at the Loden plus up to $50 for breakfast at Voya. I booked the hotel on the night of my anniversary and my husband and I spent a lovely evening. The hotel is centrally located with lots of dining options around, and the concierge was helpful with her suggestions. The hotel room itself was very chic & classy, with a great view, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We did find the room too warm and had a hard time falling asleep despite having a window open (and it's January). My husband attempted to turn the heat down but it appeared to be centrally controlled, not controlled by room. I did not call the front desk to complain however - perhaps there would have been a solution if we had. The only negative was their limited menu due to the temporary closure of their restaurant for renovations. We were disappointed because our prize included breakfast at Voya, and instead the only option presented to us was the continental breakfast ($15 value) which I only I participated in. It was nice as continental breakfasts go, but was a disappointment as we were looking forward to a hot breakfast for 2 worth $50. Other than that letdown which was only b/c of renovations, it was a worthwhile experience in a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern style, classic service”
Reviews.Author: phantom6e
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write this review about six months ago, but just didn't get around to it. Better late than never. The Loden had a great modern feel and a staff that was very helpful in directing us around Vancouver as we had never stayed downtown. They suggested a couple good dining options (although they recommended options more pricey than I wanted to spend). The complementary cab car and bicycles are a nice touch and allowed us to get around town efficiently and tour Stanley Park. The only thing I didn't like was the location. It is near Robson Street and Stanley Park, but it felt more like the business district. I would have liked the vibe to be a bit more like the Yaletown area. However, this was a fantastic experience and I would recommend it to couples looking for a romantic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I can't compliment this hotel or its staff enough.”
Reviews.Author: eyebehold
Reviews.Content: I booked a package from luxurylink.com which included my breakfast, parking, internet, and a $100 dining credit and three nights for a very reasonable fee. I didn't think I would get my first choice of dates because I chose to stay on New Years Eve simply because I figured they could make much more money on the rooms that night, but they let me have it. I can't express how helpful the staff was, they were eager to do their job, and more with a smile. Every person I met knew my first and last name, my room number, what I told them the day before, and always had a great recommendation for me. I can't remember staying with anyone else who had a greater staff. . I am trying my best to describe the experience, but they are in a class of their own and my vocabulary does not match the description it is worthy of. If you have a chance to stay here, do it. You will leave with a smile and warm feeling.

Reviews.Title: “hip, yet friendly downtown Vancouver boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukie10
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decor, comfy beds, but most importantly, super-friendly and helpful staff make this a great choice to stay when in beautiful Vancouver. I stayed on a "shopping package", even though there for work, and it had lots of benefits, like credit for food and beverages in the lovely "Voya" restaurant next door, free Wi-Fi in room (which I didn't use) and valet parking (which I did use, and was great). Would definitely return there over the big chain hotels, mostly for the personalised service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Heaven”
Reviews.Author: jammarkin
Reviews.Content: From the valet to the front desk to the breakfast room hostess to the lounge host, the service was warm, friendly and professional with a "can do" approach. Needs and desires were anticipated. The Luna suite was just beautiful. Wish we could have stayed a week!

Reviews.Title: “An attractive comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karl_BKK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. The adjoining restaruant was still under renovation. A limited room service menu was available. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed, though they lack a coffee maker. Valet parking is quite expensive ($35) so i would suggest booking a package that includes parking. The same goes for the broadband connection. Fortunately, the front desk offered such a package deal to me when I complained about the high cost of these extras. They have free coffee service set up in the lobby in the morning, but for the cost of the hotel, I feel it should include some kind of simple continental breakfast. Overall, we had a pleasant stay at the Loden and would book there again if i return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Comfortable and Well Designed”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGalxo
Reviews.Content: Amazing Location - so close to Stanley park and the view of the Harbor is around the corner. They even have bikes you can rent (no charge) to explore all Vancouver has to offer. The rooms - fab. Gorgeous design, modern, but inviting. The bathroom is a dream. The bed was so comfortable. Made our 2 night stay so so enjoyable. The service was great - they remember and address you by name, the gentleman who served us at the lounge/bar was professional, but a good conversationalist when it came to telling you how a drink is made, and its origin/history. Also made a few good recommendations for dinner. Such a good holiday! This hotel will definitely be on the list to re-discover. Enjoy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular room and service”
Reviews.Author: pat26044
Reviews.Content: The interior design was sumptuous and very comfortable. The room's size was generous, the bed very comfortable and the bathroom was superb. I would stay here again without reservation. Service was knowledgable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The most well designed and luxurious hotel room I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: PaulJohn58
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a real gem in the heart of Vancouver's trendy downtown and short walking distance to the business area. The staff are friendly and courteous and go out of their way to ensure that you are well taken care of. The room was ideal for either business or leisure travel. The design, decor and furniture in the room were most impressive. Especially the bathroom with a full soaker bath, separate shower and toilet stalls with floor to ceiling glass doors. The large floor to ceiling sliding doors at the entrance of the bathroom and the opening in front of the sink into the room allowed you to keep an open concept or close for privacy as desired. I wish I was staying longer so I could have enjoyed it more and experience the Voyu restaurant. I will definitley stay at the Loden again for business and leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room, Friendly staffs, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: dianewei525
Reviews.Content: The room is well decorated and we love the floor plan which makes the room seemed pretty large.The staffs are super friendly, the valet parking is awesome. Breakfast was served in one of the penthouse due to remodeling of the restaurant. However, it was still great (both the food and environment) Loden will definitely be the place I stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: dguz
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, this was the 3rd time i have stayed here. i have stayed in both the 1 bedroom suite and the corner suites. Both rooms were beautiful and the staff are beyond nice!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet. Central. Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: Housekittycat
Reviews.Content: The new slogan of the Loden "Quiet. Central. Beautiful." perfectly describes this amazing boutique hotel. The location is second to none, with restaurants, shopping, scenery, coffee houses and parks all just a couple of blocks away in any direction that you start out in. We had a suite again and it was spacious, beautiful, clean and perfect for entertaining. We had family and friends in town while we were there and it was nice to hang out in the living room of the suite without feeling cramped. The staff is indescribable with their bubbly personalities, genuine interest in your comfort, and knowledgeable of the best things to do while in beautiful Vancouver. Our only disappointment was the Voya was closed for renovations during our stay, as that restaurant and bar are amazing! Though they did have a SkyBar upstairs in the penthouse, so that was a neat way to showcase the penthouse and still offer limited menu and drinks. Room service was still available and wonderful every time! The fitness room is well equipped and I utilized the spa during our stay this time. It is not a day spa, as there is no steam room or other spa-like amenities, but it was wonderfully convenient to stroll downstairs for a massage and facial (both were excellent!) then head back up to our room to get ready for the day. This was our second stay at this hotel and we are looking forward to next vacation up to Canada to stay here again. There is no better place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Naguchi
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel near park, waterfront, and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maxhiker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Loden over New Years for 3 nights and thought it was a great hotel for the money. Centrally located and in walking distance to many points of interest. I didn't eat on property so can't rate the F&B but the restaurant was just about to be renovated; continental breakfast is currently being served in a suite. Parking was kind of pricey - as expected - but there is a public parking structure right next door for about $25 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: lizzylouwarren
Reviews.Content: The Loden was a wonderful place to stay. The staff were helpful and down to earth. If I even looked lost the staff was there willing to help out. My room was beautiful and comfortable. I will stay at The Loden next time I'm in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Staycation Luxury”
Reviews.Author: akw-travel
Reviews.Content: Grandparents visited Vancouver over the Christmas holiday and so we left the kids with them and my wife and I had a night away. After considering the Shangri-La and and the Fairmont Pacific Rim I settled on the Loden because of other reviews and the fact that it was quite a bit cheaper. The room was great, the bed was excellent, and the staff were really helpful. The only annoyance I can think of from the trip is that there are no coffee makers in the room, and there was no indication that there was morning coffee and tea available in the lobby -- I would have run down and grabbed one much earlier. Walking distance to great food and movies. I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “this is our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel2040
Reviews.Content: Love then location and all ammenities..this still feels brand new and we are always telling our friends about it. For sure he best fitness center of any hotel! Very modern, very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good service, but should pay attention to maintenance.”
Reviews.Author: RWF_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loden on August 24, 2010 for one night on my way to Japan for business. I booked directly with the hotel through their website and received a discounted rate for a Signature King room. The staff was very friendly and professional upon check-in and check-out. I was, however, a bit disappointed when first entering the room to see that I had been put in a "downsized" room. By this, I mean it did not appear to be as large as the Signature King rooms in the photos on the website and it lacked the seating area with sofa which I had believed was standard for this room type (once again based on the photos from the website). That being said, it was a very minor issue and did not at all stop me from enjoying the comfort of my room. As many people have commented, the interior design, decor, and furnishings are modern yet retro at the same time. My room, including the bathroom/toilet area, was spotlessly clean. On the other hand, I am aftraid that without regular and frequent upkeep and attention to detail the rooms could start to become rather dated and worn. For a new hotel, I noticed that the fabric on the armchair in my room was already starting to wear. In addition, I noticed that the wood panelling was starting to fade in areas and was slightly damaged with scuff marks, nicks, and scratches. Finally, I also remarked that although the bathroom was very clean, the caulking around the bathtub was starting to peel and some of the granite (marble?) used in the bathroom appeared damaged, similar to how water damage on wooden furniture appears. Once again, given that the hotel is only a couple years old, the condition of the room was for the most part above average, but as I wrote above, perhaps a bit more attention to little details like this would help to keep the rooms from looking rundown in the future. To sum up, the staff and the service are excellent and the rooms are very reasonably priced for a hotel of this quality. I just hope that the quality can be maintained as I would like to continue to stay at the Loden whenever I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: KriaSeattle
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location-close to shopping (Robson St) and Stanley Park. Hotel staff was very friendly and they upgraded our room from our tripadvisor free upgrade we printed. Room was great-had the king suite-very spacious and really modern feeling.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ehoeter
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful time staff are fantastic rooms are great as well as decor!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel. Must stay if traveling to Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: carole_chi09
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Great service. So clean & nice and yet the price is amazing. I would expect to pay 2 or 3 times as much. Great location. Close to the water and park. Also close cabs to other fun neighborhoods. Excellent restaurant attached and in walking distance to coffee and other cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Moved from overbooked Opus Hotel, thanks for that!”
Reviews.Author: EL_Oslo
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 had originally booked 4 single rooms at the Opus Hotel, but upon arrival the hotel had oversold, and the front desk manager offered us a complimentary first night at either the Fairmont or the Loden Hotel. We chose the Loden, and did not regret at all. The Opus staff drove us over in their brand new Porsche Cayenne (credits for that, Opus), and we were greeted warm welcome at the Loden by an upgrade. All of us got corner rooms, with great view and atmosphere. Beds were super, bathroom huge, and all-in-all a very nice, stylish, modern and comfortable hotel. Breakfast was also great, but they need to work on their wine prices in the bar. A bootle of Masi Amarone was like 88 CAD. You get that for 20 EUR in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoFigment
Reviews.Content: We loved this small but classy boutique hotel. The rooms were great and their Christmas shopping package was great. Candy canes for turn down were an added touch that really set The Loden above. This was easily the best bathroom I've seen in a hotel room. It had a sliding door to seperate it from the rest of the room so the room could look huge or when you are using the bathroom it was made private. Each room has a yoga mat and a dedicated channel for your daily routine. Front desk staff was incredibly friendly, willing to help with any need that came about. The bar and restaurant area was clean with excellent food. We are planning a Alaska cruise in the next few years and this will definatly be where we stay before and after.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: vesp60
Reviews.Content: Never knew about this hotel until this week, perfect location, room was beyond what you would expect, only down side no Coffee/Tea in room

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: allytoma
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and the rooms were lovely and modern. Staff were fantastic always happy to explain how to get places, provide maps, restaurant suggestions etc and we always felt comfortable asking them without feeling like we were being an inconvenience. Gym was great, and the hotel computer with free internet was extremely useful. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting some luxury and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: millergeoff
Reviews.Content: On the first couple of days of a family trip to British Columbia we thought we would splash out on The Loden and were so glad we did. It is a great hotel, great staff and a great location. It's not cheap but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Need more hotels like the Loden”
Reviews.Author: q22343
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of a long journey. After spending many nights in "chain" brands(Westin, Intercontinental) the Loden was a revelation. From the moment we were greeted to the moment we left the service was impeccable. Front of house staff were knowledgeable, housemaids were discrete and efficient, food and beverage service was polite but casual. The room was nicely appointed and of reasonable size. Location was great, easy walking distance to many of the key Vancouver locations. For longer trips the Loden Taxi is available, fun and great marketing. After over 50 nights in hotels this year the only problem I have with Loden is that there is not one in every City... Make sure you check for special offers and packages which make the Loden great value.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute bliss! What a perfect experience - every aspect of comfort was considered in this suite.”
Reviews.Author: McNeill8
Reviews.Content: Absolute bliss! What a perfect experience - every aspect of comfort was considered in this suite. A fantastic 'staycation' in the our own city! It really felt like we got away. The suite came with a Wii system and was so well received by our school aged children. For us as adults, the overall suite and consideration of fine details, right down to the yoga mat and nespresso machine were included.

Reviews.Title: “Better than home”
Reviews.Author: Libbybakes
Reviews.Content: Amazing attention to detail. Every need is met and the support staff is beyond excellent. I've stayed on two occasions and will only choose The Loden from now on. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem.”
Reviews.Author: alljoules
Reviews.Content: Normally, i stay at the Shangri-La when i travel on business to Van. I think I will be booking a room at THe Loden from here on out... great experience. Room was brilliantly thought out - with every required amenity at my fingertips. One example: The standard 'plug-in' panel had an HDMI in for the TV and when i inquired at the desk for an HDMI cable was delivered in moments. I was then pleasantly surprised (when i plugged in my laptop to play some tunes)... that it HDMI in was connected to both the TV ... AND the speaker in the bathroom ceiling. Great touch. This was just one of many little 'extras' which i found durring my stay. Decor was modern and spacious, service fast and courteous, food at the restaurant delicious.. great value for a hotel of this quality. --the ONLY knock on the spot was the lack of a swimming pool and hot tub. This might be a deal breaker if i come to vancouver w/ my ladyfriend. Otherwise 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience overall.”
Reviews.Author: SeahowksFan
Reviews.Content: Downtown location. Nice modern rooms; quiet. Great service. Price reasonable for a highend downtown hotel. Offer specials that make it affordable and in line with much lesser value places. I'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel that exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: jackie154943
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Loden hotel are extremely professional, and very helpful and courteous. Our rooms were large and very nicely appointed. We enjoyed our stay at the Loden and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I went to Vancouver more so I could stay at the Loden”
Reviews.Author: KKirk
Reviews.Content: A beautifully designed, well-priced and extremely well-serviced hotel. We enjoyed three nights in a glamourous corner king room and felt that we were traveling at a Hollywood level at a Main Street price. The hotel's bar/restaurant is a special treat, with really well-made cocktails and food whose quality and inventiveness surprised us. A highlight of our stay was bellman Brian, who leapt into service the moment we pulled up our car to show us the area map, suggest a great restaurant or two, point us to a cafe, etc etc. He was the epitome of great hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, tasteful and comfortable room in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: charlie_brown72
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a superb choice. It provided comfort and all the amenities needed for my visit to downtown Vancouver. The staff was friendly and very personable, ready to offer whatever assitance was needed. The room decor was modern and did not lack anything. One of the nicest hotels I have enjoyed staying at during my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: razzbazz
Reviews.Content: I thought the rooms were nicely decorated but I did not like looking out our windows to a residential building where people were barbecuing. I was disappointed there was not a coffee maker or iron in the room and the in-room dining selection was not great. Great T.V.. but the response was slow. The front desk personnel were nice but not as efficient as I would have hoped. We have stayed in many Hotels in downtown Vancouver and for the price we payed, it did not compare.

Reviews.Title: “They cancelled my reservation with out my knowledge.”
Reviews.Author: mike0351
Reviews.Content: I booked this room about 1 week in advance of my stay. The day I got into the city we were busy in the afternoon and in the email it said that if we were going to show up past 4pm than to call to hold the room. I called to confirm my reservation around 3:30 the day of check in and they could not look it up by my name. Luckily I had the confirmation email in front of me and I gave the confirmation number and the receptionist was able to look it up with that information and told me my reservation had been canceled. I never canceled the reservation, although I did email the hotel and request a high floor and inquire about the hours of the car service to decide if I wanted to add the signature package. In the hotels reply back he gave me the information I requested and told me that I would indeed be placed on a high floor although not all views are unobstructed due to being down town among other tall buildings. Never did I call or email to cancel. I think I should have been given a discount or a voucher of some sort just for the trouble and annoyance. I did get a room when I called but I lost the room on the high floor I requested. I believe if I stay in Vancouver again I will be staying at a Hilton hotel which has a very consistent quality of service and friendliness of staff. The Loden's rooms are great and high tech but there are buttons and things that I had no clue what they did and couldn't find a guide to explain what the button in the bathroom with the times of the day and various dots did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: juliennereed
Reviews.Content: We like to splurge on nice rooms when we travel. I searches and searched and found the Loden. We stayed in a Suite. It felt so clean and comfortable. The city view was great through all the many windows- which could be opened for fresh air (which is one thing my spouse requires). The bathroom with its heated floors, oversized bathtub and fancy modern fixtures was very luxurious. Our own espresso/coffee maker, the guitar hero, the lighting... What fun if you can afford it! The staff were very helpful and friendly and gracious. The restaurant was fantastic. The food was amazing and everyone was so polite. WE LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is how it should be :)”
Reviews.Author: GreatDaze
Reviews.Content: How wonderful to find such a quality hotel so close to home, yet with the feel of a mini-vacation. We enjoyed the luxury of the room facilities, a fabulous dinner in our rooms (procutto wrapped chicken - YUM!) and even had chocolates before bed.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping and the Loden...A Match Made in Heaven!!”
Reviews.Author: CathyB70
Reviews.Content: We purchased the suite shopping package. I thought it was a fantastic value. The gift from Holts, the complementary Valet parking...the breakfast credit...AND the most incredible SUITE!! I was blown away!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with a good weekend rate”
Reviews.Author: Zoomed
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the shoppers weekend special and got free parking, a meal credit and free wifi. It was a nice corner room from which with could see the harbor in two directions. The room was nicely furnished, if slightly on the small side. The giant flat screen tv hanging from the ceiling nice but would have been better if the cable service had HD. (possibly the movies were HD). The room was well equipped but the clock was so bright (even when turned down) I had to move it. We had both dinner and breakfast downstairs, the meals were good and the service nicely done. My only small complaint is the both meals were served on "deep dish" plates into which my sllverware kept sliding (into the sauce or egg yolk). All in all a nice hotel with a good weekend rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Consistent Service”
Reviews.Author: JSB-67
Reviews.Content: Have consistently stayed at the likes of a Westin or Sheraton, but ever since being introduced to this boutique hotel 2 years ago - this has and will be the only place I will stay for business in Vancouver. Great gym, quiet and comfortable rooms, ideal DT location for dining and staff are outstanding and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant.”
Reviews.Author: mrfrater
Reviews.Content: The staff were always available, unlike other hotels. The room was very nice. The bathroom was amazing. The decor is modern and fun. The hotel lounge is very chic. The only negative aspect is that this hotel will get very busy, as it's reputation grows.

Reviews.Title: “Great small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcosachar
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent rooms, nice and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Pancho8
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Vancouver. We were very impressed with all aspects of the Loden, from the initial greeting by Mr Adrien Litargne, who couldn't have been more helpful during our stay. He recommended and reserved restaurants, gave us directions, and generally assisted us. Our room was really very nice, quiet as requested, with a beautiful corner view. We ate dinner in the hotel one evening, and it was excellent, as were the breakfasts. LOcated close to Stanley Park, we will definitly stay there on our next visit to Vanvouver.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing... I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Hopkins05
Reviews.Content: I was being treated to this room by my workplace, so I decided to go all out and search for the best place in Vancouver. I saw a rave review of the hotel in the New York Times, and decided to splurge on the Loden, I was impressed by the reviews on trip advisor and the pictures and the friendliness of the staff before I even got there. The hotel is kind of hard to find if you get off the plane and decide to walk from the skytrain stop, and I would probably avoid this at night, but everyone is nice enough in Canada that you will find it, and if it is during the day, it saves you a bit of money versus the cab. I tried to walk to it from the train stop and got harassed by a homeless 'guide' and couldn't walk away fast enough with my bags... but that's just my experience. Once I actually found the hotel which is super close to the water and the Vancouver Convention Center and Stanley Park (if you're up for a gorgeous jog!), the staff was great and helped me settle in right away. I was literally in shock when I saw my room. Talk about swanky. I didn't even realize until my second day that i could plug in my Ipad into the audio and have my music play in surround sound even in the bathroom, which was a great way to get up in the morning. The bed, ohhhh, that bed, was so very wonderful, I wish I could have taken it home with me. The hotel did everything right, they somehow got to my room while I was out at dinner, did a quick clean up for the second time during the day and would leave a lindt chocolate and water every night. Vancouver was wonderful, and so accessible from the hotel. I started running every evening and was able to get out to the water in a matter of 1-2 minutes. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. I loved the staff, and the GYM! The gym was actually what it looks like in those pictures on the site, it is that great. I plan to get to vancouver again soon, and i would never stay anywhere besides the Loden. LOVELY!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Katja_Brenn_Roger
Reviews.Content: Small things can have a huge impact! We had our son Brenn with us and the front-office staff was more then friendly to him, the translation of Brenn is similar to a Prince and he was treated as a little Prince ...they opened the door for him, played with him, always a nice smile and took always the time to help us or just a little word to him.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and romantic”
Reviews.Author: BC_family54
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a Saturday night with my spouse for a fun evening out. The bathrooms are great - fantastic two person tubs. The lounge/restaurant downstairs is trendy with excellent bevies and food. Staff in the restaurant and hotel are very friendly and service was excellent. The hotel is in a good location, quiet but close to the action. If they had a spa, it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Two years after the opening of the Loden hotel, it still consistently delivers.”
Reviews.Author: wells1835
Reviews.Content: I am planning to come back. Good locations, curtesy car service and very helpful staff are some of the reasons why I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: jonro26
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at The Loden since it opened, and every time it continues to keep up the high standards, be it service, room quality and a brilliant gym (that no-one ever seems to use -or perhaps it's my jetlag that kicks in at 4am)! I could stay at countless other hotels in Vancouver, but The Loden is my #1 choice every single time.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel with excellent service and well-designed comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: vkubic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located for a meeting at the Convention Center. Service was excellent at all times. The lobby felt comfortable and was decorated in a chic but comfortable fashion. Thoughtful design characterized the rooms, which has huge windows that could be opened! Everything about the rooms was carefully done, with attractive color scheme and great use of space. Overall, this was an excellent hotel in a pleasant and attractive part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel's I've ever stayed with”
Reviews.Author: UberTrout77
Reviews.Content: This place is fantasic. Wonderful rooms. Incredible staff! A great gym. In an excellent part of the city. Wish I could have stayed longer. Can't say enough good things about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, chic atmosphere, good location”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy9M
Reviews.Content: Check in was courteous, upgraded me to a sweet suite. Nice views, good location that was close to the water, bar was good for meeting for drinks. Chic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “This is one truly great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A_Alexander1
Reviews.Content: I booked 10 rooms at this hotel for a conference at the convention center. My colleagues could not stop talking about what a great hotel it was, and I agree! Top notch service, absolutely lovely rooms, good gym, great location. A great getaway for work or pleasure. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: lynnruby
Reviews.Content: The Loden exceeded our expectations. Every staff member that we encountered provided exceptional service. The hotel had a contemporary design with plenty of warm and inviting touches. Our room was quiet and comfortable. The soaking tub was a delight after a long day of travel. We loved our accessibility to the Robson Street shops/restaurants and to Stanley Park. From start to finish, top to bottom our experience was outstanding. We would definitely stay at the Loden again!

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Boutique”
Reviews.Author: GoldsGuide
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my three kids and our nanny for four days at this new Vancouver Hotel. The hotel is very nicely decorated and the presidential suite was very well appointed. The hotel is small and you will have only one dining option when staying there. We found the room service to actually be a more enjoyable experience than the restaurant. The food was average but certainly not poor. The gym was terrific. The staff were all very nice and very accommodating. Well worth staying at for several days before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing home away from home experience!”
Reviews.Author: abrochu
Reviews.Content: From from arrival to departure, the staff of the Loden hotel is always anticipating your needs. From restaurant suggestions to little attention, they are always ready fullfil your needs. Special mention to the restaurant and bar employees. At the bar, Clayton, a new friend, will ensure that you taste his new drink creation of the day. I really enjoyed my stay at the Loden. Last note, the staff doesn't wear name tags to encourage dialogue with the customers. Interesting!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, beautiful hotel and delicious restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: gounder
Reviews.Content: The Loden is a luxury design boutique hotel within 10 minutes walk of the Vancouver Convention Center. The rooms are beautiful and feel spacious. The service was excellent and friendly. The staff provided excellent recommendations on area restaurants. Josh the concierge was particularly helpful. The restaurant had delicious food and a nice wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch boutique hotel in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: CanadaViaggio
Reviews.Content: The Loden is a great for business or leisure travel. Rooms are beautifully designed and comfortable, Service is great and food wonderful. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loden is Chic, Plush and Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: RayPS
Reviews.Content: Second Stay at the Loden, tipped off by friends , stayed here last summer and again' Spacious room, upgraded to corner room. Beautiful finishes, comfortable beds Love it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Experience”
Reviews.Author: blndgenie
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Loden, having purchased a package on luxurylink.com which included a corner room (exterior walls are basically ALL windows!) with a nice view of the waterfront, breakfast, internet, dining credit and taxes. It turned out to be a fantastic deal and outstanding hotel. The staff were extremely helpful, efficient and pleasant. The room was incredibly comfortable, quiet and spotless, great linens and toiletries, HUGE bathroom with an awesome side-fill tub (soooo deep!) and an enormous shower. A window which OPENS! and an extremely comfy bed. Large flat screen mounted on the ceiling and excellent desk and closet space as well. Lovely bar and although the breakfast choices are somewhat limited, the food was excellent. The bellman were always willing to give us a ride anywhere downtown if the car was available, but the hotel is well-located and close to most sites. I would only say that I didn't find plastic laundry bags in the closet or anywhere in the room, but perhaps I missed them. In addition I believe the daily charge for internet if you don't get a package which included it is overpriced. VERY minor issues indeed! The Loden is an exceptional hotel in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Words alone are not enough!”
Reviews.Author: zkraut
Reviews.Content: For more than twenty years my wife and I have been frequent guests at a Vancouver hotel. Recently that hotel dismissed our long time loyalty so we thought about trying the Loden, a centrally located botique hotel. Just two years new the hotel experience was absolutely outstanding. The rooms, atmosphere, decor and most of all -- the people. All staff members remembered our names in addition to those of the party with which we were traveling. Ranging from the concierge to the front desk to the restaurant/lounge to housekeeping and hotel management, the staff was exceptional. In fact we would rank them at the top in all of our travels. They were friendly, well informed and ready to assist in every way possible to make our trip a special one. With all the amenities at the Loden the hotel is truly a terrific value when it comes to big city hotels. The quiet rooms are well designed, architecturally interesting and offer the best accompanied by a rich hues of vibrant colors. My wife and I are seasoned and discriminating travelers and we highly recommend the Loden as one of the best. The Loden--it's worth checking into. York & Dianne

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kishi99
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and have stayed in many hotels in the US and around the world, and the Loden was one of the best experiences I've had. I can't think of one negative experience/feature of the hotel. The room was beautiful and spacious, the bathroom large and elegant, and loved that tub! The staff was one of the friendliest and most helpful that I've ever encountered. What's more, the price was even a little lower than hotels that aren't as nice, or just your average chain. The location was also excellent. I was attending a conference, and it was a five minute walk to the convention center. There were cafes and restaurants on the same block and neighboring block. It was just a two minute walk up to Robson street (the big shopping hub), and walking distance to Stanley Park. I have already recommended this hotel to colleagues, and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was your very first client! It felt like home coming back for my second time!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya49
Reviews.Content: I love the fact that I can walk to the seawall and Stanley Park, as well as Robson. Love the lounge music that is always playing and the warm greeting when you walk in. Incredible bedding!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great Staff, Great Food, Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: sandra1946_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, Sat, Sun, Mon. Great service began with easy, no hassle registration and friendly, smiling staff. Security evident . . .must have a room card to access the elevator and , , ,you don't need to insert your card . . .just show it to the elevator and door lock! Room was beautiful and functional. No costs spared! Beautiful and very functional space. Granite floors in bath area. Great tile. All glass surrounds. Very comfortable bed with top quality coverings. Entire glass wall to street below. Lots of mirrors, hanging lights, and storage for your "travel crap." Ate there twice for breakfast , once for lunch and once for dinner. The food and servers were exceptional! Was easy to walk to a major shopping area and many fine restaurants. However, best of all was the friendly, smiling, cheerful service in the eating and bar area of the Loden. Felt like family from the beginning to the end. Would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was wonderful I recommend it highly.”
Reviews.Author: Itravel024
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location walking distance to great Shopping, Dinning,close to the big park for walking and picture taking. Staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant sophisticated quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calgaryfamily65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loden one night last week on business. It is a fantastic place for a couple or a solo stay. It is quiet, sophisticated, and modern with fantastic unobtrusive service. The rooms are beautiful. Its location on Melville is two blocks off of Coal Harbour. You have to walk two blocks to get to the water, but it is closer to the center of downtown and shopping. I stayed here a year ago with my wife and it was great then too. They have two bikes you can borrow and ride the sea wall. When will all these places stop charging for wireless internet?

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: montrealer_50
Reviews.Content: intimite, good bedding, decor, amenities, restaurant, and friendly helpful staff. need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, fun atmostphere, awesome bar & food, amazing hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: APaschall
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. Such a trendy, fun hotel, located in a youthful, social part of town. The staff and hospitality was awesome. I would come back in a heartbeat and would recommend it to everyone. Treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful ...went out of their way to help you..”
Reviews.Author: sadie867
Reviews.Content: The staff were fantastic...from the door men to the maids.. The only issue we had was no coffee machine in the room....but they had free coffee down stairs at the front entrance.. But we didn't want to walk down in our pj's at 6.30am.. so ......they were kind enough to bring up 2 cups and a jug..

Reviews.Title: “Resting on its Laurels”
Reviews.Author: Palpatine
Reviews.Content: Well , the "boutique" decor and the calm impression might impress the week end crowds of leisure guests but the dismal service makes this hotel a poor choice for the frequent traveller. The room service is appalling, forgotten orders, night orders delivered by the night cleaner with his cleaning gloves hanging from his back pocket, missing cutlery items, coffee luke warm for breakfast, never received a newspaper in the morning even when requested, smiley but totally inefficient front desk staff incapable of following through. I have been staying in this hotel its opening and the sense of professionalism has totally disappeared. True the decor is very nice but the same cheapness applied to service is being applied to the repairs and maintenance with falling appart bathroom fixtures. A good hotel for the party. "girls week end" crowd but not for seasoned travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice expensive hotel with good services”
Reviews.Author: Mashinka
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night in October 10 for my birthday trip to Vancouver.
