This hotel is a little bit out of our normal range of hotel prices and not very cheap and i was surprised to see that they want to charge us for water ( $8) in the room and internet at $30 ( i think? ) /day. Another thing mentioned by a fellow contributor earlier - their rooms/bathrooms are overdesigned and it doesn't make them better. Having said that, the room was extremely nice and of a very decent size, with big TV and audio controls for it all around the room. They provide you with yoga mat and a dedicated channel; they provide turndown service to all (?) guests; they're very helpful with reservations/advices. We also were able to check out at 1 instead of 12 ( due to our fault) which was a big deal for me. The beds and pillows are very comfortable and the room itself very quiet. We also rented bikes in the morning for a quick ride around Stanley park - this was one of the highlights. Upon checking in, we found a pastry plate in the room ( it was my birthday) with the card from the management. Huge deep bathtub, nice robes, very good products in the bathroom. The complimentary cab service around downtown area is very convenient too. Overall, we were quite happy with this hotel and definitely will recomment it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Little bit of modern boutique luxury in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: moniqueauzoux
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a girls weekend and was thoroughly happy! What great service, gorgeous modern rooms and exceptional staff. Huge large square bathtub 4 feet deep ! Modern architecture and decorations thruout - The lobby in itself is amazing - Voya restaurant top notch! Car service thru out the downtown area at no cost - they've thought of everything - really enjoyed it!! Thanks Loden for making our girls weekend spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rduggan
Reviews.Content: Great location, intimate scale, modern design, great light, helpful staff. Only small complaint is beds could be softer. Will definitely stay again on my next trip to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: zmann77
Reviews.Content: Well really I can't say much that has not already been said over and over again!! The Loden is simply a great place to stay if for business or pleasure! We stayed in a Loden park vista corner room with the loden life package which included breakfast (with the loden life package only you are allowed whatever you want and as much as you want for breakfast!!!) internet, valet parking, and a $35 credit for whatever you choose. All in all, we thought it was excellent value considering the level of service and would and will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: The Loden is located close to all downtown hot spots, and an easy walk to Coal Harbor or Gastown. The neighborhood is safe and since we rented a car, we utilized the valet and the car is always promptly delivered when needed. There are less than 10 rooms per floor, and although the room size is not big, it is definitely sufficient for downtown location. On the other hand, you can see into other people's apartment if you leave your shades open. There are many casual eateries around the hotel and since the hotel is located not on the main streets of downtown Vancouver, you avoid the noise and heavy traffic. Everybody is extremely friendly. The hotel restaurant serves excellent cuisine, and the Nespresso machine set up next to the elevators in the mornings is a great touch. There is also a gym at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: akatravelgirl_10
Reviews.Content: This elegant boutique hotel is a fantastic treasure in the heart of Vancouver. I would not stay anywhere else, and I've been to the Four Seasons, Shangri-la, Pan Pacific and many other top hotels in the city. If you are looking for first class service in an intimate, luxury hotel, you must stay here. The location is excellent. Walking to Robinson street for shopping or to Gastown in the evening to experience the best food and clubs Vancouver has to offer. It is also nestled in the quiet, residential neighborhood of Coal Harbour. You are two blocks walking to the waterfront and the rooms have glorious views overlooking the water or city. A true gem and a must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect everything”
Reviews.Author: jag027
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all-good workout facilitiy, great location, excellent staff, beautifully appointed rooms and bathrooms (waterfall faucet in deep tub, windows you can actually open, lots of light). I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to be”
Reviews.Author: HDLBruxelles
Reviews.Content: Nice and modern hotel, easy to find, sufficient far from the nights activities but not too far. Good location for the convention center and the cruise departure. The rooms are nice but you have to understand that the price/sf is nearly the same than in US: nice room, tastefully decoration but small or more small than you hope. The desk is really efficient. I think a good choice in, vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the perfect weekend in Vancouver....”
Reviews.Author: Calgary523
Reviews.Content: They even take excellent care of pets while travelling...we were all comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel thats pays attention to every detail from the rooms to the clients needs.”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel1234
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Hotel. The rooms were beautiful architecturally --every amenity you could want. The staff was fabulous. Food delicious. They have a wonderful restaurant bar downstairs in which is a great meeting place for friends. Stayed catching up with my friend a hour after closing time and they didn't say a word but continued to fill our glasses. They were very hospitable. I highly recommend this upscale hotel for the traveler that wants to have luxury in a cozy environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: lscquig
Reviews.Content: Once again a terrific stay at the Loden. The staff is so warm and friendly and the hotel so comfortable that I now find it hard to stay elsewhere in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique hotel with over-the-top service”
Reviews.Author: MissouriTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I thought that my expectations would overwhelm my experience. To the contrary, I was delighted with the service, the ingenious room design, and all of the extras. My husband and I stayed here for a meeting at the convention center. The location is a perfect spot for access to the convention center, harbor and downtown dining & shopping. We used the hotel bikes to tour Stanley Park--probably the highlight of our trip! We were given a code for free internet access, an unexpected perk. The front desk was endlessly pleasant and helpful, as were the doormen. They made us feel at home while abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travl003
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel two bolcks from the waterfront and convention center. Restaurant/bar are outstanding. About the only thing I can knock it for is that the drapes still allow some light to bleed through at the edges, and I like a pitch black room for sleeping. But that's pretty minor in the grand scheme.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: tmoon_7
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I truly enjoyed our stay at the Loden. The hotel is located in the upscale Coal Harbour area of Vancouver. It is walking distance to many great restaurants and close to the walkway along the water to Stanley Park. Also, the hotel has bikes that guests can take out for a beautiful bike ride along the seawall around Stanley Park. The service and the rooms at the hotel are top notch. I would highly recommend a stay at the Loden when you are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, quaint luxury”
Reviews.Author: Troyjohn
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Tuvana as part of proposing to my girlfriend in Antalya. The hotel itself was great, as many of the reviewers here have pointed out. Our room was delightful and all the amenities I would hope for. I really like the style and decor of the place too. The hotel is fantastic. On top of this, the staff were amazing. The frontdesk staff helped me plan many of the details of the proposal itself. I can't stress enough how all the staff made us feel not only welcome, but they were all aware of our engagement and made things truly special. It's a day I'll never forget, and Tuvana is a very big part of that. I look forward to returning there and reliving this day for the rest of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable bed, loud A/C”
Reviews.Author: Iloveboutiquehotels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of the high ranking in Tripadvisor but I should have focused more on the negative responses. When I arrived there was no one at the front door and because of the residential location I wasn't sure whether I was dropped off in the right place by the taxi driver. I struggled with my cases and managed to get to the front desk where the bellman was chatting with the front desk agent (yes, that's where he was). I felt like I interrupted their fun, their reception was lukewarm. The room decor was nice but safe for this type of hotel, there was a particular scent in the room which did not agree with me. I always wonder why hotels infuse smells in rooms, there are chances people will not like it and this was the case with me. I arrived late so I was going to take a bath in the nice soaker tub and go to bed immediately. The bathroom was beautiful, the big tub was inviting but the bath salts were in a small square vase with no lid. The germaphobe in me scramed "uhhygenic!" and made me think other people's bath splashes may have gone inside. So I took a shower instead. The sink is very small and I splashed water all over the counter. I think it doesn't help that the counter is relatively low too. The bathrobe made me wonder if they wash it every day since it looked a little ratty so I did not use it. Heading to bed I thought maybe I should order something through room service but I could not find the menu anywhere, it ends up you have to switch the TV and go to the directory channel. I thought I was tech savvy but apparently not, this made me feel old. The bed was rock hard and I did not feel like I was wrapped in clouds. I was woken up twice with the loud A/C noise, I thought this was a relatively new hotel but it certainly didn't sound like one. Needless to say, I woke up not very well rested. I was staying in Vancouver for a few nights and I did not want to continue to have such poor quality of sleep so I switched hotels. One more thing, this hotel is amongst residential buildings and when I opened the curtains I felt like I was in a fish bowl on display.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Exceeded Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: aml3679
Reviews.Content: After making at least 3 other reservations and cancelling them, after reading about The Loden on Trip Advisor, I booked with them. The hotel is amazing with the best service we have ever received. We asked for early check in and were able to check in right after lunch in their amazing restaurant Voya. It was our 25th anniversary and were leaving on a cruise in 2 days - the Manager sent over champagne while we were eating lunch and they upgraded us to a suite - over 750 sq. feet. The room was amazing. We felt like we were in our own penthouse apartment. We had city views with a tiny glimps of the water. The bathroom was marble with heated floors, a huge soaker tub with bath salts, a steam shower, thick fluffy towels and luxurious amenities (toiletries, bathrobes, slippers ...). There was 2 huge closets with wooden hangers, a steamer, an umbrella, shopping bags, a yoga mat and a safe. The bedroom had a king size bed with luxurious bedding and a 42" plasma TV. There were pocket doors to close off the bedroom from the bathroom and living room. The living room had a plush sofa, a 42" plasma TV, a WII game, DVD player, a drum set and an electric guitar with amazing city views. The dining room had a 5 pc dinette with nice art work. A side board had a refrigerator, expresso/cappuchino maker and snacks. There were 2 newspapers delivered daily, evening turn down service and a car that took you anywhere you wanted to go. On our second night, the Manager sent up a tray of pastries made by the pastry chef from the hotel staff with a note wishing us a happy anniversary. The restaurant was outstanding. We had lunch the first day with fresh bread and homemade pasta. And, breakfast, on the second 2 days. They even make their own breakfast sausage. The second day, I ordered eggs over easy and they came over medium and I sent them back. They apologized and said breakfast was on the house. Another unexpected surprise. I love a traditional decor while my husband loves modern. The hotel is a mix of both. Casual but elegant. Stylish but comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “#1 rating well-deserved”
Reviews.Author: tymsink
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden this past weekend. Our first night we were kept up until 4am by the guests in the adjoining room having a lively conversation. The hotel staff went way above and beyond to make the rest of our stay amazing. We were upgraded to a very quiet view room and the manager sent a note of apology and a fantastic candy tray to our room. The customer service was the best I've ever received at a hotel. They really know how to take care of their guests. Loved the room, the bathroom, location, very clean, all at a very reasonable price. I would definitely stay at the Loden again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: PimpWagon
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to all the places we wanted to visit on our trip, the Loden surpassed all expecations we had. Beyond being clean and comfortable, the staff was extremely friendly and helpfull. They provided suggestions for places to visit and how to start navigating the city. The bar was a great place to hang out after a long day in the city, again with friendly staff. They even have a complimentay driver if you need a ride to a restaurant or in our case to the cruise ship terminal. The only disappointment was we did not have time to eat in the hotel restaurant and the menu looked amazing, was hoping to try the Bison Tri-Tip. The only thing that I would have liked better was having coffeee in the room, but it was easy to walk downstairs to rab a complimentary cup.

Reviews.Title: “understated class”
Reviews.Author: Sonicshaman
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice hotel, a little fancier than what I normally go for, but not garish, and a good location. I found this to be a reasonable value, booked a bit more than a month out with a discount. Everything I like, simple entrance and lobby area, tastefully modern, rooms the same. Very clean and everything in nice shape, maybe because it's still new, hopefully it will be kept this way. I was able to walk just about everywhere I wanted to go. Rail is nearby if you're not a walker. I found the staff to be friendly and very helpful. I definitely will stay again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly relaxing and perfect”
Reviews.Author: okitsmeAnotherCity
Reviews.Content: A fabulous, romantic stay in a great boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: nppaine
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. While we wished we could be on the water or have an open view (only available in big box hotels), this is the best location in the city for access to the water, to shopping, to the park, the seaplane port and it is not on a busy street but next to them. Rooms are very nice and our corner park view room had lots of natural light. Due to its location, you are looking into peoples condos and business offices but they have good screens and curtains. My only complaint is the toilet paper. In a place very well appointed otherwise, the single ply toilet paper was a bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located clean, attractive hotel with pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: brubarbtravelers
Reviews.Content: Room was ready at check-in, always appreciated. The staff was pleasant and helpful as to how best see the city in time allotted. The room was clean and very comfortable with plenty of room and a good bathroom. Robes and slippers were also provided and there are pillow options, again, always appreciated.The location was downtown in the financial area so quieter in the evening but still very central. Vancouver is on a grid so very easy to negotiate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Toddly
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this wonderful hotel. Everything about it was absolutedly perfect. The staff were all friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, and great. The rooms are really sleek and modern. The beds are extremely comfortable; I slept great. It is located near the major attractions of downtown Vancouver (Robson street, Stanley Park, etc). Plus, the hotel's restaurant, Voya, is wonderful. They make the best poached eggs for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: montauk0236
Reviews.Content: They found out it was my birthday and upgraded us to a suite. Waiting in the room was a full plate of sweet treats. Slippers by the bed, candies on the pillow, bikes for your convenience. Soaker tub and a bathroom you would love not to mention great restaurant and room service. If you get a chance take advantage of the Loden mobile its a fun ride. Super convenient to Stanley Park and many great restaurants. Staff was super friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent top-notch service - a "home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: Gomyone
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of hotels in downtown Vancouver for business, but the Loden stands out miles above the rest. That's why I now call it my "home away from home" when I frequently go to Vancouver for business. The location is perfect (it feels like its in a residential neighbourhood close to both Coal Harbour, yet its still a stone's throw from major downtown office buildings.) The rooms are very nicely appointed, with ultra-modern decor and very comfortable beds and great soaker tubs/showers in the bathroom. Depending on the room you get, you can get magnificent views of the Vancouver mountains and some corner rooms have floor to ceiling glass walls which let in amazing amount of light, even when Vancouver has a typically grey day. While I could rave about many other features of this hotel, the best attribute comes down to its impecable service. The staff are warm, courteous and there to make your stay as comfortable as possible. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will return to it again and again whenever I'm in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Stophers
Reviews.Content: Following nearly a three week vacation in the Pacific North West, we arrived at the Loden hotel in Vancouver as our last stop before home. Having pre-selected a Park Vista room for the 'city loft' look, we were delighted to find that we had been upgraded to the Luna suite with the same floor to ceiling glass but with the added benefit of glimpses of the bay plus spacious separate sitting and dining areas. The reception staff were very helpful and offered to take us to the water bus in the hotel taxi so that we could cross easily to Granville Island. Turn down staff were always friendly and cheerful. Only reason to mark down service one point was the breakfast service which always seemed not quite up to the Loden standard, having to remind to bring water or coffee on more than one occasion. The added benefit of the Loden hotel is that it is in a great location, in walking distance of both downtown and English Bay (and we're not big walkers!)

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: scfphoto
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a good vibe and trendy, comfortable rooms. Very pleasing decor, views of city, lovely bathroom. Comfortable bed with nice linens Excellent location that is close to sights yet on a less congested street which made the room a nice haven. Much better room and peacefulness than Shangri La.

Reviews.Title: “I can not say enough about how wonderful our stay at the Loden was.”
Reviews.Author: jwallybrown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days of our honeymoon at the Loden and it was perfection. We were upgraded to a suite (the Mistral) as it was our honeymoon and the room was amazing. The staff at the Loden are truly exceptional and the service was beyond our expectations. The bed at the Loden was the most comfortable sleep we have ever had. The location in Coal Harbour is great, close enough to walk almost anywhere you need to go. We would, without hesitation, recommend the Loden to anyone looking for an exceptional hotel experience in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Auto launch event”
Reviews.Author: BobMcHugh
Reviews.Content: Nce hotel - very modern - freindly and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, large suite with view, service exceptional”
Reviews.Author: kimboToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden for 4 days. The room was large with a seperate lounge and kitchette. Room had a partial view of the water. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was beautiful. Staff provided good unobtrusive servide. The hotel's free London cab was a great idea and we used in on several occasions. The staff gave good advice on restaurants in Vancouver. Would definately return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's all grown up.”
Reviews.Author: dragonx_01
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vancouver a few times, but this is the first time staying at the Loden, and it seemed to give the city an entirely different feel. The service was exceptional across the board, very friendly, without overstepping. The windows on the corner room felt great and let in plenty of light, even though the views were partially into the patios of the neighboring building. There were only two faults, and neither was major. I could hear some doors slamming in the morning, but fortunately it wasn't too early. Second, the valet parking is $35, which is bearable, especially with the great valet service, but it was annoying to find that there's actually another $12 of tax on top of that!

Reviews.Title: “stylish , understated , good food , excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cinta07
Reviews.Content: Check in service was not good but all the service that followed was excellent. The hotel has a courtesy car but when directions were asked for the counter staff did not offer the courtesy car. This should change. The hotel is located 15 minutes walk from water but it is not on the water. Breakfast is of a high standard and very generous. Menu does not change from day to day so it can be boring for a longer stay. Coffee can be improved. The hotel room was good and decor stylish. Beds very comfortable and very clean.I liked the understatement of the whole hotel and the stylish room and bar and restaurant. Only reservation is distance to waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience - with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: HudsonFam
Reviews.Content: The Loden is a gem of a hotel in a great central location between Robson Street, the Gastown area and Coal Harbour. It is a short bike ride to beautiful Stanley Park and a nice walk to English Bay to view the sunset. Rooms are large, unique and very clean. We had great, but unpretentious service each day from Stacey at the front desk and Troy was usually around the front door to help you with anything that you need.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel...one of the best...”
Reviews.Author: KaySharrard
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel...one of the best boutique hotels we have ever stayed in. Everything was perfect from a flawless check in experience, to great restaurant recommendations to little touches like a yoga mat in the room and bottled water in the car when it was brought around. On a scale of 1-10, The Loden gets a 10+!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Loden!”
Reviews.Author: notadoc
Reviews.Content: great downtown location. Super staff - always helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mrWagner007
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for someone looking for a great weekend get away to Vancouver!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels in which I've had the pleasure to stay”
Reviews.Author: tjdamman
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean, large and well-designed. It had one of the nicest showers I've ever seen, I wanted to take it home with me. Additionally, the restaurant Voya is top-notch. Every meal was so good even the simple dishes and I was made the best Old Fashioned I've ever had by the bartender.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel with all the bells and whistles.”
Reviews.Author: Seattlelove
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Boutique Hotel with all the bells and whistles! Great location, just a few short blocks away from the frenzy of Vancouver's trendy to restaurants and shopping. Friendly, professional and courteous staff made the stay and weekend memorable. I will most certainly be staying at the Loden my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend ... a great success at the Loden”
Reviews.Author: jan416
Reviews.Content: Went to the Loden this weekend for a girls weekend away. Rented a one-bedroom suite and were very pleased with the great living room suite. This allowed us to have enough space to catch up in the privacy of our own room. The bathrooms are great with beautiful showers. The hotel staff made a great dinner recommendation which we appreciated. While it was a little outside of downtown, they recommended DB Modern Bistro, which provides you with a taxi voucher back to the hotel. This restaurant was a great change of pace and we appreciated the tip about the taxis voucher. We will come and stay with the Loden again next time us girls meet in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Buzzbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loden hotel for the first time last week. When travelling on business, I have always stayed in Vancouver's many 4 star downtown hotels. After reading all the positive reviews, I thought I would try something new. I found this hotel to be a refreshing change to some of the other more stuffy hotels. With polite and attentive staff to assist you and a warm greeting at check in, I was impressed. Although you have to pay for internet at the Loden, I was pleased with its speed and how user friendly it was. It made working from the hotel room, which had an amazing view by the way, simple and relaxing. Because of the rain I did not get to run the sea-wall, but to my surprise, I found out the gym in the hotel was amazing. Too have such square footage and choice of machinery in a hotel facility is impressive. Hopefully work will send me to Vancouver again soon, as I have found my new home-away-from home at the Loden. I think for business travelers or anyone traveling to Vancouver, this hotel offer something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions count - you had me at SNUBBED”
Reviews.Author: SouthBurnabyMom
Reviews.Content: Based on the glowing reviews in Tripadvisor, my husband and I chose the Loden Hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. After the wonderful service we received at the Italian Kitchen from our server, we were on cloud nine as we headed to the Loden for a one night stay sans kids. We entered the lobby after dinner and there was one gentleman ahead of us. As we waited our turn, two other men came out from the elevator area and stood off to the side. After the gentleman in front was served, the male hotel clerk did not even acknowledge our presence or the fact that we were waiting in line ahead of the two other men and proceeded to assist the two men. We would not have been insulted if the clerk at the very least acknowledged our presence and asked if it was ok for him to quickly help those two men who had budged in front of us, but he didn't. To say the least, we were insulted. This stay is our first and absolutely last time at the Loden. Other points to note: We agree with other reviews about the bathrooms, the sinks are not well designed, water splashes out everywhere, the decor is very dark, and the air conditioning very annoying and loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, some quirks”
Reviews.Author: omszz
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at this hotel was very good. The hotel is in a fantastic location, has a very clean and nice rooms, and an attentive staff. There are also nice little touches such as ice delivered to your room, free london cab in downtown area, free bicycles rentals, etc... There were a few things that could be better. There were a few hidden-misrepresented prices of certain things. When I made a reservation on the phone one of the gentelman I spoke with highlighted that $15/night parking in downtown was a big benefit of the hotel. I agreed with that, however when arriving at the hotel, I learned parking was $35/night + parking taxes which made it nearly $50/night. A huge difference from what I was told when making the reservation. The second item was the breakfast package. We called down a few times to find out what the package included and never got a straight answer. We specifically asked if we could get the breakfast in the room and what was covered by the package. The answer was anything from the breakfast menu. Well that wasn't quite accurate, only 1 entree + 1 drink was covered. So if you got a side of fruit, or a coffee, those were extra charges. This is very easy to explain, just tell is 1 entree + 1 drink - but somehow the front desk staff wasn't clear on it. It did seem like they were training new front desk staff, so that might be the issue on both these items. The last complaint I have is although the bed is wonderful, and we slept very well, my wife got itchy due to the sheet configuration. There is a fitted sheet with a down comforter directly on it. There is no top sheet between the comforter and the fitted sheet. As a result if you are sensitive to down feathers, it can get itchy. We were there with friends and they said they had the same problem around feeling a bit itchy in bed. Although there were a few gripes that I have listed above, I would recommend Loden and probably stay there again. It is one of the nicer hotels in the area and overall our stay was postive.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, great location & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JBJS
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - modern, conveniently located and with very friendly people. In particular, Sarah helped us a lot with what to do and see, bookings, local restaurants (Coast and The Italian Kitchen), shopping etc. Stacey was also a great help. Complementary local car service and Wi-Fi was also excellent. We highly recommend the hotel. Even if the people change we hope The Loden keep finding such friendly and helpful team members.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: ruthbonini
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel, excellent bed and pillows. the internet should not be charged.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: JenUdy
Reviews.Content: The room was full of surprises with many extras that they had that you normally do not see in a hotel room; ie yoga mats!!! The only down side was that they did not have coffee in the rooms, but did have a coffee bar in the lobby. We've stayed at hotels that have in room cappacino/coffee machines and think that if they had this it would make it great! So, for those that enjoy that cup before having a shower and getting dressed, as I do, it was the only downer. As we were staying at the Loden for a wedding, the rates were excellent for what we had for a room. They do provide a complementary "Loden Cab" which takes their guests to anywhere in the immediate area in Vanouver. It is a really neat looking cab that we had pre-booked to get to the wedding that we were going to, but the hotel staff were not overly organized, even though we had pre-booked their cab. We waited over 20 minutes before they were ready, and since our party going to the wedding was rather large, we needed to get an addtional cab to get everyone to our desination. The Loden is an easy walk to great shopping and attrations in the downtown area of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MiffyK
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Clean, very modern & stylish. The restaurant (Voya) was wonderful too. We tried the omelette for breakfast,and found it delish! (Tons of cheese and mushrooms!) Other reviewers says that the staff are very friendly. Hmmm. I can't totally agree on that (although some of them were really nice). I have also read in other reviews that the bathroom amenities are from Molton Brown, but they weren't in our room, so don't look forward. I wish they didn't charge you for everything (i.e. wi-fi, valet parking), but still, it was a really nice hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with the BEST personal service!”
Reviews.Author: davida425
Reviews.Content: All really good! Exception being no free wifi service

Reviews.Title: “A trendy hotel in perfect location with incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: DiscodivaBristol
Reviews.Content: The Loden is placed in a great position for the waterfront, Stanley Park and Robson Street. The staff are so incredibly helpful and friendly and the amenities are great including a gym and free bike hire (which has to be done in Vancouver!). The restaurant and in house dining are of great quality and the room we stayed in (2nd floor) with both city and waterfront view. The rooms are decorated to a very high and elegant standard

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: DaveNStAlbert
Reviews.Content: I am not a globe trotter but really this hotel is one of the nicest I have stayed in. The rooms were smart and classy and the price was acceptable. Our breakfast was reasonably priced and super tasty. The staff were superb. I actually thought that they really actually cared. I want to cite the valet parker as being especially helpful on Sept 4 & 5th during the daytime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence found in a boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gigi063
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step from the taxi on arrival to the moment you say goodbye the Loden experience is top drawer. The staff at all levels are professional and could not be more helpful in making your stay relaxing, enjoyable and comfortable. The room on the 11th floor was terrific with both mountain and water views. We used the bikes several times making our way to Granville Island, Stanley Park and back to Granville Island. The bikes were in great shape and the helmets were easy to adjust. Water was provided for all of our outings. Although we walked a bunch the few times we needed a taxi one was summoned quite quickly. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant, Voya was superb and we couldn't have been more pleased with the service. The room was sleekly designed and the bathroom was quite large and had a great shower. The Loden is modern and beautifully designed throughout. Great, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Helen187046
Reviews.Content: The staff could not be more helpful. I was staying with my 2 sons, 12/13, and we were upgraded to a suite including a Wii ! so I was a very popular mum, only issue was with the room facilities being so good, including the room service, they didn't want to get out to see Vancouver ! Food in the restaurant was wonderful and the service with my son's was great.. the staff went the extra mile. The gym was also great, well equiped, and light. would just have been perfect if there was a pool.. Will definitely stay again if I visit Vancouver..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and hospitality provided by it's staff”
Reviews.Author: misty290810
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loden in Vancouver and was most impressed with not only it's location near the harbour and it's financial centre but also the shopping area around Robson street. Most impressed with it's staff in the restaurant and rooms service and particularly was thrilled with the hospitality and tours advise provided by their front desk staff Sarah and Stacey. Would highly recommend this Hotel for both business and tourist travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...reviews are right on...”
Reviews.Author: IslandTravelling
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Vancouver for a concert and decided to stay at the Loden. The hotel offers many amentities for the travellers...superb gym area, shuttle service to many downtown attractions, bikes that you could use to cruise through nearby Stanley Park and restaurants and coffee shops close by. The hotel is one block off Georgia Street, close to transit and a few short blocks from Granville and Robson Street. Both my husband and I remarked about how quiet the hotel is and the area that surrounds the hotel, but you are within walking distance of downtown Vancouver's action.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with fabulous service!”
Reviews.Author: StanleylovesGracie
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel could not have been better. From the turndown service which included complementary water and chocolates, to the Bell/Valet's Troy and Mike, to the friendly front desk staff--all were exemplary. We booked the Loden Life package which included valet parking (fast service---two minutes or less), a tasty breakfast for two at Voya, high speed internet and a daily $35 credit used for snacks and in-room movies, all for a very reasonable price. They even provided a Wii Fit for my pregnant wife to use for exercise. The room was modern, spacious, and very high tech. The bathroom included a shower and a tub that gave a perfect in-room spa experience. The bed was great. All in all, a very relaxing vacation in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Comfort”
Reviews.Author: jetfl51
Reviews.Content: Discreet yet stylish and elegant. My wife and I enjoyed two nights at the Loden.....and I commend myself for choosing it!!! It's in a quiet area of the city, but close to the seawall and Coal Harbor for wonderful morning strolls. The staff was sincerely friendly and accommodating. My wife and I reserved the two bikes from the hotel and they were ready to go on time. Bottles of water were also included. A little pricey, but hell so are all the good things in life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice differentiation from standard hotel - quaint and personable -refreshing”
Reviews.Author: pchat
Reviews.Content: Nice to have a quaint property. We enjoyed our interaction with staff. They were friendly, professional and helpful. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Cool”
Reviews.Author: sprsullivan
Reviews.Content: The Loden Vancouver was so great! I did a little research online and wasn't quite sure about the area, having never been to Vancouver before. But this location was excellent, it was about 4 blocks from the waterfront and there were various modes of transportation just steps away. There were also cafes, bakeries and soup and sandwich places every couple of doors, so that was easy and convenient. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, giving us an espresso maker after our request, a map and directions to a city tour bus and the restaurant even prepared a special custom meal for my husband and I, because of our vegan diet. They had THE BEST SHEETS AND BEDDING EVER!!! I wanted to take them home! The room was gorgeous, modern, and beautifully designed. The only thing that was a little odd to us, was there was no ice machine, but apparently Canadians aren't big ice users, which we came to realize! I'd stay there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great find on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: BrianInColorado
Reviews.Content: The Loden is perfect for anyone who likes a stylish, small boutique hotel. Location is convenient to the bay or downtown districts, rooms are well-designed and comfortable and the staff is very accommodating. A nice alternative to the big chain hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: AzSummerrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Loden for 4 nights in a King Room with a peek of the harbour. We were on the 10th floor and it was very quiet. The concierge and front desk staff were very professional and helpful in answering questions, recommending places to eat and even booking activities. Also must say that the housekeeping staff was very friendly and we had great turn down service - it was more than just turn down service it was like getting your room freshed again plus treats. We took advantage of the courtesy hotel bikes and biked to Stanley Park (so fun). Staying at The Loden made our trip very relaxing and we looked forward to returning to our room at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Boris26
Reviews.Content: I have to say, ive stayed at a fair amount of hotels that deem "greatness" but this hotel was truly amazing. great service from all departments! no hidden fees, great room service timing, always clean! desk staff were the nicest Ive encountered. i really enjoyed my 5 Night stay and would recommend to anyone staying in Vancouver. Its literally 2 blocks from The Sea Walk + Robson street.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MauriceDF
Reviews.Content: What can I say ... great experience! From being greated at the front door to having my bed turned down and ice delivered to my room ... couldn't ask for more. The breakfast and coffee in the morning was a step above most. I'd give this place five stars (out of five). Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Friendly and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: NYEureka
Reviews.Content: The Loden had been open only a few months when we stayed there for one night on our way to Alaska. It has a great in-town location not far from the seaport. It's an 18-storey building with a very inviting and intimate lobby, which has a modern glassed-in fireplace forming part of a divider wall between reception and the Voya bar/restaurant...perfect for those cold winter days, I'd imagine. We were greeted very warmly and informed that we our room had been upgraded. In fact, we got to stay in the Zephyr Suite, a large one-bedroom place with a big living room/kitchen. The best part of the Zephyr was that the bedroom was surrounded on three sides by floor-to-ceiling windows (with curtains that were easy to open and close). The views of Vancouver and its harbor were spectacular. The bathroom was gorgeous, with a huge soaking tub....actually too deep for me, I felt like I'd really have trouble getting out, so I stuck to the rainforest shower. The concierge recommended an informal seafood place on the nearby inlet where all kinds of yachts were docked. And just to make sure, he called ahead while we were walking over, making sure we had a reservation. Nice! After a very good sleep, we went down to Voya for an excellent breakfast and were happily on our way to the ship. I'd go back to The Loden anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: garyklau
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel stay, the Loden was definitely a gem in the Vancouver area and one I would recommend as one of the best hotels to stay at for business and leisure. Best features: great room - spacious and confortable, gym was among the better in the vancouver area, staff was receptive and welcoming, and the location was in the heart of Vancouver close to coal harbour. Everything was great, the only issue I had was a lack of an ironing board and iron (these are necessary with business travel and a lack of 24 hour dry cleaners in the city). The room comes with a steamer device but I find those devices don't come close to the crispness of a regular old iron.

Reviews.Title: “The best service we ever got”
Reviews.Author: zguby
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in very good place walking distance to many major attraction of the city. The room was nice and quite and had a very comfortable bad. All the hotel employees were polite and helped us in any way they could The business center and the spa are small and need improvment

Reviews.Title: “Best Service”
Reviews.Author: Feedyoursoul_35
Reviews.Content: Wow, wow, wow! Amazing place to stay. The service is incredible. The room is modern, clean and gorgeous! Location is perfect. On a quiet street but within walking distance to the water or the main shops. Stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Loden!!”
Reviews.Author: amkoenig
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend here with our young children and loved our spacious room , stylish surroundings, attentive and helpful staff, and beautiful location very near the waterfront. Our balcony had an amazing view of the city and harbor. It was our first trip ever to Vancouver and we hope to come back to the Loden frequently!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Starmysha
Reviews.Content: Loved the room: the design, separate bath and shower, great view and comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: dillsSeattle
Reviews.Content: Overall, I'd say it was a great stay. The room (king deluxe, I think) was extremely comfortable and spacious. We loved having a separate bathtub and shower, fluffy towels, and nice bath amenities. There are speakers for the TV are in the bathroom area. The room has a small fridge, clothes steamer (no iron -- need to ask to have it brought up), and a flatscreen that gives you info about your bill, hotel, weather, etc. There's also a nice port for hooking up a laptop, DVD, etc. My only complaints -- no coffee maker in the room. They did offer coffee pods downstairs in the morning until 10am (although one morning, I overheard someone complaining that they had removed the coffee at 9:30). My issue with the pods is that while they're good, they're slow and I also walked by a line of people waiting for coffee since there's only one machine. And, no free internet. I realize you're less likely to get this amenity at nicer hotels, but seriously, in this day and age, internet should be free. Final complaint, parking with taxes was over $40/night. Definitely adds up over several nights. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, and we also had a nice dinner in the hotel. Room service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing brunch, stylish and modern decor, great location!”
Reviews.Author: jameswcurrie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Loden on our wedding night, (even though we live right around the corner!). The staff were amazing and helpful, the brunch was delicious and our room was spacious, luxurious and stylish. I would recommend The Loden to anyone visiting Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “spectacular”
Reviews.Author: travellingone60878
Reviews.Content: From the curbside to arrival to the room, the experience was superb. This high tech hotel does not suffer from a lack of personal touches. All staff was friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable about things to do and directions on how to get there. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the bathrooms are long on luxury. Only downer was the cost to valet your car. Having said this, I believe that the hotel's $35 per day fee is in line with the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Modern Design with a Few Minor Amenity Improvements Needed”
Reviews.Author: Mark47Seattle
Reviews.Content: The design of this hotel is very modern without being cold. The rooms are very comfortable and cozy without succumbing to the starkness of many a modern design these days. The bathrooms are among the best hotel room bathrooms I have ever experienced--in my opinion being only matched by the best resort properties in Las Vegas. There is a large wood sliding wall that gives you the ability to open up the bathroom to the rest of the hotel room. The sink faces out and there is a floating mirror, which allows you to watch TV while shaving and primping. There is even a speaker in the ceiling of the bathroom that's connected to the TV's audio--a nice touch. Now for a few gripes. I appreciate the thoughtfulness of offering up Ethernet ports, power outlets, and video connectors for the TV right on the back of the desk, but internet access and WiFi should be free in a hotel of this caliber. It's so annoying to have to pay for WiFi every single day when all I might need to do on a particular day is check my email or look up a restaurant. WiFi is more important than an in-room telephone or a TV, yet I have to pay for it? And speaking of TV, why bother to install gorgeous flat screens in every room and then hook up low-def analog cable to them? This is not the first luxury hotel I've seen with this problem, but I expected more from a hotel that had it's building recently completed from the ground up. Any hotel over 3 stars should have digital high definition cable and an onscreen program guide. I guarantee that anyone who can afford to stay at this property abandoned the Preview Channel at least 5 years ago at their own residence, so I don't appreciate being made to stare at a non-interactive scrolling program listings when I'm on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very stylish”
Reviews.Author: bradhaney
Reviews.Content: We stayed a single night at the Loden on our way back from Vancouver Island. Our flight was delayed multiple times, and the people at the Loden handled everything flawlessly. They changed dinner reservations at last minute, and greeted my wife with a big "Happy Birthday" at the door as we arrived at 10PM. The location is very central for Vancouver. The rooms are modern and stylish. The service and staff made it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: robleroad
Reviews.Content: Probably the nicest and most welcoming staff - right down to housekeeping. Rooms were really lovely, well-appointed, comfortably with GREAT beds and fabulous linens. The only bummer is the overnight parking fee and you are stuck with it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CharlesGrant
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Loden were very helpful and courteous. The room was very comfortable, and the location convenient.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aztravelgal57
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel!! It was amazing service. Everything the staff recommended was great. They were a class act-even comped an appetizer at a restaurant they made reservations for us. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable. We highly recommend it and would absolutely stay there again. Great value but luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: giese
Reviews.Content: Totally fantastic stay at Loden! Big rooms, nice decor, very good food, great location, staff SO nice and super friendly - Stacey and Josh at front desk are the best! Thank you for a wonderful stay - we will stay at Loden if we come back to Vancouver again. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loden is a great location, quiet, hip, and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Bpop1991
Reviews.Content: The Loden Hotel is a great location, quiet, hip, and great amenities, and caters well to the film and entertainment industry. Highly recommend this hotel to all travelers from California and throughout the world, great spot in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for people looking to explore downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: gorge_hiker
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel is impressively modern (marble bathrooms, tasteful decor, large flat-screen TV, etc), impeccably clean, extremely comfortable bed, etc. Well worth the extra few bucks if you can find a good rate. Remember that if you want to park, there's no hotel lot and valet parking will set you back $35/day and wifi is extra, but they're very good at explaining this upfront (not trying to hit you with hidden fees). I was most impressed by the friendly service. For example, I mistakenly booked the wrong dates, but upon notifying them of the error, they promptly refunded my original cancelation fee and rebooked me for the correct dates at the rate I had originally reserved the room for (and when I arrived, I was given a complimentary room upgrade). Great service all around. Do try one of the cocktails at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my 2 night stay. I had a super-comfy king size bed with plenty of room. Floor to ceiling windows added a lot of light during the day. My room was across from the elevator and it was still quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They even have complementary bikes to take out (they're not great but nice for a short excursion - rent one near Stanley park for a longer ride - biking is a great way to see the city). It was a short walk to Robson street and the waterfront and ~10 min walk to Davie and Denman streets for restaurants and Stanley park. There's free internet and a free Business center if you don't have a computer. A 7-eleven and drugstores are around the corner. Tip: The Sky Train is 1-1/2 blks away. It requires a transfer to get from/to the airport, but if you have a roller, it's 3.75CAD versus >35CAD for a taxi. From the airport take the skytrain to Waterfront. Then transfer to the other line and go one stop. Exit the station and turn 180 degs. Go 1-1/2 blks to the hotel Tip: There are 3-4 rental car agencies a short walk away. As in-town rentals are often cheaper than at the airport, you might save money renting in town. I got my best rate on Travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite perfect, but a fantastic hotel nonetheless”
Reviews.Author: han1974
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a 5-night stay @ The Loden. Got a great online deal directly thru the hotel for $189/night CAD, which is fantastic given how busy Vancouver is during the Summer. After reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor, I must say my expectations for The Loden were sky high. Having said that, most, but not all, of my expectations were met. I requested an early check-in and while they couldn't accommodate me at the time of my arrival, the room was ready within an hour and our luggage was waiting for us in our room by the time we returned. The Loden King room is beautiful, complete with floor-to-ceiling windows, spacious closets, very functional desk/workspace, and a L-shaped sectional that fit beautifully into the corner of the room. The king bed was super comfortable, complete with 4 king-size pillows that lended itself to 5 nights' great sleep. It really felt like a home away from home, minus a kitchen. The bathroom is gorgeous - sliding door between the bathroom and hallway, and another sliding door that shows or conceals the bathroom from the rest of the room. There is a two-sided mirror that makes it great for 2 people to get ready at the same time w/o getting in each other's way. The bathroom had great counter and storage space, featured a deep, large soaking tub, with frosted glass door leading to the toilet, and another frosted glass door leading to the shower. The service from the staff was great throughout our stay - very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful all the way. We took advantage of the hotel's car service multiple times to get to Yaletown and also had drinks @ Voya, the hotel's restaurant/bar (which is very beautiful). Despite all of the great attributes of the room, there were some flaws that slightly impacted our stay. First, there was a leak in the rain shower head that sprayed water out over the shower door. The shower head didn't seem fully secured and had low water pressure, which I think went hand-in-hand. Second, the battery for the safe in our room malfunctioned twice, so I had to call the front desk for help so our valuables could be secured. Third, as others have mentioned, you must request an iron and ironing board -- kinda unusual for a luxury hotel of its stature. Fourth, any changes we made to the room temperature trigged a small leak in the AC unit in the ceiling right above the room entrance/closets, but we worked around it by keeping the room at the same temperature after day 1. As a whole, I highly recommend the Loden and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: mwcochran
Reviews.Content: Really good room and staff. The location was really nice because it very quiet but very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “just the right touch”
Reviews.Author: kevin067
Reviews.Content: great room, great service, really enjoyed the use of the bikes for a ride around Stanley Park, really enjoyed the appy at Joe Fortes that was compliments of our consierge. Great bathroom....comfortable deep tub and wonderful rain shower. The room was very quiet and the bed oh so comfortable. I do think the internet conection in the rooms should be complimentary though. I look forward to returning again to the Loden.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place. Rooms amazingly well...”
Reviews.Author: ExpectTooMuch
Reviews.Content: Terrific place. Rooms amazingly well prepared and designed. Staff really great at helping you out with anything. Breakfast worth the $20, so nice... Lastly, they have a London cab to shuttle you around when needed... Will definitely return... One thing, the windows could do with a clean outside, 12th floor a little dirty, but hey, they may be getting done next week and I was simply here the week before...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: foodiehotelguy
Reviews.Content: The Loden is an amazing hotel! It is located within walking distance to many things (Canda Place). Just an FYI, the hotel is small in terms of public space, so don't expect a big lobby arrival expirience. If that doesn't matter to you, the rooms are great - especially the guest bathroom. The shower was amazing and the amenties were great as well. Beyond the physical product (which as a hotel owner, I gave an A+) the staff was extremely friendly, knowledgeable, non-evasive, and just a pleasure to be around. When in Vancouver - I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow wonderful stay,great rooms,cozy design,yoga mat in the closet.”
Reviews.Author: erimleb
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone We stayed there for 4 nights,they have a great bar.Staff was extremely helpful.Walking distance to mostly places little bit far to yale town.Very nice hotel.Sometimes rates might be high,but if you can catch the right time,you can get good deals.I think one of the best hotels in vancouver,boutique and cozy. Try it,you wont regret your decision

Reviews.Title: “Superb package with some minor imperfections”
Reviews.Author: Max2502
Reviews.Content: I arrived early and fully expected to have my luggage stored whilst having to either come back or wait for a room. To my immense delight, the receptionist offered to see if he could help me and after a brief wait checked me in early. I stayed here for a week and it was extremely pleasant. A great location with very well appointed rooms. The corner room with floor to ceiling glass on both sides was very nice indeed, although there was not much of a view. My only slight issues with this hotel were the following: -the newspaper was not delivered every day, as requested. -no coffee or tea facilities in the room. You have to put on your gown and go downstairs to get a cup of coffee in the morning. No slippers are provided so you might want to take your own. -the business centre is a tiny box, taking one person at a time. If someone is using it then you're going to be inconvenienced for a while. Furthermore, the lobby area is very small and lacks character and ambience. If youy like the buzz of well appointed hotel lobbies, you won't find it here. I guess this is in keeping with the boutique nature of the hotel. All in all, the good far outweighed these minor points and I believe that it offered excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Character with great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: TJS2009
Reviews.Content: We spent a week traveling throughout the Northwest Coast region, and so were expecting to pay a little more for lodging. Our budget for lodging was at the "clean and comfortable but modest" level, but we decided to splurge a little bit for our last two nights in Vancouver. This is not to say that the Loden was expensive; in fact it is probably cheaper than its peers. From the first moment we walked into the lobby, the Loden is true to the images and styling on its website. It is unique and trendy, with a distinct effort by its designers to make you feel like immersing yourself during your stay there. This styling only increased in our room. The small couch, comfortable bed, and elegant entertainment system invites you to stay. The bathroom is equally elegant, with a sliding wall which provides the opportunity to control the amount of privacy. The large glass-enclosed shower was very nice as well. Our only complaints were the sink's tendency to spray water everywhere when used, and the presence of only a single computer in the business center. On the note of hotel services, it must be mentioned that the fitness center at the Loden was also topknotch. The equipment is all high quality, and the Loden-styling is still very much present. If we weren't already pleased with our stay, the valet that returned our car to us made the feeling stick permanently. He knew that we would be driving down to Seattle that day, and so he took the initiative to place two complimentary bottles of water in our car. Nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacationNow2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in late July. Booked the hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Rooms are exceptional in design and are roomier than at other hotels in this quality bracket. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Loden Hotel was everything we expected.....from location to comfort.”
Reviews.Author: cmnapp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location to downtown Vancouver. We walked to Stanley Park, Robson Street and even the ferry to Granville Island. The front desk staff was very helpful from our early check-in request to recommendations for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing but too short of a stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: nikhil_nj
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Loden and loved our stay there. Pros: - The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. Travelling with a 3yr old is not always easy but they made our stay wonderful! (They were extremely helpful when we had a bit of a medical emergency -- false alarm....THANK YOU!) - The room was great. It is a boutique hotel, after all! - We didn't dine at the Voya as we're much more impromptu eaters... but room service was good. - Location -- just close enough to the action without being in a noisy area. Also just 2 blocks from Coal Harbour -- what a great place to take a stroll the first day after arriving. Negatives -- - Hard pressed to find any real negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Something different, friendly stylish boutique hotel but watch the valet charges”
Reviews.Author: clydewales
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel opened it's doors just a couple of years ago. Overall a positive experience but several issues detracted from an otherwise fair value package. An imaginative restaurant affordable menu with top notch friendly service which applied to valet staff, hosekeeping and concierge services, even the front desk. Response time for fixing an annoying TV problem was very fast as well. A few things need sorting however. Here's my gripe list: Leaky shower door allowed water to spread far and wide - dangerous on marble floor. Shower head collides with inward opening door and ends up pointing at the wall instead of you & is unreachable to all except the tallest guest. There are no coffee/tea making facilities in-room but the lobby offers the very highest quality European coffee if you can be bothered to head down there as soon as you're out of bed. The bed frame projected far enough to cause stubbed toes on the metal leg. Ouch! So lot's of poorly thought out teething design issues that didn't spoil our stay. The check-out procedure revealed valet parking charges that topped a whopping $47 a night if you include HST and specific parking related taxes. Guests better check the valet charge before booking. After searching for a fair deal, much of the value offered is lost on valet charges. The hotel should be more up front in revealing this at time of booking. I was partly at fault for not checking. Rooms don't have much of a view unless on the higher floors. On the plus side, it was nice to have only 7 rooms per floor. The hotel is spotlessly clean & sharp and well located. There were several excellent value all day breakfast joints within 100 metres of the lobby, so no need to pay hotel restaurant rates to start your day. Will we return? Probably - one day, if the rate includes a declared fair value for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act”
Reviews.Author: tonycnyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden for a long weekend getaway over my birthday in July. It was a great choice. This small-ish hotel is impeccably maintained and has all the amenities world-class travelers expect: central location, stylish rooms with mind-blowing bathrooms, turndown service, helpful concierge services, complimentary morning coffee bar, gym, office suite, etc. The staff is only too happy to accommodate special requests from guests whenever possible. In our case that meant asking for an extra-late check out for our redeye flight back to NYC. Management graciously allowed to use the room well into the evening for a small fee. Very classy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flackie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a park vista room. Right from check in we had no problems, staff were attentive but not overbearing. Room was spacious and very clean with free wi fi. We used the 2 complimentary bikes that the hotel have to ride around Stanley Park which was great. You have to book them and you get a 3 hour slot which is ample time. Good location about 10 minute walk to shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: bos2sea
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2-night stay at the Loden. I can't say enough about the Loden's professional, friendly, responsive staff - which is why I scored it with 4 stars rather than 3. Their excellence mostly made up for a couple of things we thought were not so excellent about the hotel itself. First, our biggest annoyance was a persistent vibratory noise in our room which seemed to be coming from the elevator bank. We spent our first night in a room on the 8th floor almost directly across from the elevators, and the thrumming/vibration each time an elevator moved was very obvious and quite irritating (even wearing earplugs you could hear/feel it). The next morning I informed the front desk of this, and they very willingly moved us to a room on the 11th floor further down the hall from the elevators. Although being further down the hall seemed to lessen the vibratory noise, we could still hear it. Given that there are only about 10 rooms on each floor of the hotel, and since our room the 2nd night was near the end of the hallway (with the elevators in the middle of the hallway), I would guess that the vibratory noise is present in most if not all rooms of the hotel. I would be curious to know if any other guests have noticed this. The other thing that bothered us (and which can easily be corrected by hotel management) is a wide gap between the glass shower door and the wall which allows water from the shower to easily spray/leak out onto the bathroom floor. So much for a nice, dry shower mat to step out on. Have other guests noticed this? My own glass shower door at home has a clear silicone gasket along the edge of the door to prevent this from happening - why the shower doors in the Loden don't have this same gasket is puzzling. Apart from these two issues, the Loden is a nice hotel with a laid-back vibe that is not trying to be as splashy as a lot of the newer trendy hotels are trying to be. We liked that. With regard to recommending the Loden to a friend, I would make sure they know about the vibration noise in the rooms before they book to make sure this is not going to bother them as it did us.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, helpful staff, lovely room, good value.”
Reviews.Author: DonStanley
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel and thorougly enjoyed our stay. The location was ideal for sight seeing and restaurants, the staff were very helpful and the room was modern, particularly the bathroom, with plenty of space for clothes. Good value. The only minor criticism was no tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom. Tea and coffee were available in the lobby in the morning, but only up to around 9.30.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service and fantastic Beds”
Reviews.Author: JDSher
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in the service was perfect. the restaurant/lounge servers, valet it was all top notch. a fresh change and my new favourite spot in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the "Chic to Shore" package!”
Reviews.Author: gatorgal75
Reviews.Content: We chose the Loden's "Chic to Shore" package for our one night stay before a cruise departure. It included a $50 restaurant credit and transport to the pier. We especially like what I'll call the eco-modern decor of the rooms. Clean and crisp. The sliding panel between the sleeping area and the bath makes the room seem all that much larger. The staff is super friendly and ready to please. Our most pleasant experience was using the restaurant credit for our evening meal at the Voya Restaurant. We had two wonderful entrees, a braised lamb shank with pea and mint and lemon risotto, and the halibut with vegetable salsa, pine nuts and sauteed kale. This was truly an unexpected delight. We thought the morning coffee service in the lobby was a unique idea, and we used it both before and after our 2 hour walk to and from the lighthouse in Stanley Park the morning of our departure. It was a relaxing walk along the harbor on a quiet drizzly Saturday morning. All in all a most pleasant prelude to our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “NEW, HIP YET COMFORTABLE AND SPACIOUS WITH BRILLIANT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: New2theSouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is FABULOUS!!! It's new, hip and modern yet inviting and very comfortable (which isn't always the case with these new modern hotels). The staff is unbelievably service oriented. The rooms are large and extremely well appointed and equipped and the bathrooms are gorgeous--huge shower (room for two :)), large soaker tub, separate toilet, marble, etc. Floor to ceiling windows cover one entire wall. What can I say--I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else now that I've been here. Location is also perfect--three blocks from the water and three blocks from Robson Street.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek luxury amidst old fashioned service”
Reviews.Author: AZyoulikeit
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading strong reviews on TripAdvisor. We were very pleased with the decor and ambiance of the hotel and its amenities, but the attentive staff seems to be what sets it apart. They offer helpful guidance for exploring the area and feedback on restaurants we had heard about before arriving. Peter at Voya knows what makes a great drink (and delivers). The hotel itself is well-located. We were able to walk to Stanley Park and get to Robson for shopping very easily. There are a couple of small downsides. The sink splashes water out, and the standard room has very little storage space for clothes during your stay. Those aren't dealbreakers, but it's room for improvement. There is a charge for in-room internet, but the business center is free to use. Our favorite perk was taking advantage of the hotel car. They helped us get to our dinner reservations on time and without the pain of walking in heels.

Reviews.Title: “treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: joanne154990
Reviews.Content: The last hotel of our driving trip from Calgary to Vancouver was the Loden. I have stayed in many fabulous hotels but this experience was memorable from the time we pulled up to the curb until we left. Staff is extremely friendly but also professional. This boutique hotel is what I call quite high tech (and we are not!). The bell hop was very patient and helpful in explaining everything to us. I had phoned the hotel before we arrived for a recommendation for a near by seafood restaurant and was given an excellent choice- Joe Forte"s where we had a great dinner. We were disappointed we didn't have another night to eat at the hotel as it looked fabulous. Beds are very comfortable and bathrooms are very neat!!! We had an early morning flight to catch , and had a 4:30 a.m. wake up call. In the lobby when the elevator door opened a staff member was waiting for us, and immediately took our luggage to our car that they had right outside the front door. We were shocked that there was no charge for valet parking. He told us to help ourselves to coffee, cappuccino, steamed milk... that was all set out. (lobby is beautiful) In the car he had left a bottle of cold water for us. We were very impressed by everything and everybody in this hotel. The location is great- about 3 blocks from shopping on Robson and a few blocks from the water and the Olympic cauldron. Too bad there are not any other locations!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: KGTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 8 days in May 2010 and really liked the hotel. It feels quite boutiquey and the service was friendly and professional. We had a corner suite so had lots of light in the room and the bathroom felt huge (although very dark - maybe the black tiles are a bit too much). My only little gripes are that the TV was up very high on the wall and a bit temperamental changing channels and that the sink splashes when you run the tap. Although we were staying with a young baby, we never felt too out of place amongst the other guests and the travel cot was clean and came with cute little toys for the stay. The gym is functional and was quiet when we stayed. Unfortunately we did not get to eat or drink at the hotel. If I came back to Vancouver I would definitely consider staying here again as it was nice and central, but hardly any road noise at night. Robson Street was minutes away and Stanley Park only 20 minutes by foot too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, wonderfully furnished, and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sirwollliam
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Loden. The dowtown location was great for getting around. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room was spacious and clean. the floor to ceiling windows had great views, and the furnishings were high quality, right down to the yoga mat, and shoe horn. The bathroom was loaded with a huge tub, modern fixtures, lighting dimmers, and tv audio with volume control, and the towels felt like they were brand new. The room doesn't come with an iron and ironing board and the front desk sent it up the moment I asked for them. No in-room coffee maker either, but they have free coffee in the lobby every morning. Parking is a little steep at $35/day. That said, I would stay there again in a heartbeat. The Loden really spoilt us,and it will be hard for any hotel to come close.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Needavaca11
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vancouver. The location is amazing- being very close to the water and Coal Harbor. Being a big dork, I called a couple times to ask some location/activity questions before we got to the hotel. We spoke with several people and they were all very helpful. Once we arrived we were greeted by Calvin. During out entire stay he was very helpful, kind, and very on top of it all! He was typically the manager on staff and we were very impressed with his attention to detail and his willingness to go out of his way to make us happy. I am extremely happy that we stayed at the Loden- good location, helpful staff, cute rooms- well decorated and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ahme
Reviews.Content: After much research on tripadvisor I thought this was going to be the perfect hotel. Great location once we found it. I was very surprised by the size of the rooms ... tiny .... If it were not for the floor to ceiling windows I would have gone nuts. Bathroom nice but small as well. If you want ice you have to ask for it in the (also small) lobby. Since it was the hottest August on record we were grateful for the airconditioning!!!

Reviews.Title: “I have been utterly spoilt!”
Reviews.Author: deezerness
Reviews.Content: I have decided on the Loden as my "treat" hotel for my birthday week whilst travelling based on the reviews here and I must say that the Loden did not disappoint. I was upgraded to a corner king room upon check-in and the room was magnificent. It had floor to ceiling windows, a really comfortable bed, large screen tv and the most ergonomic and luxurious tub ever! I mentioned that this it was my birthday the next day (yes, Stacey I am looking at you!!) and voila, I get a lovely platter of chocolate truffles and brownies in my room the next day, together with a message from the team to contact their experience specialists should I need anything at all. The hotel from the outside was very discreet and it made me feel like I was privy to a special club. Doors open almost magically just as you near it and staff always greeted you. I have recommended this place to my hairstylist and my travel agent to pass on this little piece of treasure to their friends. Should I ever have another celebratory occasion in Vancouver, this will be the place I will INSIST upon! Kudos to the Loden, you're a star!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: miss_christine1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loden when I was traveling on business. The staff was courteous, helpful and fast when I needed room service. The rooms are beautiful and the view is decent. The lounge next door is great for drinks after work. I don't recommend the vegetarian in-room dining option, it wasn't cooked well. If you are vegetarian, I suggest ordering in or going to one of the sushi places near by. I also went to Whistler for the day and the hotel is only 10 mins from the Greyhound bus station. Overall I would recommend this hotel for anyone traveling on business, with friends or as a couple. As a bonus, i've heard that celebrities have stayed there and saw it featured in a magazine recently.

Reviews.Title: “You will love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: roseguinea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loden in March. This hotel is wonderful. The service was amazing and the staff were extremely friendly. The location is extremely convenient. It is located in the financial district so it was a little quiet on the weekend. But it is walking distance from just about everything, including a metro stop and good shopping. The hotel is very modern in design and you can tell it is a newer hotel. You will love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: noxinnhoj
