Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Saturday night for a local one night getaway.Everything was awesome,nice staff,very nice rooms,extremely clean.Location is great,we walked to the granville street entertainment area(fun bars),via Robson street(great shopping).Before we went out on the town ,we hit the hotel lounge,very comfy,great oysters too.The nicest smaller hotel we have ever stayed in!The beds are deluxe,the bathrooms are even better!! No complaints whatsoever..

Reviews.Title: “Great City Escape!”
Reviews.Author: Murrmanator
Reviews.Content: Awesome experience here. The lounge is cool, food was great and the service was awesome. They new it was a special occaision and had a complimentary bottle of bubbly waiting. The car service was cool and convenient. I live in the city and they made us feel as though we were away on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek & modern”
Reviews.Author: lovendancing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov '09 for 3 nights and loved the room. Modern and well designed with just a few minor faults that should be fixed if they wish to maintain their high rating. Pros: I loved the walls that move to expose or hide the bathroom, the floor to ceiling windows and ability to open for fresh air was appreciated, lots of counter/closet space and well set-up for work/computer, nice decor and great location (very convenient for the seawall and Robson St). Cons: Bathroom sink design very poor - splashes you everytime you turn the water on (staff felt it necessary to warn us of this problem), shower leaking so water spray present on shower floor, soap shelf falling off (caulking coming loose), some missed spots with cleaning. The lounge was modern and chic with comfortabe chairs. All in all a very nice hotel, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I can dig it”
Reviews.Author: BarryWE
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel quite a bit. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The room, with its floor-to-ceiling window wall was nice. Cool bathroom with two sliding doors that closed the room but when left open really opened up the space. Distinct toilet area with door and a big deep tub - both a plus. The rate spot-on with other hotels in the area. I also liked the small window that could be opened to get some fresh air. The location was good for me. Close to Robson St. and striking distance to Gastown and Coal Harbor. A bit of a walk to Yaletown but totally doable. Anything further south would be a long trek by foot or a cab ride. Will definitely want to check out that area next time. Had food from Voya in the restaurant once. While the arugula salad was just ok (croutons?), the buffalo rib eye was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept Secret Hotel AND Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellerBC
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a find! The Loden, located on Melville between Bute and Smythe. We were given a 1-bedroom suite. Totally outfitted with a WiiFit (didn't use...and after you hear about the food, you'll know why)...dvd player, large (46"?) TV's in living room and bedroom. Beautiful bathroom with separate toilet, shower and tub. The Voda Restaurant was amazing. Soup and Sandwich lunch was amazing... crab sandwich and butter squash soup. Dinner was beyond all expectations. The quality and presentation was outstanding. The wines that were suggested matched the food perfectly. Can't rate it high enough. The Gym has state of the art equipment (the spin bikes look like they are going 40 MPH just standing still) and it it open 24 hours a day. We booked massages which were given in a room outfitted with 2 massage tables and an infra-red sauna. The hotel staff were wonderful. Everyone greeted you. Asked if you were staying in the hotel...seemed truly interested in our answers. Not sure what the CAA/AAA status is....but easilly should qualify for a 4-diamond award.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Upscale Hotel with Friendly, Professional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Readnour
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and kids (2 yrs and 5 yrs) for a couple of days getaway from home. I chose the KLoden based on the reviews in the Trip Advisor and I was more than happy with the decision. From the booking, to the valet service, to check in and hotel quality I give the hotel and it's staff the highest ratings. The staff was willing (and located) to help us find my son's shoes that he'd kicked off in the car and that we were looking for in the rain. They found the missing shoe and brought it up to the room less than 10 minutes after we'd returned after they parked our vehicle in their secure facility. The front desk offered to take us anywhere we wanted to go - aquarium - in their vehicle so we could enjoy and not worry about the parking or driving in an unfamiliar city. very person working at the Loden was friendly, helpful, nice and pleasent to be around. We felt we had a great stay. The room was beautiful, immaculate and silent. I would recommend going as a couple, which was not an option for us, but it would be a scenic and romantic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: skibunny-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 teenage sons for 1 night after returning from Whistler/Blackcomb. The hotel is beautiful - clean & very modern, & well located. The rooms are a very nice size with gorgeous bathrooms & amenities. Fabulous bed - big fluffy comforter, high quality sheets. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful with suggesting dinner reservations,getting us a a taxi for the airport,printing business documents, etc. I really loved this hotel & would definitely return. I would love to have stayed here longer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AMG007
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed hotel. Absolutely no flaws. And above all: exquisitely friendly and helpful staff. Good location in close proximity of shops, restaurants and famous Gastown district. Excellent restaurant & bar ("Voia") in the hotel. Wouldn't choose another one in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ezpeezy
Reviews.Content: I am a native Vancouverite but have since relocated to LA. As someone who knows the area let me tell you that The Loden is close to everything a tourist could ask for, steps from The Burrard Skytrain Station but tucked away from traffic. Close to shopping, sightseeing and great restaurants. The room service was of outstanding quality. And the rooms are very well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “What Great Hotel is all about”
Reviews.Author: TheRefSingapore
Reviews.Content: My reservation was made for me as I was part of a Conference Group so not having heard of the hotel I wanted to ensure the business facilities I needed were there.From the moment I arrived until the time I left the entire experience was "Outstanding". All the staff came across as genuinely enjoying their jobs, plenty of smiles, nothing a problem , engaged ( key behaviour) in genuine conversation and were similar to Cathay Pacific cabin crew, helpful and attentive with a smile. This hotel would give a lot of the big brand hotels some lessons in service. To round it off I misplaced an engraved pen and discoverd I had left it at the hotel when an email arrived to let me know they had found it. It was mailed and arrived in due course. It just goes to show that with the right culture and environment people excel . The Loden was outstanding. Ray Bigger Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Braddock54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in late November, and it was a great place to stay. Nicely decorated rooms and the staff was very pleasant. Can't beat it at what I paid, which was 135 a night! On quiet street in Vancouver, close to Skytrain as well! I would recommend this hotel for sure! Just take your lumps and pay for valet parking, it is worth it and is secure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at the Loden mid October and was rather happy to have chosen the hotel. Service is top notch as I had experienced in other Kor properties. The hotel is rather new (maybe just over a year or so), so rooms are very modern and comfy (great bathroom with separate bath and power shower, first class beauty products), great bed, tv with surround sound also in the bathroom. My room had lake views, which were partially obstructed by other buildings. They have a trendy bar and a restaurant (very good breakfast, small menu), and the staff is quite attentive and not pushy for any additional service. This area of town is very modern and very convenient for business, but the hotel is also close to one of the main shopping streets (Robson) and plenty of restaurants (Joe Fortes is really good for seafood!). Staying at the Loden is very convenient for sightseeing, and Vancouver is indeed a very beautiful city. I will definitely stay here again when I come back.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the quiet location”
Reviews.Author: manningpark
Reviews.Content: If you have business anywhere between Burrard and Denman this new Hotel offers a great location. It is on a quiet street was only a short two blocks for me down to the seawall and very close to the Burrard Skytrain. Some of there fixtures are more form than function, including a bathroom sink and clock radio that are poor designs but the bathroom spout was one of the coolest things I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Lives Up to the Rating”
Reviews.Author: RobynnM
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location (near the water, Starbucks, restaurants/bars and shopping), modern rooms, great price, gym was awesome and staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location, great city”
Reviews.Author: merri175
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. I could go on and on about it, but I'm not as eloquent as the previous advisors! We were blown away by the service, the quality and the location of this hotel. The staff were outstanding, the room huge and beautiful and any room where I can sit in the deep bath/tub and still see the television AND hear it because of speakers in the bathroom is pretty impressive! The separate toilet is great, the bathroom wall opened up to the bedroom area, which was nice, and the sofa in the corner of the room was just great for lounging and reading by lamp light. The access to the business center was a nice touch and as we had a lot of things to organise for the rest of our holiday it was much appreciated! Great location, beautiful room, wonderful staff- if you need to stay in Vancouver you can't go past the Loden.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: xoxx
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms. Chic and compact with lots of nice amenities. Great location in downtown Vancouver. Great bar area and restaurant. Staff are friendly and helpful. Stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: Verlinda-California
Reviews.Content: Over the top ambiance, amenities and staff. Four Star, but felt like "Five". Loved the thick robes, slippers, contemporary decor and luxurious feel. Exceded our expectations for the cost. Will recommend to all of our friends and families visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Unobtrusive service, clean, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Violet_DeFlowers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively new so there are a few kinks that still need to be worked out...the disconnect on rates among the website, the reservation desk, and the front desk was extremely irritating - initially booked online 2 months out, 3 weeks before, I checked rates on line and they were cheaper. I called the reservation line to have them switch me to the new rate, they transferred me to the front desk, the front desk couldn't find the rate, and so on and so on. I spent about 20 minutes going around in circles on this. Was finally assured the online rate. But when I checked out, they had me at a higher rate than either of the ones I had booked!!! They definintely need to pull it together. Also, on arrival, upon inquiring about the possibility of rain, one of the front desk staff quipped that if we wanted nice weather "we should have stayed in San Francisco"!!! Other than those issues, as far as the hotel itself, I liked the spa like boutique-y feel, the bath products were spectacular, the bed was very comfortable, and the 2x day room service was spoiling! I may try somewhere else the next time though - possibly the Shangra La. One other thing is - why charge $20/day for wireless internet. Seems like a silly nickle and diming on a $300+ room

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SAMSEA2009
Reviews.Content: Its a modern hotel, close to everything. The staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Very impressed with this hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: nwwriter
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel from the minute we arrived and were greeted by the valet. Then when we entered the lobby, wow! Very stylish décor. The front desk staff were simply awesome and genuinely friendly. Service was all around excellent. The room was another wow! Impressive, stylish décor, huge bathroom, tons of closet space, and the bed and linens were the best we have had in a long time. All of the staff always greeted us by name, even the housekeeper! Excellent views of the city and waterfront. While we didn’t get a chance to dine in the restaurant, the bar and restaurant looked very impressive. Location is excellent, within easy walking distance to shopping and site seeing. We never used our car or a taxi. Didn’t need it. This place has it’s act together and is truly a gem in Vancouver. Highly recommended. Our teenager wants to move into the hotel as a permanent guest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 2012Toronto2012
Reviews.Content: "bmeeder" review below from Sept 17, 2009 captured it all. Rather than repeat things in the other reviews the only thing i will add is that the rooms are very soundproof. You will have a great sleep with no city noise or noise from the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff good location. Very new hotel. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Surferscott
Reviews.Content: Great value on a luxurious, trendy hotel in downtown Vancouver. Great Staff, Good value. Go to thier website for discounts

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Loden”
Reviews.Author: mate0517
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty amazing. The room was great. The bed was extremely comfortable. I loved the large TV . We had a Park Vista room so we had a partial view of the mountains and harbor. I thought the location was great. Pretty much close to everything. I do have two negative comments. The wireless internet is not free. Most 4 star hotels provide free wireless. Second, we had a slight issue with our bill and the person checking us was not accomodating at first.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing hotel room...and customerservice.”
Reviews.Author: bmeeder
Reviews.Content: Probably the best modern hotel room we'ver ever stayed in. Only a year old, some design firm thought of EVERYTHING today's travelers would want in their room. While checking-in, we were given a green tea-flavored iced drink...perfect, and very welcome at the time. The front desk associate walked us to the elevator to show us how to wave our card in front of a panel (they don't swipe them in this system). We walked into our corner room (not a suite) which had floor-to-ceiling (extra high ceilings) windows across two walls (including a portion of the window that actually OPENS), and were greeted by soft music already playing on the very nice clock radio. The room is modern, and tastefully decorated in subdued hues with a splash of color here and there. An extra-large flat screen TV hangs from the ceiling, and greets us with our name on it. This leaves extra room on the dresser and desk (good idea, not seen in older hotels). The desk has a dozen different electronic connections right on top of it, so you don't have to hunt for outlets. You can connect anything to this desk. Bed = ultra comfortable. Love seat in room with comfy pillows. Filled water container on night stand accompanied by card with clever quote from Bob Dylan. Umbrella hanging in closet, along with steamer to take the wrinkles out of your clothes. Water and wine glasses on etegere await whatever libations you want from the mini-bar. Bathroom is amazing. Solid marble everywhere. Etched glass door to stand-alone shower with adjustable rainfall showerhead and separate glass door to toilet. Large soaking tub with waterfall fill, along with glass jar filled with bath salts on the marble surround. European-style sink and fixtures. Plenty of room. Dimmers on the halogen light fixtures...separate over tub and sink. TV sound piped-in to ceiling speaker with volume control. Terrycloth robes, of course, and two pairs of terry slippers engraved "Relax" and "Revive" are a nice personal touch. The restaurant off the lobby matches the hotel's contemporary design and is soothing to look at but pretty loud when full of diners. I told the maitre d' that the seared halibut in a chowder sauce was the best piece of fish I've ever had. Try it. Every staff member we encountered was professional, friendly, and well...perfect. The hotel's location is in walking distance to many downtown sites. And the price (they guaranteed their own web site will be the lowest cost...it was, I checked, comparing Canadian dollars to Canadian dollars) was significantly cheaper than the Fairmont-type hotels we had been staying at in several Canadian cities. This hotel exceeded our expectations by leaps and bounds.

Reviews.Title: “The Loden delivered on every level!”
Reviews.Author: DLO1975
Reviews.Content: Piror to our four night stay at the Loden, my wife and I had gone back and forth between the Loden and the Opus. Wow, did we make the right choice! The Loden is the perfect combination of location, service, and quality. The lobby and rooms were unique and trendy while remaining welcoming. The hotel was extremely clean, and the bathroom with the sliding wall is truly one of a kind! The staff's dedication to service is evident in every aspect of the hotel. Whether we needed advice on restaurants, hand-written directions, or a ride to dinner or a bar in the Loden's private car; the Loden staff delivered in a big way. The location which is two blocks off Robson and walking distance to just about anywhere in the city was superb! If you're heading to Vancouver and can't decide which hotel to choose, look no further. The Loden is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: Venturer88
Reviews.Content: From the time the courteous valet opened our car, we knew that we were in for an extraordinary treat. Staying in a hotel is not typical for us when we travel - preferring to stay in B & Bs, where one can inituitively expect a certain degree of personal service and charm. The Loden Vancouver delights us with its unsurpassed level of personal service and for a hotel situated in the city - surprisingly delivers on a charm uniquely its own. They key to its success can be simply summed up as: "To provide an unforgettable customer experience". And as a result of a single-mindedness approach to this mission, it does everything well: from the way its staff - including the valet and housekeepers, greet you by name; the zen-like quality of its tastefully-decorated rooms, to the thoughtful courtesies you receive each day. I will make it a point to stay at the Loden everytime I am in Vancouver, for business or leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place - the best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Penelopa159
Reviews.Content: Really! Normally, I don't even write reviews (I only read them) but this place definitely deserves the review. The staff was amazing!! Such nice people - I'm not kidding. The people at the front desk (who worked there on 9/4/09!) and at the door & restaurant - thank you for making our stay wonderful! The hotel is immaculate, the rooms are beautiful, modern, (the bathroom was spectacular!), clean, great quality sheets, comfortable beds, flat screen tv, even umbrella & yoga mat! If you have an opportunity to stay there you should definitely do it. Vancouver was wonderful altogether but the stay at such nice place (what we normally don't do) was just simply this last perfect addition to our already great vacation! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the world!”
Reviews.Author: nwest_mail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden for 3 nights after getting a great deal on their own website through a link form Travelzoo. Right from the greeting at the front door, everything was perfect. The staff are extremely freindly and the room layout is fantastic. This place deserves it's number 1 ranking on Traipadvisor. The location is also one of the best. Close the the beautiful waterfront and close to Robson St. Don't consider anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “An urban-chic oasis in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PetiteSyrah
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a good internet deal, we decided to splurge a bit and stay two nights at the Loden on a recent trip to Vancouver. What a great choice! We loved the hotel---chic decor, friendly staff, great location. Just two blocks from the sea wall, 15-20 minute walk to Stanley Park, to Yaletown, and just a few blocks off of Robson. I hope we get a chance to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Weekend Stay At An Exceptional Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foodie28
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Loden in the early morning of August 21 and were immediately welcomed by the professional friendly front desk staff. Thankfully our room was immediately available as our family was exhausted as we had disembarked from an Alaskan cruise earlier that morning. Our family of four (children ages 15 and 6) stayed in a spacious room (#1205)with two queen beds. The room's design had very clean lines and arguably the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in! Although the bathroom did not have a bath tub, the shower stall was spacious, and my wife enjoyed the heated floor and always appreciates the quality toiletries (Molton Brown). I also appreciated that we had a window that could be opened and the peek-a-book view of Coal Harbor was nice. Can't say enough about the wonderful front desk staff....just warm, friendly and knowledgable. Took care of our special needs (when we informed the front desk that there wasn't a DVD player in our room for our 6-year old son to watch movies, one was installed with an hour) and we were always greeted with a smile as we passed by. The restaurant, Voya is not to be missed.. Restaurants that look cool and hip and catering to a young clientele, usually offer food and service that falls short and in many cases fail miserably. That is not the case with Voya. The cooking is well prepared....not too fussy but creative without being over the top. The kitchen is clearly working with quality ingredients (excellent ceviche, bison, veal cheeks) and the kitchen crew is top notch as the taste is excellent and the presentation definitely adds to the dining experience. The service was not always perfect (e.g. water glasses went unfilled, finished plates lingered a bit too long on the tables) but that said the friendly and GENUINE nature of the wait staff more than made up for any service glitches. We were debating between staying at the Loden and the Shangri-La but decided on the Loden because of our preference to stay at smaller boutique-style properties. I've stayed at many deluxe hotels (e.g. Shangri-La, Four Seasons, SLR) but when you stay at a smaller property that "gets it", it's hard to beat. And the Loden does get it....

Reviews.Title: “Super cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olberto
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with this hotel. We arrived in the middle of heat wave and it was the perfect place to chill out for a couple of nights whilst exploring Vancouver. This is a design conscious style of this hotel, and I half expected the staff to be aloof and pretentious. However, it's actually a design conscious hotel with delightful staff who really helped us to make the most of our short stay with recommendations, float plane bookings etc. They also have a couple of bikes which can be reserved and borrowed for a few hours (no charge). These were perfect for exploring Stanley Park and covering some ground. The hotel itself is set back from Coal Harbour, easy walking distance to shopping, the new Convention Centre, Canada Place etc The room didn't disappoint either. Clean and comfortable, great bed, big flat-screen, stunning bathroom. I can't comment on in-room internet because my laptop didn't make the trip. There's free access in the business centre downstairs though. There's also an impressive gym, which I completely failed to make the most of. All in all, very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, few dissapointments”
Reviews.Author: Bellagio06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to head to Vancouver for a nice weekend getaway. We stayed 3 nights and enjoyed it. The room was a nice size, with nice furnishings. We stayed on the 11th floor, and had a nice view of the city. The nights were very quiet, which we very much appreciated after a long journey. My wife enjoyed the large tub in the bathroom with additional speakers so that she could hear the TV while in the tub. A big frown point was that there was no turndown service to our room (we even put the make up room button on). We arrived back at the hotel at 9pm with the light turned off, but nothing done in the room. We never had bathsalts left at the tub, or a paper at the door. We did book through expedia-and per a previous review that may have been the reason why. That was very dissapointing. Overall a great stay, but not sure it is worth it without the extras.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: lhap
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, and could have stayed for a week. The service was top notch, very friendly and professional. The room was equipped with upgraded technology which my husband loved. My 9 year old daughter took 5 baths in the deep soaking tub with the waterfall faucet. I enjoyed the comfortable beds, and deluxe towels, and linens. The Loden has 2 new "Townie" bikes that they loan for 3 hours. My husband borrowed a bike from the Loden, and my daughter and I rented a tandem bike from a near by bike shop. We rode for 3 hours in Stanley Park and along the sea wall. The Loden is a 2 minute bike ride to the park, and sea wall! Perfect location for restaurants, shopping, walking, and biking. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, we need more hotels like this! !”
Reviews.Author: Chance1234
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I had to check my credit card statement as what we paid for our room after seeing it, was unbelievable good value. Where to start! Great welcome on arrival, stress free valet parking. Excellent room with a fantastic bathroom. Fantastic bar with great friendly staff and a cracking breakfast. Would most definitely come back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Spruce77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Loden in mid-April for 4 nights and loved it. Located on a quiet street within walking distance of virtually everything (or a short cab ride), it's a great place to stay in Vancouver. Every day, we'd walk down to the harbor and all the way to Stanley Park. As soon as we stepped out of the cab at The Loden, the service, professionalism and friendliness were top-notch. Since it's not a large hotel, you feel like the staff actually knows you. We stayed in the beautiful Park Vista Room and had a view of the harbor and other skyscrapers. The rooms are exquisitely appointed and very comfortable. The bathroom was fabulous, especially the large shower. Everything is very modern and high-tech but in a soothing way. Each day we'd return to a spotless room with a special amenity awaiting us like a calming lotion or slippers. We never ate in the restaurant because it was a bit pricey but did have drinks and appetizers one night which was fun. We'll be back in Vancouver this fall and will stay at The Loden. It's one of the best hotel experiences we've had in a long, long time.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTucson
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 20th anniversary at the Loden Hotel July 16 - 20, 2009. We typically look for small boutique hotels as they offer more personalized service than the larger chain hotels. We were not disappointed. Modern and chic in design; centrally located; friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff; and lots of amenities (including WiFi)made this the perfect choice for us. Upon hearing we were there for our anniversary, Mauricio, the pastry chef, sent up a delectable tray of homemade truffles and petit fours. The selections were unbelievably good! Renita and Evan greeted us and made us feel at home. Agi arranged for the complimentary use of great bicycles (w/ locks, map, helmets & water!) for a 4-hour tour of Stanley Park, Granville Island, and great neighborhoods. Charlie and Venzenia were helpful getting us dinner reservations, bus tour info and taxi back to the airport. The use of a fully equipped health club right on premises was a real plus! Upon hearing that we had raved about his candies, Mauricio sent more to our room! My favorite was caramel w/ a touch of sea salt encased in a dark chocolate truffle. My husband liked the ooey-gooey cherry center. Our meal at VOYA, Loden's adjacent restaurant, was the best meal in town, by far. We, of course, hit the famed Indian spot, Vij's, and wished we had spent that night back at Voya's!!! We had NO complaints...great location, great hotel, great price, outstanding staff! Don't hesitate to book your stay at the Loden in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Cartervan
Reviews.Content: Very nice property, opened recently Clean rooms, luxurious.. Great service, and nice location

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: GeneralManager96
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of the Loden was perfect! We were graciously welcomed at the Front Desk, escorted to our room - which was beautiful - floor to ceiling windows with partial water views - fabulous bathroom area. Dinner was fantastic - afternoon cocktails in the lounge an event - very creative delicious drinks. Every staff member made us feel more than welcome. Perfect location - very easy to get everywhere. Couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Had to do this . . .”
Reviews.Author: Aye190
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel quite a bit and stay in many four and five star hotels. Our stay at the Loden is the first to push us over the edge to write a review. We had never been to Vancouver and everyone at the Loden made us feel at home and welcome. We booked the room through travelzoo at a great rate and we were given a corner room. The room is comfortable and well appointed. Downstairs in the restaurant the barmen are incredibly knowledgeable and eager to educate their patrons. We received a fantastic lesson on Bourbon from Simon - I will never look at an old fashion is the same way. The most amazing facet of the Loden are the people that work here. Many companies can spend money to build a first rate facility - creating a business that attracts and keeps talented and caring employees is the difference of good and great.

Reviews.Title: “The best attraction in Vancouver may be where you sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Loves_Italy
Reviews.Content: Background: I am not a regular contributor, but my recent experiences at the Loden moved me to do it now. As a regular traveller I have stayed in virtually every type of resort around the world. In addition, having worked in the service industry at one time I have an appreciation for the effort behind quality service. I am more grizzly bear than kitten as a client. Finally, I have stayed at every top rated hotel in Vancouver but one. This is the best overall experience and stay - period. My experience at the Loden was truly excellent, and for several reasons. First, I have been in Vancouver three times this year, each time at the Loden, and each time was met with truly outstanding service. This is the most important point in my opinion; professional service with a friendly tone is a difficult balance. The staff was very professional without exception, and I can’t remember the last time I could say that about a hotel or restaurant. To be friendly, in an appropriate manner means reading your client and their current mood. The front desk get special mention, but everyone was very good. Second, the standard rooms are better than most ‘superior’ or ‘deluxe’ rooms elsewhere. While not huge in size (it urban Vancouver people), the rooms are spacious, very modern, stylish and very well appointed. Most hotels I have to look at the room key to remember which hotel I’m in they are so monotonous. Not true here. I would be surprised if you did not remember your stay, just based on the room alone. The bed and linen were truly ‘dreamy’. The soaking tub, large walk-in shower, WC, and bath products are all outstanding. The location is subtle, while not on one of the main drags it is very well positioned between the core business district, Robson Street for shopping and dining, and the waterfront leading to Stanley Park. Finally, on our last visit we decided to risk not to go to CinCin (still a personal favourite) and went to the Voya Restaurant located in the hotel. Well it was amazing. I could easily write another article just on the meal we had, but suffice it to say if you haven’t been, go! The balance of flavours and quality of ingredients for all of the dishes was superb. I’m a foodie, and this was exceptional. Vaneta, Stacy, Simon and Michael – Special mention, you’ll meet them if you go. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, if you don't book through Expedia....”
Reviews.Author: emzo789
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on Trip Advisor we were really looking forward to our 3 night stay at the Loden. Our room was nice - comfortable bed and I liked the way the bathroom was wired up for sound (even though 2 of the lights in the bathroom didn't work). The disappointing part came when we tried to use the "free internet" in the room. We'd travelled with a laptop and only booked hotels which advertised free internet as we needed to do work while away. Upon trying to connect to the internet we were charged $15. We called reception to query this as the lady who checked us in, and the guest information in the room both claimed free internet for guests. We were told that because we booked through Expedia, we were not entitled to internet, nor were we entitled to the taxi service mentioned in these reviews, nor a paper in the morning, nor a turn down service in the evening! So basically, we were treated like second-class citizens, even though we paid $240 per night! Although the staff were friendly it seems a very odd management strategy to discriminate against certain full paying guests simply because of the website they booked through. The Loden is nice, but I think there are probably other hotels in Vancouver that would offer better service for the price you pay, and not make you feel like you didn't deserve to be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ErikvanG
Reviews.Content: We sleept at the Loden for 5 nights and loved it. First of all the room was perfect with a great bathroom (with complementary bath salt) and a big flat screen. Also the bed was large and comfy. Second the location was great, just a block away from the beautiful harbours and most importantly Stanley Park. And last but npt least the friendly staff, helpfull were needed and very focussed on service. The greatest hotel we've ever stayed! Tip: look at their Expedia Sales (we got a great deal)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: naughtychimp
Reviews.Content: Based on the the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor, I had high hopes for the Loden. I was not disappointed. The room was gorgeous: huge windows, useful amenities, modern but warm furnishings; luxe bathroom... just great. Since it's relatively new, everything is still in pristine condition and very much on trend. The staff was generally warm and helpful, although during check out the woman helping took far longer than what seemed necessary and needed to ask questions of the guy beside her every two minutes. Whatever; maybe she was in training.... In any case, Vancouver is a pretty city and the Loden is a sleek, spotless place that could hold its own compared to the best hotels of London or Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - If your budget is such that you can't afford to stay here, save until you can!”
Reviews.Author: Nottstravellers
Reviews.Content: We arrived to be greated by the most modern and swish hotel we had stayed in during our Canadian trip. The rooms are very tasteful - completed in a classic contempory fashion, with all the mod cons you would want. Unlike many Canadian hotels, which seem to cater for more traditional European travellers (and are furnished accordingly), the Loden is simple, clean but extremely sumptuous. Can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection. #1 Boutique Hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: charlotte2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden recently. What a fantastic hotel! The service is friendly and attentive, the rooms are beautifully decorated (refreshing clean lines) and modern, and the view is lovely (we could see the water). The beds are heavenly and the gym well-equiped overlooking a wonderfully lush garden. The hotel has a car that will take you out and about downtown Vancouver as well as bikes to explore Stanley Park (both complimentary). We love staying in intimate, boutique hotels and Loden has to be one of the best, if not the best, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Best urban hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lesley_ey
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that we don't usually stay in hotels this nice, but we got an amazing deal through travelzoo (thank you, travelzoo!). Still, I think even people who are used to luxury will be impressed by the Loden. It was a perfect balance of hip design and welcoming comfort. In such a stylish place, you might expect the staff to be snooty, but nothing could be further from the truth. The staff were unfailingly helpful and personable. Our room had everything you might want and more--like the sliding doors that connected the bedroom and bathroom. We used the fitness center, which was well-appointed and super clean. We appreciated touches like the bowl of fresh apples. We ate breakfast and an evening snack in the restaurant, Voya, which was just as chic but friendly as the rest of the hotel. The location was great--not very exciting right around the hotel since it's the financial district, but only a few blocks to Robson Street, the Vancouver Art Gallery, etc. We like to walk so we also walked to where we could catch a water taxi to Granville Island and could have walked to Stanley Park if we'd had more time. Parking is extra and valet is the only option, but when our car was brought around, there were water bottles provided by the staff waiting for us. If we'd paid more, we could have had a room with a view, but we truly couldn't have been happier than we were at the Loden.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cabasf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights this week during a trip to BC from San Francisco. Great hotel - smallish boutique feeling, sophisticated, extremely friendly and helpful staff. Made you really feel welcome. The bar is good atmosphere though service was somewhat nominal...but great tequilla. I am having my friends switch to this hotel after staying here. Only bummer is no steam room/hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark_J_G
Reviews.Content: Trying hard to be trendy, the hotel generally succeeds. Well located in centre of town, Staff could not have been more helpful with check in, restaurant suggestions, anything at all. Great rooms with all sort of tech gadgets meaning you could hook up nearly anything to the big screen, cool bathrooom with great lights and, windows which open. A superb place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Best service and friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: scarlett99
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night at the Loden this past weekend. From the minute you pull up to the curb until they send you off, the service is exceptional. Everyone in the hotel, including the restaurant, is friendly and alway anticipating your needs. This is a small boutique-style hotel located on a beautiful tree-lined street in Vancouver's West End. It is within walking distance of everything you could want -- the harbour, restaurants, shopping, Gastown, you name it, but just enough away from the hustle and bustle to give you a quiet, intimate feel. The room was on the small side, but beautiful. The bathroom is amazing! Black marble floors, very modern furnishings. The turn-down service includes replenshing your towels, adding a eucalyptus "bath therapy" to the amenities, fresh cold water by the bed and the ice bucket filled. They even turned on the lamps beside the bed and set the radio to some soothing music. The bedside lamps and all the lighting in the bathroom have dimmer switches. The main thing about this hotel is the personal, friendly service you will receive. When our car was brought around by the valet, it was stocked with two cold bottles of water for our trip home. All in all, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not blown away”
Reviews.Author: thalgizouzle
Reviews.Content: I must preface this review by noting the special circumstance that we stayed here for our wedding night. So, to begin, in the context of that circumstance, this hotel was disappointing. First, despite having noted this fact in our booking and having posed some questions about early check-in etc, we were not contacted at any point during the month or so between booking and staying. Second, we were a little underwhelmed by the service. Finally, to the hotel itself, the public areas are small but pleasant, though the whole hotel feels very business-hotel in personality. The room was very nice - a good size, stylish, comfortable, and well laid-out. The location is also quite good - in walking distance to many things, though perhaps not the most lively neighbourhood in itself. I would say it is a reasonable choice for a business trip or possibly for a romantic weekend, but context of both the raving reviews below and a myriad of other hotels in the world, we really didn't find this to be anything incredible.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right!”
Reviews.Author: AnnMYoung
Reviews.Content: You won't have anything to complain about. All staff members (especially Stacey, Troy, Bryan) are exceptionally well-trained. We felt pampered, special and wouldn't choose any other hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families too.”
Reviews.Author: walkaboutnyc
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews written here are spot on - though I wanted to add that the Loden is a great place to stay for families too. We stayed at the Loden with our 7 month old daughter as part of a wedding event. They set us up with a beautiful crib (we joked that it was nicer than the one we had at home) - complete with a soft blanket and a toy for our little one. The hotel also provided us with a water kettle to help heat her bottles and food, and pointed us to a nearby drug store when we needed to buy her some medicine. The rooms are also big enough to have the crib in it and some room to move around - which often is not the case elsewhere. Staying in a hotel is never easy with a little one, I find, but this was as seamless as we've ever experienced. The Loden service in general was impeccable - from the front desk (they helped us find a doctor when our daughter got sick), to the valet (always had our car ready quickly), and the restaurant (helped us store some food when it wouldn't fit in our refrigerator). Also had free wifi that was actually fast - didn't think that existed in this day and age. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Loden really got it right”
Reviews.Author: BuckLaFleur
Reviews.Content: After staying in just about every decent hotel in downtown Vancouver, I am relieved that there is now an option that is quiet, small, centrally located, and extremely chic. The room is very well designed and feels much larger than it is. That the bathroom wall rolls back to allow in natural light is a fantastic feature (I was in a standard room - which was just terrific for a one person). The bed was plush and comfortable and my sleep was opulent. I only had breakfasts in the hotel restaurant, but the food was delicious. I actually ordered two breakfasts on both mornings, not because the portions were small but because the food inspired gluttony. Cottage cheese with coconut foam is still a topic of conversation that surfaces. The equipment in the fitness centre is terrific, and the space is gorgeous - light filled with great air circulation. I was disappointed that there was no changeroom, however, and also sad to learn that you had to pay for the fancy sauna. The fitness amenities at the Four Seasons remain the best in Vancouver - as far as I know... The staff at the Loden are a wonderful group. Overall, this is a fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've stayed in a long time. Well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: timosol
Reviews.Content: Loden has really got the best combination of travelers' experiences: great location (close to Stanley park, Robson street, Gastown, Yale town, sea-buses); modern and sleek design; very nice rooms; fantastic service and great restaurant. From the moment we checked in, we felt welcomed and relaxed. I've never written a review for a hotel, but decided to do this for Loden. The staff should be complimented separately - every person on staff was friendly, eager to help and very attentive to us. The staff were genuinely interested in making our experience enjoyable. Concierge Troy was exceptionally helpful in guiding us through our days and recommending places to visit and the ways how to get there. The restaurant server Michael was also trying to think through and suggest things to do (including his favorite restaurant Salt in Gastown, which was very good). The rooms have comfortable beds, floor-to-ceiling windows, new bathrooms with separate bath and shower and Molton Brown soaps (yummy!). We could stay all day in this room. This hotel has hip and young vibe (as compared to some stuffy atmosphere of some older hotels), it's airy and easy-going and we enjoyed it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Cool - style and substance !”
Reviews.Author: Hazelnutter
Reviews.Content: The Loden looks gorgeous and it backs it up with the quality of service. We were lucky to have a room on the 10th floor so good views down to the water. The room (a signature king) was large and furnished nicely. We liked dining at the hotel's restaurant for breakfast. The staff was excellent and the location great. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for two”
Reviews.Author: Huning
Reviews.Content: Valet parking upon arrival ($32/night). Room is trendy and high-tech -- floor to ceiling window, "openable" bathroom with separated bath and shower, 42" LCD TV with connection to your laptop or ipod, comfortable king bed, bathrobe, slippers, umbrella provided. Fully-loaded fridge with snacks and drinks ($4/can pop though) and many others. Located 3 blocks away from Robson and Pacific Centre/Holt Renfrew with free ride from the hotel. Free wireless internet. Friendly staff. Recommended for young couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Nice Touches, but Noisy on Weekends”
Reviews.Author: WashDCMan
Reviews.Content: Loden is a small boutique hotel in Coal Harbour, at the north end of downtown Vancouver. The vibe here is luxury and hipness. They get a lot of things right and some things more than right, but their uber-hipness may prove a Pyrrhic victory for them if they don't make some simple changes. First, the good. The staff were without exception friendly and informative--and more importantly, sincere. There was no practiced obsequiousness--simply a muted yet earnest wish to be of help and a local's knowledge of the city. We enjoyed chatting with them. One great service the hotel offers is complimentary use of its London taxi within a few blocks or so of the hotel. (We went as far as Yaletown.) It's customary to tip the driver a few loonies, of course. It was lots of fun and a very charming feature. Be advised that the return trip is not part of the service. (I never asked outright, but they never mentioned it when I asked about regular city taxis' availability for the return trip.) You're expected to give them a little notice, naturally. The modern-yet-subtle rooms were reasonably spacious and quite luxurious, featuring: a marble foyer with a little loveseat nook; a marble bath with separate, glass-enclosed toilet; a desk with all manner of a/v linkages conveniently arrayed in a mini-dashboard on the desk; a large HDTV; two very soft robes; etc. The bed was great. I could not figure out the alarm clock, but it sure looked fancy. There is free wired Internet in the rooms, with the option to purchase high-speed access for $10/day. The free version was actually not that slow. I didn't stream a movie or anything, but it was only marginally slower than our home cable Internet. All in all, sleek, gorgeous, tasteful and luxurious. However... Now for the criticisms: One problem was the a/c. The thermostat was very responsive, yet when the a/c came on or went off, we heard a loud noise in the vent. In addition, the air from this vent was either very warm or very cold, and even the softest fan setting was very powerful. We never could find a setting where it would come on automatically and softly. Since we were there in May, we just turned the thing off and were fine. So that wasn't much of a problem. There was, alas, no coffee maker in the room. I've seen this trend in other boutique hotels, and I must say I don't care for it. There is no luxury in having to get dressed and go downstairs for coffee, nor in having to order room service and spend maybe $10 (?) for something that should be free in a hotel. That said, the free coffee in the lobby was from an espresso machine and quite tasty. I would've liked to have slurped joe while watching the news or checking e-mail, though. There was nothing to do in the lobby but listen to Deep Forest or whatever it was they were piping in. Housekeeping did a great job getting the room spotless, but they didn't leave any extra toilet paper in the bathroom. Probably not their fault; I think this must be in keeping with the hip luxury motif. But I just feel better knowing there's no way I'm going to run out before the next time the maid comes. Management, if you think spare rolls look gauche, then why not put them in a bathroom drawer? But those are quibbles. The only real problem came on our last night there. The restaurant/bar adjoining the lobby, two floors down, was playing loud, Enigma-esque club music very late (the same Eurobeat stuff playing in the lobby at all times). We decided we'd just ignore it and go to sleep. But it was annoying. Even worse, however, was that late that night, guests of said bar were hollering in the street outside the hotel. Of course, the hotel can't control guests' behavior per se--but a sign reminding bar patrons to be considerate of the sleeping hotel guests would be in order. Or perhaps the hotel should consider shutting the bar down at 11 pm--less bar profit, but if this keeps up, the hotel's lodging profit will surely decline. Maybe if the bar played some less-hip music at half the volume, they wouldn't attract 20-somethings looking to get rowdy. It is for this reason alone that I almost gave Loden three stars. Most things about Loden rate five stars--but the ability to sleep through the night uninterrupted has to be there. That night, I felt like Loden cared more about its bargoers than us. Still, Loden is not really average in any way. So I rounded up. A word on parking: Parking in the hotel (valet only) is $32 Canadian and is on a 24-hour basis from the time you dropped it off and includes in/out access. A bit steep. And very few garages in Vancouver do overnight parking; the only one I found charged $25. However, parking meters on Vancouver's streets are free 8:00 p.m-8:00 a.m.., as long as there is no restriction on any of the street signs. (Look carefully!) Our second night there, we parked on nearby Alberini street overnight and were fine there. So if you drive into the city, try to arrive just before 8 p.m. Overall, Loden Vancouver has the potential to be an exceptional hotel. It's more than halfway there. We got a decent deal because it had just opened. I'm sure the rate will rise, but hopefully the problems I mentioned will also be remedied. TIP: It's best to avoid driving into Vancouver if you can--public transit there is ubiquitous and safe--but we found renting a car was the only viable option for us to get there from Seattle. There's a ferry, but the schedule is limited until late in May.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Bazza13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Loden after a bit of trip advisor research for our 25th anniversary get away. I have stayed at many of the mainstream Vancouver hotels but thought I would take a gamble on the Loden for something different. It turned out to be a great decision. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating, and went out of their way to acknowledge our 25th anniversary. Our room (1105) was spotless and appointed very well in a modern boutique theme. We both loved the décor and the quiet of this hotel. We did not get a chance to take in the restaurant but were able to visit the hotel lounge, and the service was fabulous. The hotel is located in the most beautiful area of one of the worlds most beautiful & clean cities. It is located on a somewhat quiet street within a 2 block walk to Robson Street and the waterfront, where your selection of restaurants and entertainment is almost endless. Vancouver is a very safe & pedestrian friendly city, so this location is ideal for those who like to explore things on foot. You will not require a vehicle to explore Vancouver’s nightlife from the Loden. The only complaint I had with this hotel was the $31.00/night Valet service. There is a parking garage right next door, so I have no one to blame but myself for this rather pricey service. (I was warned). While the Hotel is not for those travelling on a tight budget, we would highly recommend the Loden for those who are seeking upscale accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful City & Small Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrelax
Reviews.Content: Loden is small in comparison to other full service hotels in the area. There are 77 rooms. It seems quite new, is very nicely decorated, and has a very attentive staff. My husband has Parkinsons and the staff went out of their way to make sure our room suited his needs. The hotel has many, many new technology features that take a bit of getting used to and finding. Definitely have a bellman take you to the room so he/she can explain the amenities. The hotel is in very easy walking distance from Stanley Park. Good restaurants are all over the place. I'm glad we finally ate at Voya, the restaurant in the hotel. Wasn't going to at first since the room service meals weren't wonderful and they come from Voya. Don't miss eating at Voya. Excellent food! Hopefully room service meals will improve in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “First-class accomodations in downtown vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SAN_tripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Comfortable room. Superb service. Great location. Nice bar. Friendly, helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “loved the loden”
Reviews.Author: paultraveler11
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the loden in march over a long weekend and loved it. great location, close to shopping on robson and stanley park, the hotel blends into that area of downtown which is more quiet and has less traffic, which added to the feeling of being relaxed. not that the hotel dosen't do a good job of that by itself. it's beautiful inside, dimly lit and chic. the bed is big,warm,and comfy, the marble bathroom is heavenly, especially the tub, WOW! the service is attentive and friendly, amazing gym, great tv with my name on it, nice touch my only complaint is the food was overpriced and not much to it. Overall, i was very pleased and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Shangri-La! 1/3 the price.”
Reviews.Author: uberator
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at each the Loden and the Shangri La Vancouver twice recently. I live in Whistler, but commute to Vancouver for meetings and always trying to make being away from home comfortable by lavishing at a 5 Star Hotel. The Loden delivers everything the Shangri La Vancouver doesn't and I consider it Vancouver Best Bet Hotel. All the other reviewers are dead on, upon arrival you greeted by a friendly valet who walks you to the Front Desk where you are offered a glass of juice to quench your thirst from your travels. Check-in is brisk and pleasant and you are asked about your journey in a sincere manner. You are then walked to the elevator and shown how to work the key card security. My room was more than I expected, very stylish, comfortable and luxurious. A open concept room that is really spacious. The bathroom is very spa like with a soaker bath tub taking center, flanked to the left by individually frosted glass enclosed toilet and a large stone shower. To the right is a long granite vanity bar fully stocked with Molton Brown products. I fell in love with Molton Brown during by BA Travels as it was standard issue in the First and Business Class Amenity Kits. All the lights in the bathroom are dimming and the bathtub comes with a large serving of bath salts for those that want to melt away while listening to the in Bathroom Sound System fed by the entertainment center. There is a large HD LCD with tons on easy input hook-up if you wanted to watch your own material from your laptop; otherwise the On Demand Programming offer still in Theater Movies, HD Movies and a ton of free cable channels. The LCD TV is big and you will not be left wanting. The rivals my Duxiana and the linens crisp and ultra comfortable. Any requests from Guest Services are promptly attended to. I asked for a Tooth Brush and Tooth Paste and was surprised when it arrived nicely packaged in a Molton Brown Box. The lobby / lounge is very comfortable, a great place to gather and reminiscent of a W or the Opus Yaletown. The restaurant has great food and really friendly staff who make an effort to engage you; this is especially welcomed when traveling alone on business, as dining alone can get tiring. The location is very central, 2 block to the Robson Shopping Stroll or 2 blocks to the Sea Wall and parks. A lot of restaurants near by and a complimentary car service to bring you any where you want downtown. Oh.. the High Speed internet is FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Loden!”
Reviews.Author: krivard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Loden Vancouver for our overnight trip to Vancouver. I had checked trip advisor prior to booking, and was pleasantly surprised to find such a great rate for the #1 ranked Vancouver hotel. We had a wonderful stay. The decor of the room was very warm and inviting, nothing tacky. We loved, loved loved the bathroom! the soaker tub was amazing. The marble floors were beautiful. The bed was incredibly comfortable and we had a nice view from the 11th floor. Also, the room was meticulously clean. The staff was extremely helpful. They were always suggesting restaurants and activities, transportation and offering to make reservations for us. We definitely felt pampered. The only two things we didn't like (and they were small): - there was no coffee maker in the room. You need to get dressed and go downstairs to get a cup. Of course this isn't a big deal but a slight inconvenience in the morning. -the in-room movies are $16 (a little steep) We really, really, enjoyed our stay however. It's a wonderful hotel with a wonderful staff in a great location. I just wanted to share our likes and dislikes! wonderful stay! kudos! we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel !”
Reviews.Author: mykidsmomCleveland
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the most beautiful, clean, and comfortable hotels I have ever stayed in. And I feel that I travel for pleasure, quite a lot. The hotel is only 6 months old. It is small, about 77 rooms I believe. It is decorated beautifully, very modern. My room had floor to ceiling windows, that looked over the city and part of the bay. The decorating in the room was modern, soothing, and very stylish. The gourgeous marble bath room with a deep, soaking tub and separate shower stall with Molton Brown tolietries was literally 'to die for' ! Plush towels, terry robes, clothes steamer, flat screen TV - I almost didn't want to leave the room ! The staff at the desk greeted us by name, always asked us if we needed directions, went out of their way to recommend restaurants, places to visit, etc. They offered us a ride in a converted British taxi, with the hotel name on it in case we didn't have transportation available. I really can't say enough about this hotel - I would recommend it completely without reservation - It has to be one of the most beautiful, friendly, accomodating hotels I have ever stayed. I would rate it 5 stars in every category !!!

Reviews.Title: “Comparable to the W”
Reviews.Author: Lisa20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loden for 2 nights and it was wonderful. The bellman (Ethan) who brought our bags up to the room took the time to explain the electronics of our room to us (totally wired rooms - great for technology lovers!) and the hotel amenities. He was very helpful. The rooms are furnished very nicely, the beds are great and I love the sliding door of the bathroom (it opens the sink & tub portion out to the room). The ambience of the hotel was very nice. The restaurant had fantastic food as well.

Reviews.Title: “The first hotel that made me want to move back home to Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: MalibuStace
Reviews.Content: I have been working in the hotel industry for 17 years. I left Vancouver almost 10 years ago, and have been working in Mexico, the Caribbean and Central America ever since. Each time I return to Vancouver I am reminded of the family, friends and beautiful city that I so love and miss. However this trip, walking into the lobby of the Loden, I felt like I wanted to come back home. I love this hotel so much, I think I might send them my resume and put up with the Vancouver rain to work there. Great staff, warm cozy lobby, great service, good food, only wish I could have stayed longer. I had no idea they were number #1 on TripAdvisor until I just signed on to write my review, I think it is well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmara
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked a lovely room on the 9th floor for our valentines weekend in Vancouver. The website makes it look nice, but I don't think they really do it justice. Our room was on the corner and had a great urban view of the surrounding towers. The decor was modern, refined, and luxurious. The bathroom was especially nice, and very romantic. And the hotel's staff was friendly and welcoming. The location is nice, a quiet and safe area within walking distance to hipper shopping and nightlife, or business districts with ample parking on and off street.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On Service”
Reviews.Author: Kubird
Reviews.Content: What a treat!!! Booked the Loden on hotels.com for an overnight trip to BC. We went to celebrate a birthday. Everything about this hotel is terrific. The staff is warm and welcoming, the rooms are beautiful and super clean. They even sent a neat little plate of chocolates to the room for the birthday girl. They drove us to our evening dinner spot and gave us a great reccomendation for breakfast..........which they also drove us to. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Style Property”
Reviews.Author: Noodles28
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in Vancouver. It is only a few blocks from Robson street and is nicely tucked away on a great little side street. The rooms are absolutely inspiring. I will never stay anywhere else. The staff are very accomodating and everything is top notch. Floor to ceiling windows, great restaurant downstairs (secret spot for celebrity watching). The Loden is sure to exceed your expectations

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel... Very modern and well designed rooms”
Reviews.Author: littlesmitty45
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the loden as I had heard it was run by the same person who ran the Opus before it tripled in price. It looked great and very modern which is always a plus when your travelling for work. It was odd as two days after I booked the hotel there was a story in the travel section in the ottawa citizen about the hotel. Now on to the actual experience. When I got to the hotel they were very quick with checking me in and took me up to the room to show me all the features. It was great to have someone show you rather then figuring out some of the nice touches of the room on my own. Now onto the room itself The room is very modern looking with a nice big LCD tv and a nice view. The bed was comfy and made me never want to actually get out of it. I liked the slippers they included to walk around in but they kept leaving them on the opposite side from where I slept. By far the nicest part of this room though is the fact that the wall between the washroom and the main room can be moved. You can move it so you get a much more open feel which is something I have never had before in a hotel. They also had a speaker for the tv in the washroom which I have had before but is a nice touch. The shower and the tub were amazing as I have come to expect at these modern hotels. Another nice feature was being able to put the do not disturb notice on with a button rather then a really ugly sign. I always think it looks terrible when you are paying 400 a night for a hotel room and you have to stick a sign on your door know. Well at this hotel they have an electronic version and a door bell on the outside rather then just having to knock. Now about the area this hotel is in. This hotel is about 4 blocks from cole harbour which is beautiful and I spent a lot of free time sitting down there working on my laptop. Also your close enough to be able to walk to robson street and shop but far enough away that it is quiet at night. The only two problems I had were the super long time it took to get my car from the valet parking. I came down and there were no one else in the lobby waiting for their car and even though I had called down to get my car I ended up waiting almost 20 mins for my car which is crazy for a high end hotel but still a minor problem. The only other problem was not being upgraded to a better room even though their policy is if you find a better price then on their website you get that. Well I was told there were no rooms available after the fact even though their seem to be very few people in the hotel and even heard staff say that.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kels246
Reviews.Content: When we booked the Loden, we thought it looked too good to be true, but the experience far exceeded our expectations. An intimate, friendly boutique hotel with great amenities. The staff always greeted us by name and seemed to anticipate our every need. Lots of great little touches, like calling up to our room shortly after check-in to make sure everything was okay, to sending us a towncar for a trip to the spa. They were friendly but not intrusive. Decor was modern, yet warm, and the room, while certainly not large, used every bit of space perfectly. Storage space galore, and the sliding panel to open the bathroom to the main area was genius. Our only complaint about the room was the bathroom sink, which was designed to maximize splashing. A minor gripe, though. Nice little touches abounded: an electronic privacy/maid service button, the inclusion of a clothes steamer, top notch glasses, great towels, television speaker in the bathroom, and full AV hookups for computers and peripherals. We almost didn't want to leave our room because it was so comfortable and luxurious. To top it all off, our room was less than $150 USD a night--the hotel would have been a steal at twice the price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite In Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: lagunadallas
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of the Loden today and wish I could go right back! I've stayed at the Opus (liked it, didn't love it) and was hoping another more contemporary boutique hotel would open in Vancouver. This is it. We were greeted by a very friendly and knowledgeable doorman (Ethan) who took care of everything from the car, luggage, room/hotel overview (he escorted us to the room) and even brought us a printout of current movies with times at a nearby theatre after we expressed interest in seeing a movie. A+ service! Everyone else we encountered was friendly, and in a really sincere and interested sort of way. I've encountered a lot of fake-friendly service, and after arriving here from the incredible and service-oriented Four Seasons in Whistler, the Loden was right on par (or better). I loved the room. It wasn't large, but the finish-out was fantastic --- particularly the bathroom. A sliding wood door opens the bathroom into the bedroom area, but is easily closed off for complete privacy. The shower and water closet are hidden behind frosted, frameless glass doors. A separate deep soaking tub is surrounded by tumbled marble mosaic tile. There is even a speaker in the bathroom that brings the TV or iPod hook-up audio into the bathroom! The bed and linens were extremely comfortable, and wireless internet access was free. Great gym area with a lot of natural light and good machines. We didn't have dinner at the hotel restaurant --- the chic "Italian Kitchen" a few blocks away was fabulous --- but we had an after-dinner drink at the bar. Once again, service was flawless, the crowd was a nice mix, and the atmosphere sleek and fun. I was able to book the Loden at the $195 introductory rate, but I would unlikely consider staying anywhere else the next time I'm in Vancouver and wouldn't hesitate to pay double that rate. I've enjoyed my stay at a couple other Kor properties, and I will gladly spread the word about this fantastic find!

Reviews.Title: “Great high tech hotel”
Reviews.Author: alisononthego
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Loden last weekend for a quick trip to Vancouver. The outside is unpretentious, but opens up to a welcoming lobby and staff. Everything about the Loden is first rate. The modern high tech features make it special from other luxury hotels. The key card gives you secure access to the elevator by pressing it against a screen and the same card rubbed on the door lock opens the door. Rooms are equiped with wireless internet hook up (or wired) and they would loan a computer if you needed it. Ipod docking in the radio was a nice touch. Suites were equipped with Wii systems! The room also had bathrobes, slippers, steamer and umbella for guest use. The bathroom was luxurious with a deep soaking tub as well as a stall shower . The room was fairly small, but comfortable with great bedding. The location is very central, close to shopping and restaurants, but with free car service (in a converted London cab) within the downtown area. I would stay here again without hesitation, but would probably eat at another restaurant for breakfast. There was free coffee (expresso machine) and tea in the morning in the lobby. The restaurant was attractive with attentive wait staff. The menu was unique (which is hard to find for breakfast), but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the new Loden!”
Reviews.Author: none17
Reviews.Content: We were among the first to stay at this brand new property near Robson Street. We were uncertain whether the newness would mean things were unfinished, but despite the fact that there didn't seem to be many guests yet, the hotel was fully operational and everything went smoothly during our stay. The rooms are on the small side but they are very well planned so they still feel spacious and there are lots of little thoughtful touches such as a built-in bench with drawers in the entryway, and a cool button system that indicates "do not disturb" without the cheesy door hanger. The finishes and upgraded bathroom make the room feel more luxurious than the size would otherwise warrant. There are nice touches such as turn-down service, free internet and a car service that took us to and picked us up from our dinner on the Saturday night. There is a busy restaurant/lounge in the lobby (we didn't try it out) but it didn't create noise or nuisance to the rooms. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that I think it's a little over-priced at its full rate of $350 (we got an introductory rate of $250 so felt pretty happy about the value). We splurged for the upgrade to the "park view" which I don't think was really worth it; there are enough buildings around (and construction underway) that there isn't much of a view to the north shore. Nonetheless, the Loden is well-located, nicely appointed and offers great service. Only time will tell how successful it will be, but I would definitely recommend it!

HotelInfo.Name: The Loden Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1177 Melville Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6E 0A3, Canada
